Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About AccountableAccountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.




About the role




As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.


Tasks


Key Responsibilities
Revenue Growth & Experimentation (80%)





Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.


Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.


Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.


Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.


Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.


Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.





Performance Marketing Support (20%)





Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.


Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.


Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.


Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.





A quick word about data infrastructure




At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:





Our own database & its analytical datalake


Amplitude (user in-app events & visualization)


Intercom (CRM)


BigQuery (ETL engine)


Gsheet & Looker (visualization)





It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.




We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure.


Requirements


Who you are





Data-driven problem solver





Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.





Growth & experimentation mindset





You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.





Business & product sense





You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.





Technical skills





Proficiently in basic programming (Python)





Proactive & collaborative





You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.





Bonus: marketing analytics experience





You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.




Requirements





Based in Berlin


Fluent in German


A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred


Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics



Benefits


Why join Accountable?




üåç Work at a fast-growing fintech that‚Äôs making self-employment easier.




ü•ä Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.




üéØ Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.




üí°You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.




ü§ù Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Title: Data Analyst (Payment, Fintech)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (Payment) to join the Fintech team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of building the financial backbone of Delivery Hero. You‚Äôll develop products that empower millions of customers and merchants, from seamless payments to innovative financial solutions like wallets and credit. Your work will support our path to profitability by creating financial flexibility for users and enabling smooth transactions across 70+ countries.

In this role you will:


Partner closely with Fintech Business and Product stakeholders to understand their analytical needs, and execute the roadmap for analytics work for Payment Analytics
Develop and optimize monitoring tools, perform deep-dive analysis and provide insights to facilitate a data-driven decision making
Exploit and analyze high volumes of data in order to quantify and answer questions to improve the business performance. Monitor KPIs, identify user behavior patterns and actively take actions to improve online payment performance across multiple regions
Demonstrate proficiency in coding practices and analytic approaches
Be able to answer the 'What?' question effectively and within reasonable deadlines, but also think about the 'So What?' and 'Now What' portions of the analysis
Proactively bring new ideas and suggestions to the team and our internal clients to improve our Fintech set up


What you need to be successful


You have worked as a data analyst and delivered measurable impact on improving understanding of payments
You have proven experience with daily practice of SQL, and visualization tools such as Tableau, and Looker
You have experience working with online payments and deep knowledge of the PSP, issuer, acquirer, and card scheme data.
You are eager on making business impact through analytics and you understand the product lifecycle
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills
You demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills


Nice To Have:


Experience with BigQuery, Airflow, and Python
Understanding of real-time data analytics
Good understanding of mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.




Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Processing Specialist
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Are you detail-oriented and have great communication skills? Do you love working in a cross-functional environment and solving problems?

Our Merchant Services team lies at the heart of Wolt, ensuring that we set all of our merchants up for success by providing a seamless onboarding, menu, and catalog experience. As Wolt continues to grow in both scale and scope of offerings, the strength of our content management and catalog operations must expand with it.

We are looking for a Data Processing Specialist for Content & Catalog team

who will oversee the day-to-day operations of a small but dynamic team of menu and catalog specialists. You‚Äôll ensure that product information on Wolt‚Äôs platform adheres to the highest standards of accuracy and compliance. As a leader, you‚Äôll work cross-functionally to improve processes, drive compliance, and ensure our menus and catalogs are engaging and up to date.

You‚Äôre Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will‚Ä¶


Ensure that Wolt retail (grocery) and restaurant offering offering is compliant and accurate
Manage the content and quality of Wolt Germany‚Äôs product catalog for both Retail and Restaurants. Offerings are drafted quickly, in bulk and correctly
Oversee rapid and accurate creation of the retail assortments.
Create, refine and improve bulk data processing automations.
Review and approve changes made to retail assortments and restaurant menus to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Compliance & Onboarding.


What We Offer


Cool office in the heart of Berlin
Independent work in a dynamic, international team
A fast-growing tech company with many career opportunities
Attractive salary package
Discounts on Wolt orders
Various soft drinks, coffee, and fruits in the office
Weekly (virtual) all-hands meetings and regular team events
Flexible working hours policy + 30 days of paid vacation


Qualifications


Fluent in German (spoken and written) and English - any other language is a plus.
You have a positive attitude and an entrepreneurial spirit
You are a problem-solver - you enjoy diagnosing issues and developing creative approaches to solve challenges
You have a strong technical skill - you have some Python / Javascript experience, good command of excel, and experience working with large data sets. SQL and Browser automations are a plus. Graduates welcome!
You are customer-centric - you have a customer-first mentality, are effective at working with people with varying degrees of technical ability
You are comfortable working in fast-paced and demanding environments
Understanding of LMIV (Lebensmittel-Informationsverordnung): Strong knowledge of food labeling laws and regulations in Germany, particularly for grocery items.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Title: Internship Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We're looking for a motivated Data Analyst Intern to join our Machine Learning team and support various data-driven initiatives. You‚Äôll work with large datasets, improve data quality, and help build dashboards and reports to support business decisions. This is a hands-on opportunity to gain experience with cloud technologies and BI tools in a fast-paced startup environment.




Start: ASAP | Location: Remote/hybrid possible




For at least 6 months.


Tasks


Your Responsibilities:





Design Looker Studio dashboards tailored to business needs


Collaborate with Data Engineers: create tickets, track progress, validate outputs


Perform quality checks on existing data pipelines


Implement a data warehouse layer using predefined schema and basic ETL processes


Import and transform data in Looker Studio and support teams with dashboard setup


Support data cleanup efforts to ensure accuracy and consistency


Assist departments like Customer Success, Finance, Product, and Marketing with analytics



Requirements



Basic experience with GCP or other cloud platforms


Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating data


Basic understanding of Python


Experience with data visualization and analytics


Strong analytical thinking and good communication skills





Nice to Have:





Experience with data quality checks and pipeline validation


Knowledge of Looker Studio, BigQuery, ETL, or data warehousing


Understanding of customer and financial analytics



Benefits


Join Airteam!




Work with a fun, international team in a cool co-working space in the heart of Berlin. We offer flexible hours, hybrid work, and even workations. You‚Äôll have the freedom to share your ideas and make an impact. Plus, we love team events and always support your well-being.




Apply now and become part of our team!

Title: Social Insight Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks


Translate social media conversations and digital trends into clear, actionable insights for key stakeholders across the company
Monitor, analyze, and interpret social media and listening data using platforms like Netbase Quid or similar tools; turn findings into compelling reports and dashboards
Identify emerging trends, audience behaviors, and content patterns to support campaign development and innovation
Collaborate closely with marketing, PR, and sales teams to deliver timely and relevant social insights for both ongoing and upcoming initiatives
Contribute to pitches and client presentations with clear, data-driven storytelling
Continuously evaluate and test new social listening and analytics tools to enhance our insight capabilities
Stay on top of developments in the creator economy and influencer marketing landscape to help shape internal strategies


Your Profile


University degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business Administration, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in market research, data analysis, and social media marketing
Proven analytical skills with hands-on experience in data visualization and interpretation using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R, or a strong willingness to deepen technical skills in this area
Advanced proficiency in social media tracking and listening tools such as Meltwater, Netbase Quid, or comparable platforms
Solid understanding of Generative AI tools and their application in analytics and content strategy
In-depth knowledge of the creator economy and a strong grasp of current social media trends and platform dynamics
Full professional fluency in both German and English, spoken and written
High level of adaptability and drive, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, agile work environment


About Us

We Are Era is the first pan-European studio and talent agency with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Cologne, Copenhagen, Paris, Milan and Stockholm. Our vision? Shaping the zeitgeist in an era of movements - and with success: our productions and campaigns for broadcasters, brands and NGOs have won multiple awards. We create stories with impact and attitude, developed and told by and for people all over Europe. Our projects range from TV productions and fictional series to innovative formats on social video platforms such as YouTube, Instagram, Twitch and TikTok. We develop social influencers and artists into cross-platform personality brands that are now found on social media, on TV, in podcasts, on the big screen or in the music charts. Our international team of 250 speaks all languages - from mainstream to subculture, from the Friday For Future movement to K-pop culture. Together, we offer our partners the fast-lane ticket to every community in Europe. Are you ready to shape the zeitgeist with us? Join the Movement!

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Data Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.




Your impact

Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.




Who you are

A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).




Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!




What makes us special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‚Äòve created a range of perks for our employees:

A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.




Who we are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.




Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.

Title: Working Student - Data Analytics (m/f/d)
Description:
1KOMMA5¬∞

We are looking for you to join our Business Intelligence team to push 1KOMMA5¬∞ towards becoming a truly data-driven organization. 1KOMMA5¬∞ is building Germany's largest one-stop-shop for the sale, installation and services related to solar, heat pumps, electricity and charging infrastructure. And they are all connected!

Become a part of our mission and learn more about our Product & Tech team!

Your mission

As a data analytics working student at 1KOMMA5¬∞, you support our teams along the Virtual Assembly Line by delivering data and reporting solutions that enable informed decision-making. You will play a key role in transforming and preparing data, ensuring it is accessible and actionable for stakeholders. In addition to the technical aspects, you will collaborate closely with stakeholders to analyze data, derive insights, and support strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To


Building end-to-end data pipelines to ensure overall data availability
Independently developing dashboards, and reports in Looker
Performing ad hoc analyses and gathering stakeholder requests to generate actionable insights
Supporting the development of the Virtual Assembly Line, a strategic instrument for real-time monitoring across our whole value chain


Your profile


You are enrolled at a university and contribute 20 hours per week
You are studying Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, or a comparable STEM course of studies
You have experience working with SQL, Python, and ideally Git, as well as handling large datasets, including ingestion, in-warehouse transformations, and data modeling
You have prior experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
You are an effective communicator, looking forward to much interaction with team members and stakeholders
You bring a proactive attitude and don't forget to have fun at work
You have very good written and spoken German and English skills


Benefits


You are part of an international, dynamic, and highly motivated team of people who have proven to make things happen
With your work, you accelerate the "energy transition" and hence have a direct impact on our climate
Work with and learn from other super-smart colleagues
You will enjoy direct contact with core decision-makers
You will enjoy the best chances of entering full-time in one of Europe‚Äôs most thriving scaleups
You work remotely (Germany-wide), with offices in Hamburg, Berlin or Munich
Create a healthy balance alongside your work and enjoy all the benefits of the EGYM Wellpass


About Us

"At 1KOMMA5¬∞, our vision is to accelerate CO2 neutral life for all! We created an easy one-stop-shop to buy and install solar, charging stations and heat pumps, with the purpose of liberating all European homes from the shackles of fossil fuels. With Heartbeat, we make clean energy smarter. Connecting our customers into one powerful clean energy operating system to enable flexible tariffs and to ultimately follow the rhythm of wind and sun!" - Philipp Schr√∂der (CEO 1KOMMA5¬∞)

Title: Data Management Officer (m/f/d)
Description:
Lloyds Bank GmbH and its brands Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Bank have won over 1 million satisfied customers in recent years. And this thanks to convincing products and, above all, our committed colleagues who want to achieve the best for our customers every day with new ideas, challenges and joy. In order to continue writing our success story, we are looking for the right reinforcement for our teams, because all our ambitious goals would be unattainable without teamwork. We also welcome career changers.

For our office in Berlin Mitte we are looking for a

Data Management Officer (m/f/d)

The Data Management Team is part of the wider Data team, tasked with implementing new data management capabilities as well as overseeing and consulting active data management activities. Our mission is to assist the Bank in achieving its strategic goals, while actively understanding and managing the challenges and risks that come with being a data-driven organization.

Aufgaben


Building relationships within the team in order to effectively perform the diverse data management/governance tasks and foster cooperation and growth
Connecting with data governance stakeholders, with the goal of effectively managing the processes of data management
Relying on our strong analytical background, combining it with the understanding of how Banks work, as well as solid stakeholder management
Delivering actionable results to the top management, enabling well-informed decisions with a positive impact on the Bank
Interacting successfully with the Group colleagues, Internal and External Audit and Supervisory Authorities
Reporting on the developments in the Bank's data management activities as well as related data risks
Overseeing the process of managing all phases of implementation of new data management capabilities
Staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the field


Profil


Educated to degree level in a relevant subject (Business and information technology related studies)
Several years' of professional experience in in data management/governance positions in retail banking
Solid knowledge of data management/governance frameworks and best practices (ex. DAMA -DMBOK, DCAM)
Programming skills in SQL/Python or similar languages
Experience coaching junior colleagues
Good stakeholder management skills
Highly analytical approach to problem solving
Fluency in English (Dutch and/or German is a plus)


Wir bieten


An international team with colleagues from more than 50 different countries
Social benefits such as a company pension scheme and capital formation contributions
30 days holiday as well as 24 and 31 December as non-working days
Employee Assistance Programme ‚Äì personal 24/7 helpline for all employees
Various possibilities for flexible working, i.a. various part-time models, flexitime
Extensive, very flexible home office arrangements
Possibility to work from other EU countries for up to 30 days per year
Additional benefits such as sports activities, free fruit, nuts and drinks
Employer contributions to BVG job ticket and a Lease a bike programme
An informal corporate culture - without dress code and ‚ÄòSie'.
An excellent learning culture and opportunity to improve your professional competencies
Easily accessible city centre offices, in the vicinity of many shops and restaurants to which you receive a discount


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Als BI Analyst (m/w/d) im Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team bist du ma√ügeblich daf√ºr verantwortlich, datengetriebene Insights f√ºr unsere Marketing-, Service- und Vertriebsaktivit√§ten zu generieren und aufzubereiten. Durch die Aggregation, Analyse und Visualisierung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen tr√§gst du entscheidend zur Optimierung unserer Customer Journey, der Effizienz unserer Marketing- und Lead-Generierungskampagnen, der Call Center Management Prozesse und der strategischen Entscheidungsfindung bei.

Was du bewirkst

  • Entwicklung, Pflege und Optimierung von Dashboards und Reportings in Power BI und Google Sheets zur Visualisierung und √úberwachung von KPIs
  • Automatisierung und Optimierung von Datenprozessen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualit√§t durch den Einsatz von Python, SQL und Databricks
  • Unterst√ºtzung des zentralen sowie globalen Marketings bei der Planung, dem Forecasting und dem unterj√§hrigen Monitoring ihrer Ziel-KPIs
  • Erstellung l√§nderspezifischer Analysen, um Wachstum zu generieren und die Nutzung der digitalen Marketingkan√§le in den einzelnen M√§rkten zu optimieren
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Data Engineering und Data Science Teams innerhalb der Viessmann IT
  • Aufbereitung von Ergebnissen in Form von Pr√§sentationen, Reports und Zusammenfassungen f√ºr relevante Stakeholder

Das bist du

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, BWL, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
  • Mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, CRM oder in einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
  • Sehr gute analytische F√§higkeiten sowie Kenntnisse in Statistik und Data Modeling
  • Fundierte Erfahrung mit Tools wie Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks und idealerweise auch mit Python, SQL oder √§hnlichen Technologien
  • Erfahrung bei der Analyse von CRM, Call Center und/oder Performance Marketing Daten
  • F√§higkeit, komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich und wirkungsvoll aufzubereiten und zu pr√§sentieren
  • Selbstst√§ndige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und Freude an der Arbeit in einem internationalen, cross-funktionalen Team
  • Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (mind. Level C1)

Auch wenn du nicht alle Punkte erf√ºllst, aber bereit f√ºr die Herausforderung bist, dann klicke trotzdem auf "Bewerben". Wir lieben deinen Spirit!

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
About Lemon.markets üçã

Our mission is providing better opportunities to invest in capital markets. By empowering FinTechs and Banks to offer investment products, we help create financial well-being for their customers. In pursuit of this goal, we strive to open 100 million securities accounts within Europe in this decade.

lemon.markets builds infrastructure for financial services and technology companies powering the next generation of investment products. From enabling a Fintech to launch their first investment product, over allowing e.g. a Neobank to embed investing into their product to bringing investing into a completely new context. Our API-first infrastructure makes launching an investment product customer-centric and compliant. We abstract all complexity for our partners through a well documented API, a self-service customer operations portal and operating in a clear regulatory framework. Enabling partners to launch in weeks, not months.

We have experienced first hand that brokerage infrastructure is broken. Building an investment product used to be highly expensive, challenging and cumbersome. We ease this pain by shielding our partners & their customers from the underlying complexity - and with that, we make investing more accessible to everyone. Because that‚Äôs exactly what we enjoy, going to places nobody else dares and solving hard problems. This not only creates tons of value when done right, but attracts the smartest minds - because outlier companies are built by exceptional (& diverse) people like you.

Your Mission:

As a Data Engineer at lemon.markets you will play a key role in designing and maintaining the end to end pipeline of data transmission. You will be the responsible and accountable person for the Data Warehouse ensuring Correctness, Availability, Performance and Security of the data.

You will be part of the Operations Tooling (OT) domain in lemon.markets. The OT domain powered by Retool facilitates all the operational day-to-day work arising from our brokerage platform comprising Customer Lifecycle, Order Lifecycle and Post Trade domains. In a nutshell, Retool is the GUI for data powered by DWH to facilitate Customer, Securities and Cash Operations. Apart from operational work, Retool is also the basis for doing analytics for various activities that our brokerage platform performs. From customer onboarding to order placement and cash and securities settlements.

Our Tech Stack is Python, Airbyte, Redshift, DBT, AWS, Temporal, Retool and Postgres. While you could have worked in different modern tech stacks prior, you should be excited to work with these tools and learn them if you haven‚Äôt worked with them before.

You will have a significant impact on the development and maintenance of our core platform & systems - and thereby architectural decisions, as well as on the business itself. You are the first point of contact for internal functions regarding day-to-day functionality of dashboards and can reliably solve issues in a professional manner.

Work alongside a cross-functional team of experts, and together we will leverage your previous experiences to build the investment infrastructure for the next 100 million retail investors in Europe.

About you:


You have the ability to write well-structured and tested code in more than one high-level programming languages like Python, Scala or Java, plus another language such as Javascript.
You have knowledge of data warehouse architectures (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
You have a track record of designing, building and operating reliable and scalable ETL pipelines.
You‚Äôve gained good experience with software in a cloud environment (AWS, GCP, Azure) and the architectural patterns for this environment.
You have a good understanding of more than one document-based or relational database technology such as MySQL/PostgreSQL or MongoDB
You know how to write high-quality code that is understandable, maintainable and well tested, and can guide other engineers to do the same via code reviews.
You should be able to write high quality documentation catering to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You have good problem-solving skills and the ability to provide in-depth evaluations and analyses of unique and complex technological issues.


You will be successful in this role if:


Growing investment opportunities excites you. We operate in a highly regulated environment and therefore having worked prior in a Fintech or financial Service provider would give you a head start, but is not a must.
You see yourself as a product engineer. That means, you are excited by solving customer problems and strive to become an expert in the domain area you are working in.
You enjoy building from scratch. This means high involvement in the product development process itself while advocating for the best engineering practices. It also means that you enjoy taking technical decisions.
You are ready and willing to take ownership of problems and act on them decisively with no supervision. You always thrive for high quality outcomes through focus, determination and attention to detail.
You are a team player. Working together as a team, sharing knowledge & providing mentorship comes naturally to you. Long term - you consider becoming a team lead.
You have no problem with learning new technologies on the go. You try to solve problems with more things than the ones you already know. We will always enable you with that, but your willingness has to come first.
You understand what working in a startup or a similar lean organisation is like. You are able to work with a small team in a lean environment, can move quickly and focus on what's truly important.


We're looking for people with passion, desire to learn and that are team players. You're encouraged to apply, even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out‚Äîand set you apart‚Äîespecially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns.

How we take care of you:

üöÄCompetitive compensation package:

We will offer you a mix of cash and stock options based on your appetite for upside.

üíéMake a real impact:

Shape the experience for our customers and us alike. Decide on tools, processes and the architecture design of our Platform & API, while building, learning and growing together.

üïëFlexible working hours:

We value focus time. Encouraging everyone to minimise fixed meetings and leverage asynchronous communication.

üíªBuild your perfect setup:

Mac/Linux, Mechanical Keyboard, Screen. These are not expenses but investments. Please tell us what is needed to make you productive, and we will take care of it.

üè¢ Hybrid work:

We all believe that in-person collaboration is an integral part of working together, but we offer flexibility to work from home across Europe. That means, lemoneers work 4 days or more per month on-site, spending quality time together with the team at events, offsites or over team dinners.

üìà Grow with us:

We take your personal development seriously, meaning that we make sure to constantly mentor and challenge you so that you can reach your next level and beyond.

üë∂üèΩ Get the flexibility you need:

Whether you have a family or a passion that you want to follow on the side. We want to offer you a setting that fits your current stage in life.

About The Process


Get to know us - Talent - Melissa | 30 minutes
EM Screening - Ashish - EM Operations Tooling | 60 minutes
Take home task + Review - A selection of lemoneers
Meet the team @ lemon.markets HQ | 120 minutes
Deep Dive of Take Home Task - Henrik - Backend Engineer & Alexandru - Frontend Engineer | 60 minutes
Principles Session/Meet the Team - A selection of lemoneers | 60 minutes

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your role will involve developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations, collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and meet their data needs, and conducting advanced statistical analyses. You will ensure data integrity and accuracy, communicate findings effectively, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data division within the engineering department. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to track key metrics.
Own part of our data transformation layer where we apply data modeling techniques (via dbt) to transform raw data into analytics-friendly data assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Develop domain expertise in a set of business domains (e.g. Product, Marketing, Operations or Sales) to become a valuable partner to our business stakeholders
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.




ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Experience in data modeling using DBT
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it‚Äôs for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We‚Äôve banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you‚Äôre always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

  • Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!

  • Fair Remuneration: We‚Äôve banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you‚Äôre always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
  • Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
  • Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
  • Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.

Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) - SAP & Finance
Description:
At Statista, we‚Äôre all about facts and data, for we are the world's leading business data platform. By providing reliable and easy-to-use data as well as various data analytics products and services, we empower people worldwide to make fact-based decisions.

Founded in Hamburg in 2007, we have quickly grown into a global company with offices in major cities such as London, New York, Berlin and Tokyo. And we still have a lot of plans. Our constant growth does not only prove our success, but also keeps creating new development and career opportunities for our employees.

We value and celebrate our diverse culture. You are welcome here for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or whether you prefer bar graphs to pie charts. Your story matters ‚Äì keep writing it as part of our team.

Are you ready to join us?

Tasks


Assume responsibility for the development and refinement of the data models in our Redshift data warehouse.
Help transition our current MS Navision-based financial reporting to a newly designed SAP-based reporting.
Act as a bridge between Finance Controlling, Finance Tech and Data Department. Systematically translate business requirements and questions into precise data queries and insightful data models.
Provide crucial support to our Embedded Analysts and Finance Controlling Team, aiding in their understanding and utilization of the data warehouse.
Engage with stakeholders across the organization driving value from our data.


Requirements


Proven proficiency in SQL and experience working with data warehouses like Redshift.
Hands-on data modeling skills and familiarity with dbt.
Understanding of SAP-data and the SAP-system as well as Finance processes.
Adeptness in translating business needs into data models.
Exceptional communication skills in both spoken and written in English. German is a plus.
Analytical mindset with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with teams and stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


The team

At Statista Tech, our mission is to to harness the possibilities of modern technology to bring Statista‚Äôs data assets to the fingertips of our customers around the globe as conveniently and reliably as possible. Internally, we provide a productive digital workplace environment at Statista globally.

What We Offer

In addition to our great team, culture, and our shared goal of empowering people with data, there are many other things that make Statista a great place to work! Join us and benefit from:


Work from abroad 10 days a year (up to 30 if your family lives abroad)
Hybrid work and flex-time
International team and social events
Career & training opportunities
Attractive locations and modern offices
Mental health support with OpenUp


Some of the benefits listed here apply only to the German entity and to Junior-level roles or above.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Working Student (m/f/d) for IT & Data Operations
Description:
Digitalization and the energy transition in one sentence? Yes, with Green Fusion!




At Green Fusion, we are dedicated to combating climate change through our innovative software that optimizes the control of heating systems in the housing sector. By digitizing and automating control processes, we‚Äôre not only reducing emissions but also minimizing energy consumption ‚Äì actively driving the energy transition.




As a Working Student for IT & Data Operations in our Technical Operations Team, you will support our team in maintaining and improving key internal systems. This is your opportunity to make a real impact while gaining valuable experience in IT and system administration!


Tasks


As a key part of our technical operations team, you make sure our internal and customer-related systems run smoothly:




For our team:





You set up and maintain accounts for our team, like SSO accounts, VPN access, and permissions for Jira, GitHub, and Grafana.


You keep documentation up to date and ensure a structured approach to account management.





For our customers:





In our operations, you independently take on new projects and contribute your own ideas.


You create and update customer accounts and entries of their building portfolio.


You connect new buildings to the Green Fusion Cloud.


You support the operation of energy systems in buildings by running data checks.


You prepare issue reports for troubleshooting and use our data quality tools (or develop your own).



Requirements


‚úÖ Must-haves:





IT knowledge and a structured approach to working


Database (DB) knowledge


Basic programming skills


Strong written and spoken English


Currently enrolled in a MINT-related field of study


Strong interest in engineering and informatics





üöÄ Nice-to-haves:





Experience with data acquisition through hardware and/or interfaces


Familiarity with programming environments (e.g., Git)


SQL/database management experience


German language proficiency at B2 level or higher



Benefits


üíº Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.




üè† Flexible working models, home office, and up to 2 months of remote work possible.




üí° Guaranteed opportunities for further education ‚Äì whether through challenges on the job, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs ‚Äì the opportunity to learn is everywhere.




üå± Direct impact through your job ‚Äì with us, you can actively drive the energy transition and contribute every day to the fight against climate change.




üíö We value our team ‚Äì that's why regular team events are very important to us.




üôå The best team Berlin has to offer ‚Äì maybe even beyond! You don‚Äôt believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!




You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment driven by passion and ambition to actively shape the energy transition ‚Äì a goal we can only achieve together!




We look forward to your application ‚Äì Fernanda will be in touch with you!

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry, based in Berlin and Chicago. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing accurate sizing and fit recommendations, ultimately reducing returns and enhancing customer satisfaction.




As a trusted partner for e-commerce platforms and retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to revolutionizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.







Role Overview:




Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.




As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.




Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.







Key Responsibilities:




Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.




Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.




Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.




Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.







Requirements and Qualifications:




7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.




Expert proficient in SQL and python.




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.




Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.




Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.




Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.




Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.




Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Die Polizei Berlin - das Landeskriminalamt - LKA 8 - sucht zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt, unbefristet, eine/einen

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.

Your impact


Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.


Who You Are


A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level C1).


Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!

What Makes Us Special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‚Äòve created a range of perks for our employees:


A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.


Who We Are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.

Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.
Show more

Title: Student AI Engineer - Finetuning LLMs (20 hours/week)
Description:
The Role:
This position is ideal for ambitious individuals with a solid AI background who are eager to gain hands-on experience in fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs). You will work closely with an experienced Senior AI Engineer, leverage cutting-edge technologies, and grow within an innovative startup environment. For candidates nearing graduation, there is also the opportunity to transition into a full-time role.




About Us:
Zapdeck is revolutionizing the way presentations are created. With our AI-powered software, users can generate professionally designed slides in just minutes. Our innovative AI technology transforms text directly into visually compelling slide designs, supported by an intuitive editor that simplifies storyline development and layout design.We operate in a multi-billion-dollar market that is being redefined by Generative AI. Backed by a pre-seed investment, we are building partnerships with leading companies and working on a multi-modal, agent-based system that utilizes the latest AI models.


Tasks



Support the development of AI agents


Execute fine-tuning processes for LLMs using an existing server setup and prepared datasets


Systematically test and optimize open-source models and their hyperparameters


Implement and improve Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems


Contribute to the development of multi-modal model approaches (text + image)


Apply modern quantization and fine-tuning techniques (LoRA, QLoRA, Bitsandbytes)



Requirements



Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field


At least 1 year of practical experience (e.g. from student projects, internships, or relevant work experience)


Solid understanding of the Hugging Face ecosystem (Transformers, Datasets) and PyTorch


Hands-on experience in fine-tuning LLMs


Experience with multi-modal models, RAG, or agent-based systems is a plus


Ability to work independently and in a structured manner



Benefits



Flexible work arrangements: remote work or one in-person office day per week in Berlin-Mitte, with flexible hours


Fair compensation and the opportunity to gain valuable real-world experience in a dynamic team


The chance to contribute to the development of innovative AI technologies and gain insights into building a successful startup


Clear path to a future full-time role, supported by a talent funding program to partially cover employment costs





We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x) in the field of AI & Satellite Data
Description:
Build the Market Leader in Satellite Analytics with us at LiveEO

At LiveEO, we combine Space Technology with AI to solve problems here on Earth.

LiveEO is applying the latest developments in artificial intelligence to analyse satellite data and is bringing the insights of earth observation data to customers in the enterprise sector. LiveEO‚Äôs ambitious goal is to monitor 1 billion assets across the globe with its unique SaaS solution until 2030.

We are looking for highly skilled Data Engineers to join our team. LiveEO leverages satellite imagery and artificial intelligence to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making across various industries. An example is the precise detection of trees and their height in high resolution imagery to protect our customers power grids from tree fall.

The focus of the role is on building robust and automated data pipelines around our geospatial processes that handle terabytes of data. Our pipelines involve a wide-range of topics such as efficient tiling strategies, merging of different data sources and challenges around various types of digital elevation models such as disparity matching & offset-correction. Usually these processes serve as pre- or post-processing steps for our Machine Learning models. We don‚Äôt expect you to be an expert in all of the above but you should have the willingness to dive into and work on multiple topics.

Your challenge


Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines that efficiently handle large amounts of raster data.
Orchestrate and automate data workflows using Prefect.
Engage in continuous improvement of the data processing frameworks by addressing challenges associated with digital elevation models, including disparity matching and offset-correction.


Your profile


Experience in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, with a strong background in handling large datasets, particularly raster data.
Proficient in Python with a strong emphasis on writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
A proactive approach to problem-solving, with a willingness to dive into and navigate multiple topics, driving innovation to improve data quality and process efficiency.
Understanding of geospatial data applications and processing techniques is a big plus.


Your Benefits


The opportunity to create a product that can improve business processes and lives across the globe;
Flexible working hours and hybrid work model - we trust our employees to get their work done while maintaining a healthy work-life balance;
We empower employees to drive their own career development, take initiative and have the freedom to be creative and bold;
Not an overtime culture - we take care that overtime is done only as a necessity and always offset with time off and rest;
Variety of team building opportunities - from jogging groups, team sports, bouldering and picnics;
A collaborative and learning environment - frequent internal workshops, knowledge sharing sessions, journal clubs and hackathons;
Potential to participate in the employee stock option program;
Office located in the center of Berlin Kreuzberg with free fruit, nuts and drinks;
Urban Sports membership and BVG subsidy.


About Us

LiveEO is a well funded startup founded in 2018 and based in Berlin. Our primary service is modelling risk to our customers‚Äô assets and infrastructure from vegetation, ground deformation and change detection. We currently have around 100 employees from all over the world with a variety of backgrounds

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Wir sind Eberlein Kunz, ein international agierendes E-Commerce Unternehmen in Berlin. Unser Team besteht aus einer bunt gemischten Crew von 80 kreativen K√∂pfen, die in den verschiedensten Bereichen wie Logistik, Produktentwicklung, Category Management, Vertrieb, Marketing, Web- und Softwareentwicklung ihre Talente einbringen.

Seit 2013 haben wir uns auf den Online-Vertrieb von erstklassigen Lebensmitteln, Bio- und Naturprodukten, Drogerie- und Beauty-Artikeln, Haushaltswaren sowie B√ºchern spezialisiert ‚Äì und das mit gro√üem Erfolg. Unsere j√§hrliche Wachstumsrate bewegt sich zweistellig, und wir z√§hlen mittlerweile zu den Top-H√§ndlern auf dem deutschsprachigen Amazon Marktplatz. Doch f√ºr uns ist das erst der Anfang, und deshalb bauen wir unser Team weiter aus.

Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d), der uns dabei unterst√ºtzt, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen und unsere Performance weiter zu optimieren.




Was wir bieten:

Ein dynamisches Unternehmen, das zu den f√ºhrenden E-Commerce-H√§ndlern auf Amazon im deutschsprachigen Raum z√§hlt.
Ein vielf√§ltiges und integratives Arbeitsumfeld, dass die Grundlage f√ºr nachhaltigen Gesch√§ftserfolg bildet.
Ein wettbewerbsf√§higes Gehalt
Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit einem Startfenster zwischen 6 und 10 Uhr, um die beste Work-Life-Balance zu erm√∂glichen.
Mobiles Arbeiten an 2 von 5 Tagen pro Woche ‚Äì f√ºr mehr Flexibilit√§t.
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte auf alle Produkte aus unserem Sortiment.
√úber 1.500 Angebote durch unseren Partner Corporate Benefits.
Bezuschussung des Jobtickets
Und viele weitere Benefits




Deine Aufgaben:

Erstellung und Pflege interaktiver Dashboards in PowerBI, die klaren Einblicke und Handlungsempfehlungen bieten.
Aufbau und Optimierung von Datenmodellen auf Basis von Daten aus Amazon Seller Central und anderen relevanten Quellen.
Definition, Berechnung und Interpretation von Amazon-spezifischen KPIs wie Bestellungen, Conversion Rates und PPC-Performance.
Analyse von Trends, Mustern und Abweichungen, um proaktive Empfehlungen abzuleiten.
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Business-Teams, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu unterst√ºtzen.
Unterst√ºtzung bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung datengetriebener Strategien zur Optimierung der Gesch√§ftsperformance.




Dein Profil:

Mindestens 2‚Äì3 Jahre Erfahrung mit dem Microsoft Fabric Tech Stack und PowerBI.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und SQL.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Amazon- und Marketplace-Daten.
F√§higkeit, komplexe Daten klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten.
Kommunikationsst√§rke und Teamf√§higkeit, um datenbasierte Insights erfolgreich in Gesch√§ftsentscheidungen einzubringen.







Wir freuen uns auf Deine Unterlagen und Dich kennenzulernen.

Seit 2013 haben wir uns auf den Online-Vertrieb von erstklassigen Lebensmitteln, Bio- und Naturprodukten, Drogerie- und Beauty-Artikeln, Haushaltswaren sowie B√ºchern spezialisiert ‚Äì und das mit gro√üem Erfolg. Unsere j√§hrliche Wachstumsrate bewegt sich zweistellig, und wir z√§hlen mittlerweile zu den Top-H√§ndlern auf dem deutschsprachigen Amazon Marktplatz. Doch f√ºr uns ist das erst der Anfang, und deshalb bauen wir unser Team weiter aus.

Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d), der uns dabei unterst√ºtzt, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen und unsere Performance weiter zu optimieren.


Was wir bieten:

  • Ein dynamisches Unternehmen, das zu den f√ºhrenden E-Commerce-H√§ndlern auf Amazon im deutschsprachigen Raum z√§hlt.
  • Ein vielf√§ltiges und integratives Arbeitsumfeld, dass die Grundlage f√ºr nachhaltigen Gesch√§ftserfolg bildet.
  • Ein wettbewerbsf√§higes Gehalt
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit einem Startfenster zwischen 6 und 10 Uhr, um die beste Work-Life-Balance zu erm√∂glichen.
  • Mobiles Arbeiten an 2 von 5 Tagen pro Woche ‚Äì f√ºr mehr Flexibilit√§t.
  • Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte auf alle Produkte aus unserem Sortiment.
  • √úber 1.500 Angebote durch unseren Partner Corporate Benefits.
  • Bezuschussung des Jobtickets
  • Und viele weitere Benefits


Deine Aufgaben:

  • Erstellung und Pflege interaktiver Dashboards in PowerBI, die klaren Einblicke und Handlungsempfehlungen bieten.
  • Aufbau und Optimierung von Datenmodellen auf Basis von Daten aus Amazon Seller Central und anderen relevanten Quellen.
  • Definition, Berechnung und Interpretation von Amazon-spezifischen KPIs wie Bestellungen, Conversion Rates und PPC-Performance.
  • Analyse von Trends, Mustern und Abweichungen, um proaktive Empfehlungen abzuleiten.
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Business-Teams, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu unterst√ºtzen.
  • Unterst√ºtzung bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung datengetriebener Strategien zur Optimierung der Gesch√§ftsperformance.


Dein Profil:

  • Mindestens 2‚Äì3 Jahre Erfahrung mit dem Microsoft Fabric Tech Stack und PowerBI.
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und SQL.
  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit Amazon- und Marketplace-Daten.
  • F√§higkeit, komplexe Daten klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten.
  • Kommunikationsst√§rke und Teamf√§higkeit, um datenbasierte Insights erfolgreich in Gesch√§ftsentscheidungen einzubringen.



Wir freuen uns auf Deine Unterlagen und Dich kennenzulernen.

Title: IT Services Analyst
Description:
Lloyds Bank GmbH and its brands Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Bank have won over 1 million satisfied customers in recent years. And this thanks to convincing products and, above all, our committed colleagues who want to achieve the best for our customers every day with new ideas, challenges and joy. In order to continue writing our success story, we are looking for the right reinforcement for our teams, because all our ambitious goals would be unattainable without teamwork. We also welcome career changers.

For our office in Berlin Mitte we are looking for a

IT Services Analyst (m/f/d)

Aufgaben


Coordinate IT-related order requests and IT support requests from employees
Mentor issues related to IT equipment and local infrastructure problems
Collaborate with IT Service Delivery to manage and mitigate the impact of widespread IT incidents.
Document requirements, standards and processes
Implement IT related projects
Coordinate and execute out-of-hours callout
Optimize and execute IT training to new employees
Act as the primary point of contact for IT service desk inquiries and support
Access and Recertification Services
Coordinate the onboarding of new applications to the User Access Recertification process
Coordinate regular recertification campaigns of user accounts to ensure compliance with security policies and regulations, ensuring robust security protocols
Analyze the management of user accounts for specific applications, ensuring appropriate access and permissions
Implement secure and efficient user access management for applications within the defined scope
Plan regular monitoring of audit logs to identify and investigate unauthorized access or suspicious activities, ensuring the integrity and security of systems
Analyze the timely deactivation of user accounts for departing employees to prevent unauthorized access

Profil


Bachelor, vocational training or comparable degree or proven relevant work experience with a technical | IT background
Several years of experience in 1st and 2nd line support and proven work experience within technical support
ITIL Foundation certified
Access and Recertification Services
Experienced in implementing and executing recertification campaigns
Capable of overseeing the management of user accounts for specific applications
Experience at supporting regular audits of user accounts to ensure compliance with security policies and regulations
Understanding and handling of IT requests and providing effective solutions
Troubleshooting IT issues and connectivity issues
Capability to interpret and execute technical scripts for system modifications
Very good English and German language skills

Wir bieten


An international team with colleagues from more than 50 different countries
Social benefits such as a company pension scheme and capital formation contributions
30 days holiday as well as 24 and 31 December as non-working days
Employee Assistance Programme ‚Äì personal 24/7 helpline for all employees
Various possibilities for flexible working, i.a. various part-time models, flexitime
home office arrangements once a week
Possibility to work from other EU countries for up to 30 days per year
Additional benefits such as sports activities, free fruit, nuts and drinks
Employer contributions to BVG job ticket and a Lease a bike programme
An informal corporate culture - without dress code and ‚ÄòSie'.
An excellent learning culture and opportunity to improve your professional competencies
Easily accessible city centre offices, in the vicinity of many shops and restaurants to which you receive a discount


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Idealerweise hast du schon erste Erfahrungen in der Anwendung von Business Intelligence Software (Netsuite und Tableau) und mit Datenbanken und ERP-Systemen sammeln k√∂nnen

Title: Junior Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
DAS ERWARTET DICH

Zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Datenstrategie, suchen wir einen engagierten Junior Data Engineer (m/w/d).
