Ad esempio, tariffe pi√π elevate possono essere offerte ai titolari di un dottorato. Per lavori non principali, come l'onboarding iniziale al progetto o le fasi di straordinario, possono applicarsi tariffe inferiori. Alcuni progetti offrono pagamenti incentivanti. Si prega di consultare i termini di pagamento per ciascun progetto.

Title: Catalog Specialist
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Are you detail-oriented and have great communication skills? Do you love working in a cross-functional environment and solving problems?

Our Merchant Services team lies at the heart of Wolt, ensuring that we set all of our merchants up for success by providing a seamless onboarding, menu, and catalog experience. As Wolt continues to grow in both scale and scope of offerings, the strength of our content management and catalog operations must expand with it.

We are looking for a Catalog Editing Specialist for Content & Catalog team who will oversee the day-to-day operations of a small but dynamic team of menu and catalog specialists. You‚Äôll ensure that product information on Wolt‚Äôs platform adheres to the highest standards of accuracy and compliance. As a leader, you‚Äôll work cross-functionally to improve processes, drive compliance, and ensure our menus and catalogs are engaging and up to date.

You‚Äôre Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will‚Ä¶


Ensure rapid and accurate creation of retail assortments, often with thousands of individual items (e.g. supermarkets).
Review and approve changes made to retail assortments and restaurant menus to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Manage the content and quality of Wolt Germany‚Äôs product catalog for both Retail and Restaurants.
Collaborate with external stakeholders - product manufacturers.
Act on data! - you are able to pull data reports, analyze them and act based on data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Compliance & Onboarding


What We Offer


Cool office in the heart of Berlin
Independent work in a dynamic, international team
A fast-growing tech company with many career opportunities
Attractive salary package
Discounts on Wolt orders
Various soft drinks, coffee, and fruits in the office
Weekly (virtual) all-hands meetings and regular team events
Flexible working hours policy + 30 days of paid vacation


Qualifications


Fluent in German (spoken and written) and English - any other language is a plus.
You have a positive attitude and an entrepreneurial spirit.
You are a problem-solver - you enjoy diagnosing issues and developing creative approaches to solve challenges.
You have a strong technical skill - Large data set processing skill - excel, sql or similar skill are a must. Basic coding knowledge is necessary Python / Javascript, ect.
You have an outstanding organizational skill, you are able to prioritize given tasks on the fly.
You are customer-centric - you have a customer-first mentality, are effective at working with people with varying degrees of technical ability
You are comfortable working in fast-paced and demanding environments
Understanding of LMIV (Lebensmittel-Informationsverordnung): Strong knowledge of food labeling laws and regulations in Germany, particularly for grocery items.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Strategic Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

100 % Fossil-free: Wir tr√§umen nicht nur von einer nachhaltigen und lebenswerten Welt ‚Äì wir gestalten sie gemeinsam und mit Leidenschaft! Seit √ºber 20 Jahren sind wir eine treibende Kraft in Deutschland und weltweit beim Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien. Mit unserem umfassenden Know-how erzeugen, speichern und liefern Wir gr√ºne Energie rund um den Globus ‚Äì mit Wind, Sonne, Biogas und Wasserstoff. Dadurch erzeugt ENERTRAG j√§hrlich √ºber zwei Terawattstunden Strom aus eigenen Anlagen.

Mehr als 1.000 MitarbeiterInnen treiben Energieprojekte mit einer Kapazit√§t von √ºber 15 Gigawatt voran und verfolgen einen ganzheitlichen Ansatz f√ºr Verbundkraftwerke, einschlie√ülich Wind-, PV- und Elektrolyse-Anlagen sowie Netzinfrastruktur f√ºr eine lebenswerte Erde.

Werde ein Teil vom ENERTRAG-Team an einem unserer Standorte vorzugsweise in Berlin, aber auch in Hamburg, Dauerthal oder Remote als Strategic Analyst und lass uns gemeinsam die Energiewende voranbringen.

Stellenbeschreibung

Diese Rolle stellt eine essenzielle Position in unserem Commercial Centre of Competence dar. Du arbeitest mit interdisziplin√§ren Teams direkt an spannenden strategischen Projekten und Analysen mit, untersuchst und bewertest neue Gesch√§fts- und Projektideen und hilfst uns, unsere Projekte aus kommerzieller Sicht optimal zu entwickeln.


Arbeite eng mit dem Finanzierungsteam und unseren Projektentwicklern zusammen um Wissen und Anforderungen zu verschiedenen Sektoren (z.B., Erneuerbare Energien, Gr√ºner Wasserstoff, Batteriespeicher) zusammenzutragen und zu verstehen
Entwickle neue Methoden und Werkzeuge in iterativer Kollaboration, um ENERTRAGs kommerzielle Bewertung und Steuerung von Projekten zu st√§rken, z.B., durch Projekt Benchmarking und effektive Entscheidungsvorlagen, und erarbeite Implementierungsprozesse
Entwickle Pr√§sentationen zu kommerziellen Analysen zur effektiven Aufbereitung und anschaulichen Darstellung der Ergebnisse und stelle sie unserem Management (inkl. Vorstand) vor
Unterst√ºtze den Strategieprozess f√ºr unsere L√§nderorganisationen in enger Abstimmung mit dem Senior Leadership aus den L√§ndern
Recherchiere Markttrends, regulatorischen Entwicklungen und politischen √Ñnderungen, die neue Kommerzialisierungsm√∂glichkeiten bieten oder bestehende beeinflussen
Analysiere neue kommerzielle Ans√§tze und Ideen und f√ºhre Wirtschaftlichkeitsberechnungen und Szenarioanalysen durch


Qualifikationen


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftswissenschaften (VWL, BWL) oder Ingenieurwesen mit erweiterten wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Kenntnissen
Zwei bis drei Jahre Berufserfahrung, idealerweise in der Unternehmensberatung oder Financial Advisory
Ausgepr√§gte analytische F√§higkeiten zur quantitativen Probleml√∂sung und eine strukturierte Herangehensweise bei der Analyse kommerzieller Fragestellungen, einschlie√ülich der F√§higkeit, erste Absch√§tzungen auf Basis der 80/20-Regel vorzunehmen.
Ergebnisse klar und verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren. Sehr gute MS Office-Kenntnisse, insbesondere in Excel, Word und PowerPoint, erforderlich.
Erfolgreiche Erfahrung mit Team-√ºbergreifender Arbeit und Stakeholder Management
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Bewertungsverfahren, insbesondere in der Durchf√ºhrung von Discounted Cash-Flow (DCF)-Berechnungen
Gute Kenntnisse des Marktes f√ºr Erneuerbare Energien und PtX-Produkte sowie der relevanten gesetzlichen und politischen Rahmenbedingungen


Zus√§tzliche Informationen

üè° Flexibilit√§t & Work-Life-Balance

Urlaub - Du ben√∂tigst neue Energie und bist bereits in Aufbruchstimmung? Bei uns gibt es 30 Tage Urlaub

Workation - Arbeite flexibel bis zu 4 Wochen aus dem Ausland

Flexibles Arbeiten - B√ºro oder Homeoffice? Deine Wahl!

üí∞ Finanzen & Zukunftssicherheit

Zuschuss zur Altersvorsorge ‚Äì Wir denken heute schon an deine Zukunft

KiTa-Zuschuss - Deine Kinder sind f√ºr Dich das Wichtigste? F√ºr uns auch. Daher erh√§ltst Du einen KiTa-Zuschuss von uns.

Jobrad ‚Äì Nachhaltige Mobilit√§t, auch privat nutzbar

üìö Weiterbildung & Entwicklung

Gro√üz√ºgiges Weiterbildungsbudget ‚Äì Entwickle dich individuell weiter

Sprachkurse ‚Äì Lerne Englisch und viele andere Sprachen mit uns

üèãÔ∏è Gesundheit & Teamspirit

Fitnessangebote ‚Äì Profitiere von unserer WellHub Kooperation

Teamevents ‚Äì Um Arbeit auch mal Arbeit sein zu lassen, laden wir Dich einmal j√§hrlich zu unserem gro√üen Sommerfest ein und zwischendurch auch zu weiteren Teamevents

Title: Commercial Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

100 % Fossil-free: Wir tr√§umen nicht nur von einer nachhaltigen und lebenswerten Welt ‚Äì wir gestalten sie gemeinsam und mit Leidenschaft! Seit √ºber 20 Jahren sind wir eine treibende Kraft in Deutschland und weltweit beim Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien. Mit unserem umfassenden Know-how erzeugen, speichern und liefern Wir gr√ºne Energie rund um den Globus ‚Äì mit Wind, Sonne, Biogas und Wasserstoff. Dadurch erzeugt ENERTRAG j√§hrlich √ºber zwei Terawattstunden Strom aus eigenen Anlagen.

Mehr als 1.000 MitarbeiterInnen treiben Energieprojekte mit einer Kapazit√§t von √ºber 15 Gigawatt voran und verfolgen einen ganzheitlichen Ansatz f√ºr Verbundkraftwerke, einschlie√ülich Wind-, PV- und Elektrolyse-Anlagen sowie Netzinfrastruktur f√ºr eine lebenswerte Erde.

Werde ein Teil vom ENERTRAG-Team an einem unserer Standorte vorzugsweise in Berlin, aber auch in Hamburg, Dauerthal oder Remote als Commercial Analyst und lass uns gemeinsam die Energiewende voranbringen.

Stellenbeschreibung

Diese Rolle stellt eine essenzielle Position in unserem Commercial Centre of Competence dar. Du arbeitest mit interdisziplin√§ren Teams direkt an spannenden strategischen Projekten und Analysen mit, bewertest unsere Projekte und findest kommerzielle Optimierungspotenziale.


Erstelle Business Cases, Rentabilit√§tsberechnungen, Cash-Flow-Analysen und Szenarien zur Unterst√ºtzung von Investitionsentscheidungen.
Erhebe und bereite Projektdaten in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Projektleitern und anderen Abteilungen wie zum Beispiel unseren Finanzierungsteam auf.
√úbertrage bestehende Bewertungsans√§tze auf neue M√§rkte und Technologien.
Erstelle Pr√§sentationen, die strategische Narrative und Szenario-Abw√§gungen f√ºr Entscheidungsprozesse (z.B. SteerCo, Stage-Gate) kommunizieren.
Analysiere und benchmarke Projekte und unterst√ºtze Verhandlungen mit Partnern und Abnehmern aus kommerzieller Perspektive.
Entwickle und pflege Finanzbewertungsmodelle und integriere diese in interne und externe Datenbanken.


Qualifikationen


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftswissenschaften (BWL, VWL) oder Ingenieurwesen mit fundierten wirtschaftlichen Kenntnissen.
Etwa 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung, idealerweise im Bereich der Erneuerbaren Energien.
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Bewertungsverfahren, insbesondere Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) und Rentabilit√§tsberechnungen.
Erfahrung in der Automatisierung von Analysen durch Programmierung (z.B. Excel, R oder andere Programmiersprachen) von Vorteil.
Gute Kenntnisse der Gesch√§ftsmodelle der Erneuerbaren Energien sowie der relevanten regulatorischen und politischen Rahmenbedingungen.
Verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.


Zus√§tzliche Informationen

HTML:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

100 % Fossil-free: Wir tr√§umen nicht nur von einer nachhaltigen und lebenswerten Welt ‚Äì wir gestalten sie gemeinsam und mit Leidenschaft! Seit √ºber 20 Jahren sind wir eine treibende Kraft in Deutschland und weltweit beim Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien. Mit unserem umfassenden Know-how erzeugen, speichern und liefern Wir gr√ºne Energie rund um den Globus ‚Äì mit Wind, Sonne, Biogas und Wasserstoff. Dadurch erzeugt ENERTRAG j√§hrlich √ºber zwei Terawattstunden Strom aus eigenen Anlagen.

Mehr als 1.000 MitarbeiterInnen treiben Energieprojekte mit einer Kapazit√§t von √ºber 15 Gigawatt voran und verfolgen einen ganzheitlichen Ansatz f√ºr Verbundkraftwerke, einschlie√ülich Wind-, PV- und Elektrolyse-Anlagen sowie Netzinfrastruktur f√ºr eine lebenswerte Erde.

Werde ein Teil vom ENERTRAG-Team an einem unserer Standorte vorzugsweise in Berlin, aber auch in Hamburg, Dauerthal oder Remote als Commercial Analyst und lass uns gemeinsam die Energiewende voranbringen.

Stellenbeschreibung

Diese Rolle stellt eine essenzielle Position in unserem Commercial Centre of Competence dar. Du arbeitest mit interdisziplin√§ren Teams direkt an spannenden strategischen Projekten und Analysen mit, bewertest unsere Projekte und findest kommerzielle Optimierungspotenziale.

  • Erstelle Business Cases, Rentabilit√§tsberechnungen, Cash-Flow-Analysen und Szenarien zur Unterst√ºtzung von Investitionsentscheidungen.
  • Erhebe und bereite Projektdaten in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Projektleitern und anderen Abteilungen wie zum Beispiel unseren Finanzierungsteam auf.
  • √úbertrage bestehende Bewertungsans√§tze auf neue M√§rkte und Technologien.
  • Erstelle Pr√§sentationen, die strategische Narrative und Szenario-Abw√§gungen f√ºr Entscheidungsprozesse (z.B. SteerCo, Stage-Gate) kommunizieren.
  • Analysiere und benchmarke Projekte und unterst√ºtze Verhandlungen mit Partnern und Abnehmern aus kommerzieller Perspektive.
  • Entwickle und pflege Finanzbewertungsmodelle und integriere diese in interne und externe Datenbanken.

Qualifikationen

  • Erfahrung in der Automatisierung von Analysen durch Programmierung (z.B. Excel, R oder andere Programmiersprachen) von Vorteil.
  • Gute Kenntnisse der Gesch√§ftsmodelle der Erneuerbaren Energien sowie der relevanten regulatorischen und politischen Rahmenbedingungen.
  • Verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Title: Data & AI Strategist (f/m/d)
Description:
The role sits at the intersection of IT, business and innovation, developing data & AI strategies within Siemens IT, fundamentally supporting our business, leveraging Data, AI and GenAI to drive transformational change.

What We Offer You


An attractive renumeration package
Access to employee share plans
30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family
2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Diverse health and wellness offerings
Barrier-free locations


Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here.

The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions.

You‚Äôll make an impact by


Data & AI Strategy Development
Developing and implementing data and AI strategies that align with our business and IT goals, driving strategic value and ensuring that our AI and data efforts have a measurable impact.
Leading the way in AI adoption ‚Äî moving from initial experiments to fully scaled solutions that improve decision-making and efficiency.
Staying at the forefront of AI innovation, including emerging technologies like agentive AI, large language models, and autonomous systems.
Building and maintaining relationships with key technology partners, research institutions, and industry thought leaders.
AI & Data-Driven Operating Models
Designing operating models that leverage AI and data by integrating automation and predictive insights into our business processes.
Collaborating with business and IT leaders to embed AI and data capabilities into workflows, driving transformation and new business approaches.
Encouraging a culture of data-driven decision-making by ensuring that everyone has access to high-quality, well-governed data.
Developing and implementing change management strategies that support the transition to AI-enhanced operating models.
AI & Data Governance and Enablement
Helping to evolve our frameworks for AI and data governance to ensure that our solutions are scalable, ethical, and compliant.
Fostering AI and data literacy across Siemens by equipping teams with the skills and tools needed to effectively utilize AI and advanced analytics.
Collaboration & Influence
Working closely with relevant Centers of Excellence (CoEs) and internal innovation programs to define and standardize best practices, supporting the acceleration of AI adoption.
Engaging with senior leadership to influence decisions on AI and data investments, ensuring alignment with our long-term goals.
Supporting the continual development of our internal strategy capabilities ‚Äî beyond just data & AI.


This Is How You'll Win Us Over


Education
Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business, or a related field.
Experience & Skills
At least 5 years of experience in AI, data strategy, analytics, or digital transformation, with a strong track record of implementing AI and data projects on an enterprise scale.
Background in consulting, enterprise AI leadership, or AI-first startups.
Proven expertise in change management, guiding organizations through AI-driven transitions.
Strong problem-solving, strategic thinking, and program management abilities.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability for influencing senior executives and cross-functional teams.
Strong interest and extensive knowledge within the topics AI & Data.


You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!

Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let‚Äôs get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

About Us

We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. That‚Äôs why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we‚Äôll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!

www.siemens.de/careers ‚Äì if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ ‚Äì if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Engineer I, Data - (Tech Graduate Program)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for 2025 Tech Graduates, Data to join our key verticals on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We offer a unique environment for you to learn and develop your skills, and to contribute to the development of our cutting-edge tech solutions. You will have some of the most talented and experienced software engineers in the industry as mentors to help you ramp up, and a support group you can go to for help and connection.

Our Engineering organisation consists of over 1,500 talented engineers distributed across our major verticals. Our tech employees are divided into different teams across the following areas: Consumer Data Products, FinTech, Logistics, Pandora, Platform, Quick Commerce, and Vendor Tech. They work on a range of major topics from boosting customer acquisition and retention to creating efficient experiences for our vendors, building an excellent logistics ecosystem across the delivery lifecycle, providing financial empowerment to our stakeholders and much more.

If you are an engineering graduate looking for an opportunity to grow in the tech industry and make a difference, our Tech Graduate Program is for you!

What you need to be successful


Have the right to live and work in Germany and/or hold an EU passport
Have (or be graduating from) a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Science or a related field
If graduated, you may also have a maximum of 2 years of experience in similar job fields
Coding bootcamp graduates (recent/upcoming) are also eligible to apply and do not need to meet the degree requirement above; please apply if you have a minimum of 6-12 months‚Äô internship/bootcamp experience
Have a good understanding of and direct experience with coding in relevant languages and technologies (see below), ideally from internships, bootcamps, or open-source projects
Be an analytical thinker and strong problem solver with a humble, inquisitive approach
Have good communication and collaboration skills
Be business fluent in English
Be excited about working in a fast-moving, agile company where we learn from our mistakes

Technical skills we look for:


Data
Python, SQL, noSQL, cloud services (AWS, GCP or Azure), data warehousing (BigQuery, Redshift)

Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Working Student - Frontend Developer
Description:
Do you love turning design ideas into smooth, interactive web interfaces? Are you excited to shape real products, work with modern tools like Figma and Storybook, and help build the UI of an IoT platform at a fast-growing energy efficiency startup in Berlin? Then we want to hear from you!




At perto, we are expanding our frontend team for an exciting new energy efficiency initiative called pertoIOTA, part of our Efficiency-as-a-Service (EaaS) strategy. We're building a smart IoT platform that connects HVAC and lighting systems to track and optimize energy usage in real time. The project is partially funded by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action.


Tasks



Develop and enhance modern web applications using React or Angular


Design UI/UX layouts and components in Figma and translate them into fully functional web interfaces


Ensure the reusability and design of the Storybook component library


Implement unit tests using tools like Jest or React Testing Library


Write end-to-end (E2E) tests using frameworks such as Playwright or Cypress


Collaborate with backend developers to integrate APIs and ensure seamless data communication


Continuously improve the user experience by refining the UI based on feedback and best practices


Stay up-to-date with frontend trends and contribute ideas to enhance our stack and processes



Requirements



Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field


Experience with TypeScript and at least one modern frontend framework, such as React or Angular


Proficient in using Figma to create clean, user-friendly interface designs


Familiarity with Storybook for documenting and managing UI components


Understanding of unit testing and end-to-end (E2E) testing practices


Experience with testing tools like Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, or Playwright is a plus


Knowledge of responsive design and basic API integration


Possess a proactive mindset, attention to detail, and a willingness to learn


Fluent in English (German is a bonus)



Benefits



Flexible working hours to fit your study schedule


Freedom of action and design with short decision-making paths and flat hierarchies


A steep learning curve in a fast-growing, young company in a rapidly changing industry


Inspiring start-up life in the Prop Tech sector in Berlin


A pleasant working atmosphere in a motivated, international team in the heart of Berlin Prenzlauer Berg


A modern tech stack and agile development environment


Opportunities to grow your skills in design, development, and testing





perto is an energy efficiency service provider from Berlin. We help people save energy and money by bringing building utilities online. We offer an IoT platform that avails users to monitor, control & optimize energy consumption. Our main customers are property management companies as well as energy supply companies. As a young and fast-growing company, we are constantly expanding our product portfolio.




Interested? Great! Send in your application explaining your motivation and indicating your earliest possible start date.

  • Familiarity with Storybook for documenting and managing UI components

  • Understanding of unit testing and end-to-end (E2E) testing practices

  • Experience with testing tools like Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, or Playwright is a plus

  • Knowledge of responsive design and basic API integration

  • Possess a proactive mindset, attention to detail, and a willingness to learn

  • Fluent in English (German is a bonus)


Benefits

  • Flexible working hours to fit your study schedule

  • Freedom of action and design with short decision-making paths and flat hierarchies

  • A steep learning curve in a fast-growing, young company in a rapidly changing industry

  • Inspiring start-up life in the Prop Tech sector in Berlin

  • A pleasant working atmosphere in a motivated, international team in the heart of Berlin Prenzlauer Berg

  • A modern tech stack and agile development environment

  • Opportunities to grow your skills in design, development, and testing


perto is an energy efficiency service provider from Berlin. We help people save energy and money by bringing building utilities online. We offer an IoT platform that avails users to monitor, control & optimize energy consumption. Our main customers are property management companies as well as energy supply companies. As a young and fast-growing company, we are constantly expanding our product portfolio.


Interested? Great! Send in your application explaining your motivation and indicating your earliest possible start date.

Probleml√∂ser*in durch und durch ‚Äì kreative L√∂sungen findest du im Handumdrehen.

Flexibel, motiviert und ein echtes Teammitglied, das die Zusammenarbeit lebt.

Windows-Desktops? Einrichten, administrieren und L√∂sungen f√ºr jedes Problem finden.

Du kennst dich mit der Administration von Windows Server aus und beh√§ltst auch bei komplexeren Aufgaben den √úberblick.

Kenntnisse in der Google G-Suite-Administration.

Lush als Arbeitgeberin

Wir bei Lush stehen f√ºr Chancengerechtigkeit, die wir als Unternehmen vorleben und erm√∂glichen wollen. Wer oder wie jemand ist, spielt bei uns keine Rolle. Wir wollen allen Menschen ein Umfeld bieten, das sie einbezieht. Jede Erfahrung und Ansicht ist einzigartig und tr√§gt zur Vielfalt bei. Von der Vielfalt wollen wir lernen und an ihr k√∂nnen wir wachsen. Alle Bewerber*innen erhalten bei uns die gleiche Chance ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Alter, Genderidentit√§t, Sprache, Herkunft, Nationalit√§t, Aussehen, Religion, Glaube, Kultur, sozialem und wirtschaftlichem Status, sexueller Orientierung oder K√∂rper.

EIN KLEINER EINBLICK INS TEAM & DAS DAY2DAY

Da LUSH expandiert, brauchen wir mehr denn je Unterst√ºtzung f√ºr unsere digitalen Produkte und digitalen Systeme. Von Berlin aus arbeitest Du als Teil des Tech-Ops Teams und unterst√ºtzt unsere interne Infrastruktur f√ºr unsere aktuell 35 Shops in Deutschland, Tschechien und Polen.

√úber uns

Das britische Unternehmen LUSH ist Hersteller und Einzelh√§ndler frischer, handgefertigter Kosmetik mit weltweit √ºber 900 Filialen und weiteren E-Commerce Shops in √ºber 40 L√§ndern. Gegr√ºndet 1995, umfasst das Sortiment √ºber 300 Produkte im Bereich der nachhaltigen Pflege. Lush ist ein kampagnenf√ºhrendes Unternehmen, welches mit Graswurzelgruppen und Aktivist*innen kooperiert, die sich f√ºr Menschenrechte, Tierrechte und Umweltschutz einsetzen.

Title: Data Consultant (Italian)
Description:
Company Description

Assent is the leading solution for supply chain sustainability tailored for the world's top-tier, sustainability-driven manufacturers. Hidden risks riddle supply chains, many of which weren't built with sustainability in mind. That's where we step in. With insights from experts, Assent is the tool manufacturers trust for comprehensive sustainability.

We are proud to announce that Assent has crossed the US $100M ARR milestone, granting us Centaur Status. This accomplishment, reached just 8 years following our Series A, makes us the first and only Certified B Corporation in North America's SaaS sustainability industry to celebrate this milestone.

Our journey from $5 million to US $100M ARR in just eight years has been marked by significant growth and achievements. With our $350 million US funding led by Vista Equity Partners, we're posed for even greater expansion and are on the lookout for outstanding team members to join our mission.

Hybrid Work Model

At Assent, we proudly embrace a remote-first work model, valuing the flexibility and autonomy it provides our team. We also acknowledge the intangible benefits of occasional in-person workdays. For team members situated within 50kms/31 miles of our five global offices in Ottawa, Eldoret, Penang, Columbus, and Amsterdam, you can expect to come into the office at least one day a week. Similarly, those near our co-working spaces in Nairobi and Toronto are encouraged to work onsite once a month.

Job Description

Position Summary

Reporting to the Manager, Data Consulting, the Data Consultant serves as a primary point of contact regarding data quality for assigned client accounts. Through ongoing consultation, implementation support and issue resolution, the Data Consultant ensures client meet their business goals using best in class data practices.

Key Requirements And Responsibilities


Guide existing clients to keep data updated and optimized for success
Conduct strategy sessions, workshops and ongoing consultation aligned with Assent's data standards and processes
Proactively monitor client data and systems to ensure ongoing data quality and accuracy
Perform ad hoc analysis, report development and troubleshooting as needed.
Maintain expertise in Assent's products, features and roadmap to help clients maximize value
Develop documentation covering all clients data assets, processes and best practices
Deliver client presentations, trainings and knowledge transfer sessions
Manage client relationships and act as the primary point of contact for all data needs
Identify process improvements, technical issues and make recommendations
Proactively identify data risks, assess potential impacts, and collaborate with internal teams to implement effective mitigation strategies
Collaborate cross- functionally to continually enhance Assent's data solutions and client experience



This is not an exhaustive list of duties. Responsibilities may be altered and/or added from time to time to meet business needs.

Qualifications

Your Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

We strongly value your talent, energy and passion. It will also be valuable to Assent if you have the following qualifications,


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree/Higher diploma from recognized learning institution in Information Systems/Computer Science;
Minimum 3-4 years related work experience;
Proven track record of building trusted advisory relationships
Proven ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non technical audiences
Great verbal and written communication skills in English as well as an additional language in Italian
Advanced Excel skills - able to leverage all Excel functions to analyze and report complex datasets;
Proficient in SQL skills, ability to update/ retrieve data independently;
Experience in integrations and API
Excellent understanding of data management and analysis principles;



Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions. Assent is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Additional Information

Assent Europe is Headquartered in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. This position allows for remote working from anywhere within Germany or the UK

At Assent, we are uniquely positioned to make meaningful, impactful changes in the world around us. If you believe in doing work that matters, we want you to join our team.

Life at Assent


Wellness: We believe that you and your family‚Äôs well being is important. As a result, we offer vacation time that increases with tenure, comprehensive benefits packages (details vary by country), life leave days and more.
Financial Benefits: It‚Äôs not all about the money ‚Äì well, it‚Äôs a little about the money. We understand that financial health is important and we offer a competitive base salary, a corporate bonus program, and more.
Life at Assent: There is purpose beyond your work. We provide our team members with volunteer days, flexible work options and opportunities to get involved in corporate giving initiatives.
Lifelong Learning: At Assent, curiosity is not only valued but encouraged. You will receive professional development days that are available to you the day you start.
Work The Way That Works for You: Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. We offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs.



At Assent, we are committed to growing and sustaining an environment where our team members feel included, valued, and heard. Our diversity and equal opportunity practices are guided and championed by our Diversity and Inclusion Working Group and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs).

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining team members from diverse backgrounds and experiences, and fostering a culture of belonging where all team members are included, treated with dignity and respect, promoted on their merits, and placed in positions to contribute to business success.

If you require assistance or accommodation throughout any part of the interview and selection process, please contact talent@assent.com and we will be happy to help.

Title: Operations Associate, Connectivity
Description:
About Gigs

At Gigs, we're building the operating system for mobile services - a platform that enables tech companies to seamlessly embed connectivity into their products.

Just as Stripe enables businesses to embed a payment button into any product, Gigs enables businesses to add a connect button and issue SIMs with a single click or API call. From fintechs launching mobile services to HRIS platforms offering work phone plans, we automate phone plan provisioning.

We're solving complex technical, operational and regulatory challenges to make connectivity truly effortless. We've grown to a team of around 90 people across the US and Europe, bringing together an experienced team of early-stage engineers, product builders and business athletes from companies like Stripe, Airbnb and Shopify. We know what it takes to solve hard problems.

With almost $100MM in funding from Ribbit Capital, Google and Y Combinator, Gigs is one of the fastest growing tech companies. Building on our strong foundation, we're looking for exceptional candidates who want to do the best work of their lives in a high-paced environment, surrounded by a highly talented, ambitious team.

You'll be joining at an exciting inflection point in our company's history. At sub-100 people and with a year of hyper-growth ahead of us, opportunity is abundant.

The Role

Gigs' Connectivity area is responsible for building and running connectivity that powers all Gigs' products and customers. The area sits cross-functionally between Product, Engineering, Business Development, and Customer Success.

As a Connectivity Operations Associate, you will be part of our ConnOps team that ensures Gigs' connectivity always works smoothly. You will work closely with our Connectivity Partnership Managers (who are running Gigs' telco partnerships and lead new connectivity/market launches), and be responsible for a range of topics; spanning driving workstreams in larger projects to taking care of critical ongoing connectivity processes and tasks - and finding ways to optimize those.

Connectivity Operations Associate is a good entry point to Gigs; you will get to know Connectivity closely and get exposure to many different teams at Gigs. As Connectivity is central to what we do at Gigs, having a deep understanding of it will help your future career at Gigs.

What You Will do


Operations: Run key connectivity operations processes and tasks to make sure our connectivity runs smoothly - this includes e.g. plan provisioning and optimization, SIM order management and warehousing, fraud monitoring, external partnership management, collaborating across teams to support customers to go live etc etc.
Project Management: Manage your own workstreams in company-wide initiatives & projects. Support the running of Gigs' external testing program and Gigs' device certification program.
Process Scaling & Optimization: Identify and implement improvement opportunities in the processes and tasks that you own.


What we are looking for


Partnership Expertise: You have demonstrated success in negotiating and running external partnerships - navigating complex processes and engaging stakeholders at multiple levels within large organizations, particularly in IT and Procurement.
Adaptability and Curiosity: You are a fast learner who thrives in dynamic environments, eager to dive deep into new industries, especially telecom and connectivity solutions, to better serve our clients.
Analytical Strength: You are comfortable building detailed business cases, modeling partnership economics, and using data-driven insights to inform decisions and evaluate opportunities.
Relationship Builder: You excel at establishing and maintaining trust with clients, managing complex relationships, addressing concerns proactively, and becoming a valued advisor within large organizations.
Collaborative Partner: You work effectively across departments to align commercial strategies with operational capabilities, build trust internally and externally, and drive meaningful results through collaboration and influence.
Make things happen: You have a strong inner drive and you make things happen - even if the path forward is uncertain.


Remote Work at Gigs

At Gigs, we're remote-friendly, with a strong emphasis on meaningful in-person collaboration. While most of our work is done remotely, we encourage our team to connect regularly in our hubs, whether for focused teamwork, customer meetings, or brainstorming sessions that drive creativity.


Gigs Pads: Our hubs in San Francisco, London, and Berlin are vibrant spaces where Gigsters come together to connect, collaborate, and create.
Gigs Republic: Twice a year, the entire company gathers for in-depth team bonding, strategic sessions, and shared experiences to reinforce our culture and drive growth.


This blend of remote work and in-person collaboration ensures we maintain a dynamic, connected, and innovative team environment.

What We Offer

At Gigs, we believe in rewarding excellence. You'll receive competitive compensation and stock options to ensure you are truly part of our growth. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include stipends for upgrading your home office or work setup, learning and development budgets to support your career growth and a free phone and international data plan (naturally).

If you're excited about pushing boundaries and helping us shape the future of telecom, we'd love to hear from you.

For more information on benefits, Gigs Pads, and life at Gigs, check out our Careers page.
Show more
HTML:
About Gigs

At Gigs, we're building the operating system for mobile services - a platform that enables tech companies to seamlessly embed connectivity into their products.

Just as Stripe enables businesses to embed a payment button into any product, Gigs enables businesses to add a connect button and issue SIMs with a single click or API call. From fintechs launching mobile services to HRIS platforms offering work phone plans, we automate phone plan provisioning.

We're solving complex technical, operational and regulatory challenges to make connectivity truly effortless. We've grown to a team of around 90 people across the US and Europe, bringing together an experienced team of early-stage engineers, product builders and business athletes from companies like Stripe, Airbnb and Shopify. We know what it takes to solve hard problems.

With almost $100MM in funding from Ribbit Capital, Google and Y Combinator, Gigs is one of the fastest growing tech companies. Building on our strong foundation, we're looking for exceptional candidates who want to do the best work of their lives in a high-paced environment, surrounded by a highly talented, ambitious team.

You'll be joining at an exciting inflection point in our company's history. At sub-100 people and with a year of hyper-growth ahead of us, opportunity is abundant.

The Role

Gigs' Connectivity area is responsible for building and running connectivity that powers all Gigs' products and customers. The area sits cross-functionally between Product, Engineering, Business Development, and Customer Success.

As a Connectivity Operations Associate, you will be part of our ConnOps team that ensures Gigs' connectivity always works smoothly. You will work closely with our Connectivity Partnership Managers (who are running Gigs' telco partnerships and lead new connectivity/market launches), and be responsible for a range of topics; spanning driving workstreams in larger projects to taking care of critical ongoing connectivity processes and tasks - and finding ways to optimize those.

Connectivity Operations Associate is a good entry point to Gigs; you will get to know Connectivity closely and get exposure to many different teams at Gigs. As Connectivity is central to what we do at Gigs, having a deep understanding of it will help your future career at Gigs.

What You Will do

  • Operations: Run key connectivity operations processes and tasks to make sure our connectivity runs smoothly - this includes e.g. plan provisioning and optimization, SIM order management and warehousing, fraud monitoring, external partnership management, collaborating across teams to support customers to go live etc etc.
  • Project Management: Manage your own workstreams in company-wide initiatives & projects. Support the running of Gigs' external testing program and Gigs' device certification program.
  • Process Scaling & Optimization: Identify and implement improvement opportunities in the processes and tasks that you own.

What we are looking for

  • Partnership Expertise: You have demonstrated success in negotiating and running external partnerships - navigating complex processes and engaging stakeholders at multiple levels within large organizations, particularly in IT and Procurement.
  • Adaptability and Curiosity: You are a fast learner who thrives in dynamic environments, eager to dive deep into new industries, especially telecom and connectivity solutions, to better serve our clients.
  • Analytical Strength: You are comfortable building detailed business cases, modeling partnership economics, and using data-driven insights to inform decisions and evaluate opportunities.
  • Relationship Builder: You excel at establishing and maintaining trust with clients, managing complex relationships, addressing concerns proactively, and becoming a valued advisor within large organizations.
  • Collaborative Partner: You work effectively across departments to align commercial strategies with operational capabilities, build trust internally and externally, and drive meaningful results through collaboration and influence.
  • Make things happen: You have a strong inner drive and you make things happen - even if the path forward is uncertain.

Remote Work at Gigs

At Gigs, we're remote-friendly, with a strong emphasis on meaningful in-person collaboration. While most of our work is done remotely, we encourage our team to connect regularly in our hubs, whether for focused teamwork, customer meetings, or brainstorming sessions that drive creativity.

  • Gigs Pads: Our hubs in San Francisco, London, and Berlin are vibrant spaces where Gigsters come together to connect, collaborate, and create.
  • Gigs Republic: Twice a year, the entire company gathers for in-depth team bonding, strategic sessions, and shared experiences to reinforce our culture and drive growth.

This blend of remote work and in-person collaboration ensures we maintain a dynamic, connected, and innovative team environment.

What We Offer

At Gigs, we believe in rewarding excellence. You'll receive competitive compensation and stock options to ensure you are truly part of our growth. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include stipends for upgrading your home office or work setup, learning and development budgets to support your career growth and a free phone and international data plan (naturally).

If you're excited about pushing boundaries and helping us shape the future of telecom, we'd love to hear from you.

For more information on benefits, Gigs Pads, and life at Gigs, check out our Careers page.

Title: Business Intelligence-Analyst:in
Description:
Wir sind DINA




Mit unseren Technologien schaffen wir die Basis f√ºr funktionale und Cybersicherheit in einer zunehmend automatisierten Welt. Unsere Systeme sorgen daf√ºr, dass Maschinen zuverl√§ssig, sicher und zukunftsf√§hig arbeiten ‚Äì in Branchen, in denen es auf Pr√§zision und Verantwortung ankommt.

Um unsere Entscheidungsprozesse noch st√§rker datenbasiert auszurichten, bauen wir unsere Business-Intelligence-Kompetenz aus ‚Äì und suchen daf√ºr dich.







Deine Aufgaben




Analyse der Customer Journey: Auswertung von Daten aus Marketing, Vertrieb, Customer Success und Support.
Business Dashboards & KPIs: Erstellung und Weiterentwicklung von Reports zu Umsatzentwicklung, Pipeline-Status, Kampagnenerfolg, Kundenzufriedenheit und internen Zielmetriken.
Revenue Operations: Datengetriebene Analyse zur Optimierung von Verkaufs- und Serviceprozessen.
Systemintegration: Unterst√ºtzung bei der Datenanbindung und -qualit√§t zwischen HubSpot (CRM), SAP (ERP) und Web Analytics.
Preis- & Rabatt-Analysen: Bewertung von Rabattstrukturen und Unterst√ºtzung bei strategischen Preisentscheidungen.
Datenstrategie & Teamaufbau: Perspektivisch Mitgestaltung einer unternehmensweiten BI-Architektur und Aufbau eines kleinen BI-Teams.







Dein Profil




Solide BI-Erfahrung: 3‚Äì5 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence oder Data Analytics.
SQL & Visualisierung: Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Erfahrung mit BI-Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker.
Kommerzielles Gesp√ºr: Du verstehst, wie Daten Gesch√§ftsentscheidungen beeinflussen ‚Äì und stellst die richtigen Fragen.
Storytelling mit Daten: Du kannst komplexe Sachverhalte klar visualisieren und verst√§ndlich aufbereiten.
Eigenverantwortung & Struktur: Du gehst Aufgaben proaktiv an und priorisierst eigenst√§ndig.
Technisches Verst√§ndnis: Erfahrung mit Datenintegration (APIs, CRM-/ERP-Anbindungen) ist von Vorteil.
Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du kannst Analysen verst√§ndlich kommunizieren ‚Äì gegen√ºber Fachabteilungen wie Vertrieb und Marketing.







Unsere Benefits




T√§glicher Team-Lunch ‚Äì Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
Firmenfitness ‚Äì Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
Weiterbildung & Coaching ‚Äì Dein Budget f√ºr Schulungen & Konferenzen.
Ausstattung nach Wahl und nach deinen Bed√ºrfnissen.
Mehr Eigenverantwortung ‚Äì Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
Klare Rollen & Transparenz ‚Äì Jeder wei√ü, wer wof√ºr verantwortlich ist.
Gestaltungsspielraum ‚Äì Deine Ideen bewegen etwas ‚Äì in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
Interdisziplin√§re Zusammenarbeit ‚Äì Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge ‚Äì 40 ‚Ç¨ VWL + 25 ‚Ç¨ Zuschuss von uns.
Team-Workshops & Offsites ‚Äì Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
Flexibel & agil ‚Äì Deine Rolle w√§chst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.

Title: IT Process Support (f/m/d) Data Processing Elections Brandenburg
Description:
The Berlin-Brandenburg Statistical Office (AfS) is the partner for up-to-date and reliable data from the capital region. Thanks to us, people, including administration, politics, business and science, can make informed decisions and distinguish between correct and incorrect information. As a public institution, we act independently, neutrally and without commercial interests.

In our staff unit 83 "Elections" we are looking for a as soon as possible:

IT process support (f/m/d)

Data processing elections Brandenburg

Our offer

The Berlin-Brandenburg Statistical Office supports the compatibility of work and family life through flexible working hours and home office options within the scope of official possibilities.

Place of work: Berlin

Duration: unlimited

Remuneration: According to the collective agreement for the public service of the federal states, remuneration group EG 11 TV-L (remuneration table TV-L ( https://oeffentlicher-dienst.info/c/t/rechner/tv-l/allg?id=tv-l-2025&matrix=12c ) , gross annual salary approx. 51,000 - 75,000 EUR). If the requirements are met, a special payment at the end of the year is also possible.

Our benefits


Balancing work, family and private life: With us, you benefit from flexible working hours, home office, 30 days' vacation and days off on 24 and 31 December. Overtime can be compensated within the flexitime framework.
Togetherness: We promote an open corporate culture with regular events to strengthen cohesion, exchange and personal relationships (e.g. staff meetings, company outings, team days).
Individual training and development opportunities: Established onboarding, accompanied by a mentor, enables you to quickly familiarize yourself with your new role and find your feet. We also support you with our extensive further training opportunities.
Health and mobility: We offer you a wide range of sports activities such as urban sports, regular sports and health events (one hour per week can be counted as working time), annual bike checks, discounted use of rental bikes, a subsidy for the Deutschland-Ticket, drinking water dispensers at all locations, ergonomic advice and modern workplace equipment.


Your area of responsibility

In this responsible position, you will support the elections team in the technical preparation, implementation and follow-up of elections and votes in the state of Brandenburg.

As the central contact person, you will be responsible for the following tasks


Process support with support and further development of an AfS internal election database
IT support for election procedures for internal and external users (all administrative levels, in particular district electoral administrations and electoral authorities)
Technical administration of voting procedures
Preparation of elective procedure modules for secure commissioning and use by internal and external users
Participation in the preparation, implementation and evaluation of trial elections, large-scale tests and election events
Introducing and testing additional specialist procedures, processes and new modules of the electoral procedure for users
Documentation for handling the elective procedures, including documents for the user
Professional and technical quality assurance of already documented issues and processes
Preparation of information reports and minutes as well as participation in working groups


Our requirements

Formal requirements: You have a university degree (FH diploma, Bachelor) preferably in the field of computer science or comparable knowledge and skills (completed vocational training as an IT specialist - system integration - with many years of practical work experience and subject-specific further training) or equivalent skills and specialist knowledge.

The following criteria are particularly important for a successful application:


Sound knowledge of the processes involved in the preparation, implementation and follow-up of nationwide and statewide elections
Knowledge of the legal basis for elections and voting as well as federal and state data protection laws
Specialist knowledge of electoral procedures and in the field of IT and the implementation of complex IT procedures
Also desirable:
Specialist knowledge in the field of object-oriented software development for the implementation of technical application logic (possibly Java-based)
Modeling of business processes / (UML, draw.io )
Confident handling of common development tools
Knowledge in the development of client/server processes and broad knowledge of client/server architectures
Sound knowledge of Linux and databases (SQL)


Personality: You focus your work organization on the goals to be achieved, plan and think through complex issues holistically and with foresight and take responsibility for the result. Even in stressful situations and under time pressure, you are able to maintain an overview. You are characterized by your own initiative, but also by your enjoyment of teamwork and a friendly and convincing manner in communication. Your willingness to continuously develop, to participate in training and further education measures and to travel on business rounds off your profile.

Application procedure

Please send applications exclusively electronically by 02.05.2025, quoting the above reference SB 83-2507 to bewerbung@statistik-bbb.de . Please send all the usual documents (cover letter, CV, certificates) in one PDF file (max. 5 MB). If you have any questions in connection with your application, please contact Ms. Rambow on 0331 8173 - 1719.

Our aim is to create a working environment that is free from prejudice. Our employees are valued regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion and ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity. Internal applications and severely disabled people with equal qualifications and suitability are given preferential consideration.

As a precaution, please note that travel expenses to attend the interview will not be reimbursed.
Show more

Our aim is to create a working environment that is free from prejudice. Our employees are valued regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion and ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity. Title: Regional Insight & Analytics Manager Region Central Europe (m/f/d/)
Description:
Job Description

WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO

As Insight & Analytics Manager for Region Central Europe, you will lead our customer insight and analytics agenda to support data-driven decision-making across the business. You‚Äôll translate customer behavior into actionable strategies and play a key role in shaping how we engage, activate, and retain our customers.

You‚Äôll drive our Test & Learn Agenda - working with brand and customer analytics to explore new ideas, validate hypotheses and turn insights into commercial and experience ‚Äì based outcomes. From strategic direction to day-to-day performance, your work will connect insight with impact.

You will:


Lead and develop a regional team of Customer Analysts, Test & Learn Specialist, and Brand Analysts.
Generate insights on customer behavior, preferences, and engagement ‚Äî supporting CRM, marketing, and business planning.
Oversee customer research, data analysis, and segmentation across quantitative and qualitative sources.
Drive the ‚Äútest & learn‚Äù agenda, optimizing media spend and CRM activations through experimentation and performance evaluation.
Use global tools and frameworks to analyze customer journeys and enhance the customer experience.
Translate complex insights into clear, strategic recommendations for cross-functional stakeholders.
Have a clear understanding of analytical methods and tools, to drive and develop the team.



Who You‚Äôll Work With

You‚Äôll be part of the regional Customer Activation & Marketing function and collaborate closely with teams across CRM, Brand & Marketing, E-commerce, Sales, and Global functions.

In this role, you‚Äôll contribute to building a truly customer-centric mindset across Region Central Europe and report directly to the Regional Head of Customer Activation & Marketing.

Who You Are

We are looking for people with‚Ä¶


Proven experience in customer insights, analytics, or research, ideally within the retail industry.
A strong analytical skillset and hands-on experience with customer research methodologies and data tools.
Familiarity with CRM platforms, market research tools, customer journey mapping, and data visualization software.
Experience in leading teams and creating a collaborative, growth-oriented culture.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî able to simplify complexity and present insights in a clear, compelling way.
A strategic mindset with strong business understanding and a focus on turning insight into action.
Good understanding of analytical tools and methods (e.g. SQL).



And people who are ‚Ä¶


Naturally curious and motivated by understanding customer needs.
Structured, insightful, and hands-on.
Collaborative and inclusive ‚Äî guided by our values and passionate about creating meaningful customer experiences.



Who We Are

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE WORKING HERE

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.


Global Employee Discount of 25% on our products at H&M and H&M Group Brands such as ARKET, COS, H&M Home, Weekday, Monki, & Other Stories
Corporate Benefits with special conditions on a wide range of products and services
Holiday Pay
Company Pension Scheme
Employee Assistance Program with Lyra



JOIN US

This is a full-time position, starting in as soon as possible. The role is a hybrid role, based in Berlin or Hamburg with the expectation of working from one of our offices for three days per week.

If you think your experience, skills and ambitions fit this position, please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than the 16th of April.

Due to data privacy policies, we only accept applications via our career page.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things ‚Äì our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it‚Äôs our people who make us who we are.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.


We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things ‚Äì our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it‚Äôs our people who make us who we are.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

  • We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
What we do
READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!


At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability and ESG teams on the frontlines of solving the climate crisis.




We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients‚Äîincluding some of the world's largest firms‚Äîwe‚Äôre already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.




Backed by ‚Ç¨7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We‚Äôre based at the heart of Europe‚Äôs AI revolution‚Äîthe AI Campus in Berlin‚Äîwhere we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.


Your role


As Briink‚Äôs AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink‚Äôs mission to accelerate transition to a sustainable planet. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as exploring new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.





Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.


Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.


Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs and ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring how AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.


Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction and helps achieve our mission.



Your profile

What type of person we're looking for...



Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems from prototyping and experiments through to deployment, evaluation, monitoring and improvement in production.


Practical Implementer: You are a ‚Äòbuilder‚Äô and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.


Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate to drive initiatives forward to success.


Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new models, techniques and technologies in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.


Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.


Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.


Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.



Technical Skills



Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.


Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as modern frameworks (e.g. fastAPI)


Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and chains etc. as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.


Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)


Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e.g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP, Modal). Any experience with cost/latency implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.


Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders. Any other European language would be a bonus.


Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.
Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don‚Äôt fit every requirement‚Äîwe believe in growth, not perfection!



What we offer



Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink‚Äôs future.


Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.


Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.


Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.


Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin‚Äôs hub for AI innovation, you‚Äôll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you‚Äôll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.


Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.





APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission
As part of your application to Briink, please submit a short intro video (maximum of 2 minutes) addressing the following points:





Brief Introduction:



Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role






Passion for building AI/LLMs:



Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it






Alignment with Briink‚Äôs Mission:



Explain why you‚Äôre interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
Technical Guidelines:










Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.


Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.


Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.
Purpose of the Video:


This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We‚Äôre interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink‚Äôs mission and culture.


No cover letter is required!
Where to submit the video:


You can submit the video using this form:


Alternatively you can use the video submission request box and/or file upload feature if this is available on the channel you are applying from

Teil des Traineeprogramms werden z.B. fachliche und technologische Trainings, Schulungen und Arbeitsmethoden sein, welche mit einer SAP-Zertifizierung abschlie√üen.

Analytics ‚Äì¬†Du leitest aus den Gesch√§ftsprozessen die Anforderungen an die Business-Analytics-L√∂sungen ab und entwickelst ganzheitliche Anwendungen. Unsere Beratungsteams begleiten in allen Phasen der Projektrealisierung: Von der Anforderungs- und Bedarfsanalyse √ºber die Erstellung betriebswirtschaftlicher Konzepte, bis zur Realisierung und Implementierung.

Beratungsfunktion¬†‚Äì Wir beraten unsere Kunden in den Themen rund um SAP Business and Analytics, SAP Business Intelligence, SAP S/4HANA (Embedded Analytics) und SAP HANA Cloud.

Datenanalyse ‚Äì¬†Mit Werkzeugen aus den Bereichen Big Data, Predictive Analytics, Business AI, Cloud Computing, Business Analytics und Business Intelligence deckst du das gesamte Spektrum der Datenanalyse ab.

¬†

Das bringst du mit

¬†

Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Ingenieurwesens, der Mathematik, der Statistik oder eines verwandten Fachbereichs hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen oder stehst kurz davor.

Du bist begeistert davon, dich mit den Feldern Business and Analytics und Business AI auseinanderzusetzen und in diesem Umfeld L√∂sungen mit unseren Kunden zu entwickeln.

Idealerweise kannst du erste Erfahrungen in Form von Praktika oder Werkstundentent√§tigkeiten im Bereich Business and Analytics oder Business AI vorweisen.

Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift bringst du mit.

Das Traineeprogramm startet zum¬†01.10.2025.

¬†

Deine Benefits

Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die M√∂glichkeit, im Home Office sowie in √ºber 40 L√§ndern zu arbeiten.

Masterf√∂rderung ‚Äì Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Dar√ºber hinaus bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit einer Masterf√∂rderung f√ºr Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Restliche √úberstunden werden einmal j√§hrlich ausgezahlt.

Gesundheit ‚Äì Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von verg√ºnstigten Beitr√§gen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles ‚Äì Wir m√∂chten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten m√∂glich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

¬†

¬†

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu l√∂sen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Finance Transformation Teams unterst√ºtzt du Unternehmen dabei, ihre Finanzabteilung zu einem noch st√§rkeren Businesspartner zu machen und so die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit des gesamten Unternehmens schneller voranzutreiben. Dabei ist unser Themenspektrum breit: Von CFO-Strategie √ºber Process Excellence, ERP-Systemen, Quality Assurance, Compliance und Data Management. Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette sicher.
