Title: Business Analyst - Data, Analytics & Insights
Description:
Description

Join our team and what we'll accomplish together

The TELUS Health Digital Transformation is a dynamic, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial group dedicated to supporting data-driven decisions for various TELUS Health products globally. The team focuses on solving complex problems that significantly impact customers and is committed to delivering a seamless digital customer experience. The TELUS Health Digital Transformation team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS Health become a world-class leader in Healthcare delivery, leveraging Technology and Artificial Intelligence products and solutions. We achieve this by delivering AI and data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, improving the experience and efficiencies of our patients, clients, clinicians and agents. We are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big advancement in Technology to support our team.

The Business Analyst, will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions within the context of Artificial Intelligence (AI), data analytics, and insights generation. This position requires a blend of analytical skills, data privacy and security acumen in health context and a strong understanding of AI and data technologies.

What You‚Äôll Do



Conduct stakeholder interviews and workshops to gather and document business requirements related to AI, data, and insights.
Analyze existing systems and processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization using AI and data-driven solutions.
Translate business requirements into detailed functional and technical specifications.
Create user stories, use cases, and process flow diagrams.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand data sources, data models, and data pipelines.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Develop reports and dashboards to visualize data and present findings to stakeholders in Looker and Looker Studio via Big Query.
Identify and address data Privacy and Security issues
Participate in project planning and execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Track project progress and communicate updates to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, engineering, and business units.
Facilitate communication and collaboration between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Create and maintain documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and user guides.
Develop training materials and conduct training sessions for users on AI and data-driven solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in AI, data analytics, and business analysis.



Qualifications

What you bring



Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or another cloud provider.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst.
Experience working with AI, data analytics, or business intelligence projects.
Confidence in communicating complex technical ideas to diverse audiences.
Advanced expertise in data analytics and visualization tools (Looker/Tableau), strong SQL skills, and experience with Vertex AI and Python.
Experience building data procedures and scheduling and orchestrating data pipelines.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform
Strong understanding of health data
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) and source control (GitHub).
Exposure to financial reporting
Solid background in project management and the ability to communicate and influence stakeholders.



Great-to-haves



Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) and source control (GitHub).
Exposure to data privacy and security principals

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Duration: 12 Months

Location: Remote (Physically present in Canada + EST Time Zone)

Mandatory: GoC Reliability Clearance Required




We are seeking a Data Anlyst with manager experience for one of our client. The client has embarked on a digital transformation journey to become a more customer focused digital organization. Key to achieving the digital transformation is the data and analytics strategy. Over the last year, to enable the Digital transformation and data analytics strategy, the client has invested in developing a consolidated enterprise data platform on Azure cloud.

The Data Analyst will lead the design and implementation of data and technology solutions for the enterprise data platform. The selected candidate will be responsible for analyzing information requirements, recommending options for business and technology solutions, deliver blueprints for design, and implement them so they are aligned with client's information strategies and governance standards. The individual is experienced in information requirements collection and analysis, data modeling, and data integration. The data analysis service provider needs to quickly come up to speed on current state information architecture and familiarize themselves with client's information management context.




Primary Responsibilities

Collecting, documenting, and analyzing data requirements through document analysis and reverse engineering legacy ETL builds.
Designs and implements data solutions using client's data platform technologies
Creates, reviews and validates conceptual, logical, and physical data models of applications to determine compatibility and fit with architectural principles and optimal solution design.
Designs, creates and optimizes data flows for migration methods of existing data.
Works collaboratively with information governance analysts and data architects to ensure that data models and structures are compliant with governance standards.
Communicates requirements, issues, and options for resolutions to various stakeholders and tailors messages to the audience.




Project Requirements

Understand existing applications, data stores and structures, data flows and elements.
Reverse engineer legacy ETL to modernize it for the enterprise data platform
Design and implement future state architectures and data solutions
Over 7 years of demonstrated experience in SQL programming and refactoring
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with reverse engineering legacy ETL builds (Data Manager) and source-to-target mappings to design and build future data assets
Well-rounded hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, SQL programming and ETL development.
Experience implementing medallion architecture in Databricks
Programming experience in SQL, Python and Apache Spark
Validation/ testing of developed data solutions by comparing to existing or proxy datasets
Experience with Microsoft Azure or other public cloud offerings
Experience in Agile delivery
Experience in IBM Data Manager
Ability to understand, interpret, develop and maintain requirements and design documents
Excellent verbal and written communication, critical thinking, time management, priority planning and interpersonal skills.




Assets

Experience with ERWIN or similar data modelling tool
Experience with Denodo data virtualization
Experience with Power BI report development
Bilingualism in both official languages (English and French)




We thank you for visiting the job page. Only candidates closely matching the requirement will be contacted for interview. Wishing you all the best in your job search.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
Posting Closes: April 18, 2025

Employment Status: Full-Time, Temporary (until August 29, 2025), Remote

Servus is growing! We are currently looking for a full-time temporary Summer Data Intern in Calgary, AB or Edmonton, AB.

Servus Credit Union is Alberta's largest member-owned credit union, known for building strong, resilient communities by helping our members feel good about their money. One of Canada's Best Managed Companies for 20 consecutive years and ranked as one of the top banks in Canada on Forbes World's Best Banks list for two years in a row, as well as being a 2024 Forbes Best Employer Company, we are a team of smart, gutsy, and driven individuals.

The Data Intern is a member of the Data Management team which provides solutions, best practices, and supports all areas of the organization with the data flowing in and out of the Credit Union. The team focuses on three main areas: Data Technology which focuses on all the support of data on the back end technology and management of our enterprise Datawarehouse; Data Integration & Transformation which acquires, cleanses, and transforms data from various sources; and Data Governance which provides guidance to safeguard and handle our data.

This role is accountable to support the data team goals, including maintenance and support on projects. This is a junior entry-level role with the opportunity to learn with other data experts in the field and contribute to helping move Servus toward a data driven organization.

Responsibilities will focus on assist with tasks related to data analysis and management. This might include tasks such as:


Collecting and cleaning data from various sources
Organizing and storing data in a database
Analyzing data using statistical techniques and software such as SQL
Creating visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
Assisting with data-driven projects and decision-making
Assisting in the creation of technical documentation
Collaborating with other team members on data-related tasks


The specific responsibilities for this role may vary depending on the Data Team goals and the specific project(s) the student will be working on.

NOTE: Intern will be provided with specific deliverables upon successful recruitment.

Requirements


Basic skill level in SQL and/or Python.
Post-secondary education in computer technology or IT related discipline from an accredited institution.
Show more

  • Collaborating with other team members on data-related tasks

The specific responsibilities for this role may vary depending on the Data Team goals and the specific project(s) the student will be working on.

NOTE: Intern will be provided with specific deliverables upon successful recruitment.

Requirements

  • Basic skill level in SQL and/or Python.
  • Post-secondary education in computer technology or IT related discipline from an accredited institution.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
Posting Closes: April 18, 2025

Employment Status: Full-Time, Temporary (until August 29, 2025), Remote

Servus is growing! We are currently looking for a full-time temporary Summer Data Intern in Calgary, AB or Edmonton, AB.

Servus Credit Union is Alberta's largest member-owned credit union, known for building strong, resilient communities by helping our members feel good about their money. One of Canada's Best Managed Companies for 20 consecutive years and ranked as one of the top banks in Canada on Forbes World's Best Banks list for two years in a row, as well as being a 2024 Forbes Best Employer Company, we are a team of smart, gutsy, and driven individuals.

The Data Intern is a member of the Data Management team which provides solutions, best practices, and supports all areas of the organization with the data flowing in and out of the Credit Union. The team focuses on three main areas: Data Technology which focuses on all the support of data on the back end technology and management of our enterprise Datawarehouse; Data Integration & Transformation which acquires, cleanses, and transforms data from various sources; and Data Governance which provides guidance to safeguard and handle our data.

This role is accountable to support the data team goals, including maintenance and support on projects. This is a junior entry-level role with the opportunity to learn with other data experts in the field and contribute to helping move Servus toward a data driven organization.

Responsibilities will focus on assist with tasks related to data analysis and management. This might include tasks such as:


Collecting and cleaning data from various sources
Organizing and storing data in a database
Analyzing data using statistical techniques and software such as SQL
Creating visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
Assisting with data-driven projects and decision-making
Assisting in the creation of technical documentation
Collaborating with other team members on data-related tasks


The specific responsibilities for this role may vary depending on the Data Team goals and the specific project(s) the student will be working on.

NOTE: Intern will be provided with specific deliverables upon successful recruitment.

Requirements


Basic skill level in SQL and/or Python.
Post-secondary education in computer technology or IT related discipline from an accredited institution.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ambyint is a SaaS company that provides an Industrial IoT platform, leveraging physics-influenced AI models, plus closed-loop control to enable autonomous operations. As a result, we are an instrumental part of the climate technology evolution and a market leader in production optimization for the energy industry. We deliver step-change improvements to our customers by combining advanced physics, subject matter expertise, and data-informed insights with AI to automate operations and production optimization workflows. We‚Äôre coming off a strong year and are setting even higher ambitions for the future. To help us reach the next level, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our team.

As a Data Analyst at Ambyint, you will report to the Data Science & Data Engineering Lead. In this role, you will be integral in the development and continuous improvement of our artificial lift optimization software. You‚Äôll work closely with both the Data Science and Software teams to wrangle, contextualize, and visualize data using scalable cloud-based technologies and business intelligence tools. Your expertise will help turn complex data into actionable insights and improve the product‚Äôs value proposition.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and is passionate about driving meaningful insights through data analysis. If you have experience in data visualization and cloud-based technologies, and you want to make a direct impact on a cutting-edge product, we‚Äôd love to meet you.

What You'll Do


Work independently and collaboratively to deliver high-impact data products that directly contribute to the success of our artificial lift optimization platform
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to wrangle, contextualize, and visualize data using various BI tools and cloud-based technologies
Develop, enhance, and maintain interactive dashboards for OT/IT/ET data visualization and analysis
Translate complex numbers, facts, and metrics into actionable insights for decision-making using your analytical skills and data visualization techniques
Focus on open standards and open-source solutions, prioritizing them over proprietary solutions whenever possible
Work with cross-functional teams to design scalable cloud-based processes that support analysis, product development, and commercial initiatives
Participate in a strong team environment, exploring new ideas through experimentation, prototyping, and rapid feedback cycles
Live, breathe, and work in the Cloud to ensure seamless integration with our platform
Embrace Agile methodologies such as SCRUM and Kanban to drive efficiency and ensure timely delivery of projects


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
2+ years of experience in a data analyst role, with a focus on cloud-based technologies and data visualization
Proficiency in business intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Strong knowledge of relational data concepts and mastery of SQL for developing analytical data products
Expertise in data wrangling, data analysis, and data visualization techniques
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and cloud-based data analysis tools
Familiarity with ETL/ELT processes (dbt) and working with structured and unstructured data
Experience working with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (SCRUM, Kanban)
Strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
Excellent communication skills to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate data products


What Sets You Apart


You take pride in transforming complex data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions.
You‚Äôre efficient, organized, and committed to delivering high-quality results on time.
Collaboration is key to your success, and you thrive when working with diverse teams.
You‚Äôre always learning and improving, constantly seeking better ways to approach data analysis.
You enjoy experimenting with new ideas, prototypes, and concepts to drive innovation.
You embrace feedback as an opportunity for growth, not a critique.
You‚Äôre passionate about building user-friendly, impactful data solutions that add value to customers.


What Sets Us Apart

Ambyint is a scale-up company, possessing all the exciting edginess of a start-up with solutions that are proven and advancing daily. We pride ourselves on the strength of our team and company, and the positive environmental impact we are driving. We live by a simple and effective set of values.

What‚Äôs In It For You

The opportunity to make a difference in a cutting-edge technology company that is highly spirited and focused on being a leading contributor in the energy transition space. We offer an environment steeped in creating a rewarding professional experience and having some fun along the way. We work in a hybrid working environment with a diverse and talented team. We have a passion for taking on big challenges to create a wealth of opportunities and we will support your development and career goals. Additionally, we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package.

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, & INCLUSION

At Ambyint, diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the core of who we are. Our commitment to these values is unwavering ‚Äì across all of our work, teams, and interactions with customers. They are central to our mission and to our impact. The understanding that having varied perspectives and backgrounds helps generate richer ideas to solve the complex problems of a changing, and increasingly diverse world is paramount to who we are and how we work together as a team.

If you are a passionate professional that likes to work in a diverse team environment supporting an entrepreneurial culture with a focus on delivering exceptional value for our customers, we invite you to apply. This is your opportunity to join a growing company offering a competitive base salary and benefits.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You‚Äôve come to the right place!

Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsR√©alis. AtkinsR√©alis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

AtkinsR√©alis' Major Projects division is in search of a Data & Reporting Analyst to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Toronto.‚ÄØThe Data & Reporting Analyst role will be part of a high-performing project team that is dedicated to delivering this complex undertaking through collaboration and a best-for-project vision.‚ÄØ

This position is a fulltime contractual role for a 6 month term based in Toronto.

Your Role Within The Team


Develop and implement Data process maps and project-specific workflows and processes.
Collect data from multiple sources, such as databases, APIs, or external systems and create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data insights clearly and effectively using Power BI, Excel, VBA, Power Automate and SharePoint.
Manage large datasets and ensure the proper storage and retrieval processes are in place.
Transform data into a structured format suitable for analysis, applying necessary formatting or aggregation techniques.
Work closely with team members to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks.
Manage IT requirements with parent companies and ensure IT issues are resolved in a timely manner.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports, including providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing, as well as training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of Construction tools such as Procore, Aconex, Oracle P6 would be an asset.


Why choose AtkinsR√©alis as an employer?

Because We Offer


The opportunity to work on an innovative and award-winning project.
An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
Competitive compensation package.
A work environment focused on health and safety.


The Ideal Candidate


2 - 4 years of analytics or data visualization experience
Experience with industry standard reporting tools including Power BI, Excel, VBA, Power Automate and SharePoint.
Experience with data quality assurance processes, methodology and tools, quality assurance testing and implementation methods and practices to ensure the integrity of data and to identify data inefficiencies.
Expertise in data collection/management techniques and interpretation of data to determine requirements, retrieve, analyze, deliver insights and recommendations.
General understanding of program controls disciplines including schedule, cost, risk, and scope management and the associated performance metrics.
Flexibility to work at least 3 times per week on-site.


Are you up for this challenge? Apply today and join our team to help engineer a Better Future for our Planet and its People.

At AtkinsR√©alis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

AtkinsR√©alis cares about your privacy. AtkinsR√©alis and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of AtkinsR√©alis (referred to throughout as ‚ÄúAtkinsR√©alis‚Äù) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to AtkinsR√©alis, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about AtkinsR√©alis‚Äô accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are¬†

Talize is a proudly Canadian owned and operated for-profit thrift retailer.¬† At Talize, we aspire to challenge boundaries and make fashion sustainable, unique, and affordable ‚Äì we recognize the importance of shopping sustainably.¬† We‚Äôre passionate about sustainable fashion because we know we‚Äôre helping the planet at the same time as providing our customers with amazing value!¬† That means offering unbeatable prices on brand names, designer fashions, accessories, leather goods, footwear, housewares, book, toys and more ‚Äì all while contributing to the health and sustainability of our planet.

At Talize, you'll be serving the community by helping them lead a more sustainable lifestyle.¬† A place with unlimited opportunities to learn and grow while unleashing your highest potential each day.¬† You'll be part of a ‚Äúpeople and customer first‚Äù culture; a workplace that is fun, fast paced, collaborative, diverse and inclusive.¬† We provide a productive work environment, where every perspective is valued.¬† Talize also takes a holistic approach for providing great benefits and rewarding employees.

¬†

Who You Are¬†

The ideal candidate is proactive, agile, and business savvy individual who is committed to getting better everyday. ¬†You are a passionate influencer with strong communication skills, who is open to giving and receiving feedback.¬† You are customer-centric with an ability to act as a mentor amongst your peers.¬† Of course, you also deliver consistent results by aligning yourself with Talize‚Äôs values.¬†¬†

The Role

¬†

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Insights Analyst to join our retail team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing retail data, generating actionable insights, and supporting business decision-making. This role requires expertise in data analysis, visualization (Tableau), and ad-hoc reporting to drive strategic initiatives and optimize retail performance.

Work Location: Its an onsite role located at 67 Alexdon Road, Unit A, North York, ON M3J 2B5

Salary: $60,000 - $65000 PA

Duties and Responsibilities

Departmental Duties

¬†

Data Analysis & Insights Generation:


Analyze sales, inventory, customer behavior, and operational data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.
Develop and deliver actionable insights that support business strategies and improve retail performance.
Conduct deep-dive analysis to evaluate promotion effectiveness
Interpret complex data sets and translate them into meaningful business recommendations.


Reporting & Visualization:


Create and maintain Tableau dashboards and reports to provide real-time visibility into key business metrics.
Automate and optimize reporting processes to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Collaborate with business teams to design reports that meet stakeholder needs.


Ad-Hoc Analysis & Business Support:


Perform ad-hoc data analysis to answer business questions and provide insights on specific challenges.
Support cross-functional teams, including marketing and operations, with data-driven recommendations.
Work closely with IT and data teams to ensure data integrity, quality, and consistency.


Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:


Partner with business leaders to understand strategic objectives and data needs.
Continuously identify opportunities to improve data analysis methodologies, reporting tools, and processes.
Stay updated on retail industry trends, consumer behaviors, and analytics best practices.


Core Competencies


Communication: effective verbal and written communication skills are crucial for conveying ideas, collaborating with colleagues, and presenting information clearly.
Adaptability: the ability to quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.
Problem Solving: the capacity to identify challenges, analyze them, and develop practical solutions.
Time Management: efficiently managing one's own time and tasks to meet deadlines and goals.
Teamwork: collaborating with others, valuing diversity of perspectives, and contributing to group success.
Technical Proficiency: proficiency in the necessary tools, software, and equipment relevant to the individual's role.
Critical Thinking: the ability to evaluate information and make informed decisions based on evidence and logic.
Self-Motivation: taking initiative and being proactive in pursuing personal and professional development.
Emotional Intelligence: understanding and managing one's emotions and effectively relating to others in the workplace.
Ethical and Professional Behavior: demonstrating integrity, honesty, and professionalism in all interactions.


¬†

Education, Experience and Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's Degree¬†in¬†Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Science
Proficiency in SQL and database management;
Strong expertise in Tableau
Strong SQL skills
Expert ability in Excel required.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in deep dive analysis of retail data (transactional, product, customer level data)
At least 2 years of experience


Physical Requirements and work environment:

Physical Requirements:


Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Ability to concentrate and analyze data for extended periods of time.


Work Environment:


Primarily office-based on-site work environment for increased collaboration and teamwork.
Fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with frequent collaboration across departments.
Regular use of analytics platforms, dashboards, and business intelligence tools.
May occasionally require attendance at meetings or presentations outside standard working hours.
Open office or virtual team setting with regular interaction via video calls, emails, and chat platforms.


Talize is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment, where all Team Members and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We thank you for your interest in employment opportunities at Talize.¬† Please note, only the candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.¬† Talize welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.¬† Accommodations are availabl
e on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

  • Self-Motivation: taking initiative and being proactive in pursuing personal and professional development.
  • Emotional Intelligence: understanding and managing one's emotions and effectively relating to others in the workplace.
  • Ethical and Professional Behavior: demonstrating integrity, honesty, and professionalism in all interactions.

 

Education, Experience and Requirements

  • Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Science
  • Proficiency in SQL and database management;
  • Strong expertise in Tableau
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Expert ability in Excel required.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience in deep dive analysis of retail data (transactional, product, customer level data)
  • At least 2 years of experience

Physical Requirements and work environment:

Physical Requirements:

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Ability to concentrate and analyze data for extended periods of time.

Work Environment:

  • Primarily office-based on-site work environment for increased collaboration and teamwork.
  • Fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with frequent collaboration across departments.
  • Regular use of analytics platforms, dashboards, and business intelligence tools.
  • May occasionally require attendance at meetings or presentations outside standard working hours.
  • Open office or virtual team setting with regular interaction via video calls, emails, and chat platforms.

Talize is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment, where all Team Members and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We thank you for your interest in employment opportunities at Talize.  Please note, only the candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.  Talize welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are availabl
e on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Executive Assistant
Description:
About Us

Sophos is a global leader and innovator of advanced security solutions for defeating cyberattacks. The company acquired Secureworks in February 2025, bringing together two pioneers that have redefined the cybersecurity industry with their innovative, native AI-optimized services, technologies and products. Sophos is now the largest pure-play Managed Detection and Response (MDR) provider, supporting more than 28,000 organizations. In addition to MDR and other services, Sophos‚Äô complete portfolio includes industry-leading endpoint, network, email, and cloud security that interoperate and adapt to defend through the Sophos Central platform. Secureworks provides the innovative, market-leading Taegis XDR/MDR, identity threat detection and response (ITDR), next-gen SIEM capabilities, managed risk, and a comprehensive set of advisory services. Sophos sells all these solutions through reseller partners, Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Managed Security Service Providers (MSSPs) worldwide, defending more than 600,000 organizations worldwide from phishing, ransomware, data theft, other every day and state-sponsored cybercrimes. The solutions are powered by historical and real-time threat intelligence from Sophos X-Ops and the newly added Counter Threat Unit (CTU). Sophos is headquartered in Oxford, U.K. More information is available at www.sophos.com.




Role Summary

The Executive Assistant (EA) provides high-level administrative support three (3) VPs (VP,CX Strategy and Operations, VP, Global Service Delivery and VP, Global Renewals). This role requires a proactive, organized, and highly adaptable professional who can manage complex schedules, coordinate logistics, and serve as a liaison between the executive and various stakeholders. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong communication, problem-solving skills, and the ability to handle confidential information with discretion.




What You Will Do
Calendar and Schedule Management:
Manage and maintain the executive's calendar by scheduling meetings, appointments, and events, ensuring optimal time management and minimal conflicts
Coordinate travel arrangements including flights, hotel bookings, transportation, and itineraries
Prepare and organize executive‚Äôs daily agenda, prioritizing tasks, and ensuring timely preparation for meetings and events
Meeting Coordination and Support:
Organize and facilitate meetings by preparing agendas, taking minutes, and following up on action items
Coordinate logistics for board meetings, client meetings, and other important engagements
Ensure all materials and presentations are prepared and organized for meetings, providing any necessary background information
Project Management and Support:
Prepare, proofread, and format communications, presentations, and reports for the executive
Assist with project coordination, ensuring deadlines and deliverables are met
Assist with the preparation of reports, presentations, and spreadsheets
Track progress on key initiatives and provide regular updates to executives as necessary
Help prioritize projects and allocate resources effectively
Travel and Event Coordination:
Coordinate executive travel arrangements, including booking flights, hotels, and transportation, ensuring seamless travel experiences
Assist with organizing corporate events, conferences, or team-building activities, handling logistics, accommodations, and communication with attendees
Relationship Management:
Serve as a liaison between the executive and other internal/external stakeholders, such as employees, clients, board members, and vendors
Build and maintain professional relationships across various teams, departments, and external partners
Confidentiality and Data Management:
Manage confidential and sensitive information with the utmost discretion and professionalism
Organize and maintain files, documents, and records related to executive projects and business operations
General Administrative Support:
Handle expense reports, reimbursements, and manage petty cash for executive-related activities
Assist in any other administrative tasks as needed to ensure the smooth running of the executive office





What You Will Bring
3+ years of experience in an executive assistant or administrative support role, preferably supporting senior-level executives
Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a professional and polished demeanor
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other office productivity tools
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion and professionalism
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with people at all levels
Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
Experience with project management tools and scheduling software is a plus
Occasional travel may be required








In Canada, the base salary for this role ranges from $64,000 to $106,000. In addition to base salary, we offer additional¬† compensation including bonus eligibility and a comprehensive benefits package. ‚ÄØA candidate‚Äôs specific pay within this range will depend on a variety of factors, including job-related skills, training, location, experience, relevant education, certifications, and other business and organizational needs.¬†

#B1




Ready to Join Us?

At Sophos, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives to fuel innovation. Research shows that candidates sometimes hesitate to apply if they don't check every box in a job description. We challenge that notion. Your unique experiences and skills might be exactly what we need to enhance our team. Don't let a checklist hold you back ‚Äì¬†we encourage you to apply.

What's Great About Sophos?

¬∑¬† ¬†Sophos operates a remote-first working model, making remote work the primary option for most employees. However, some roles may necessitate a hybrid approach. Please refer to the location details in our job postings for further information.

¬∑¬† ¬†Our people ‚Äì we innovate and create, all of which are accompanied by a great sense of fun and team spirit

¬∑¬† ¬†Employee-led diversity and inclusion networks that build community and provide education and advocacy

¬∑¬† ¬†Annual charity and fundraising initiatives and volunteer days for employees to support local communities

¬∑¬† ¬†Global employee sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental footprint

¬∑¬† ¬†Global fitness and trivia competitions to keep our bodies and minds sharp

¬∑¬† ¬†Global wellbeing days for employees to relax and recharge¬†

¬∑¬† ¬†Monthly wellbeing webinars and training to support employee health and wellbeing

Our Commitment To You

We‚Äôre proud of the diverse and inclusive environment we have at Sophos, and we‚Äôre committed to ensuring equality of opportunity.¬† ¬†We believe that diversity, combined with excellence, builds a better Sophos, so we encourage applicants who can contribute to the diversity of our team.¬† All applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, sex, gender reassignment, marital status, race, religion or belief, color, age, military veteran status, disability, pregnancy, maternity or sexual orientation.¬† We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know.¬†

Data Protection

If you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos.¬† If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights.¬† For more information on Sophos‚Äô data protection practices, please consult our Privacy Policy Cybersecurity as a Service Delivered | Sophos

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Contract: 1 year

Location: Remote within Canada




Requirements:

Experience in existing applications, data stores and structures, data flows, and elements.
Must know reverse engineer legacy ETL to modernize it for the enterprise data platform
Experience in designing and implementing future state architecture and data solutions
Over 7 years of demonstrated experience in SQL programming and refactoring
Experience with reverse engineering legacy ETL builds (Data Manager) and source-to-target mappings to design and build future data assets
Well-rounded hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, SQL programming, and ETL development.
Experience implementing medallion architecture in Databricks
Programming experience in SQL, Python, and Apache Spark
Validation/ testing of developed data solutions by comparing to existing or proxy datasets
Experience with Microsoft Azure or other public cloud offerings
Experience in Agile delivery
Experience in IBM Data Manager
Experience with ERWIN or a similar data modelling tool
Experience with Denodo data virtualization
Experience with Power BI report development

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
Insight Global is looking for a Financial Data Consultant to join the team at one of our top banking clients on a hybrid basis in Downtown Toronto for a 6 month contract with potential extensions. The Senior Consultant, Funding and Liquidity Management is a key member of the Liquidity Solutions Team. Reporting to the Director, the Senior Consultant will be responsible for designing and implementing innovative liquidity reporting solutions while collaborating closely with business units, data teams, and technology partners to facilitate effective and efficient outcomes. This position involves designing and executing changes to a robust liquidity framework to enhance accuracy, timeliness and transparency. Additionally, the Senior Consultant prepares and presents detailed analysis or reporting to senior executives, supporting the liquidity risk framework of the bank. With strong analytical skills, a collaborative mindset, and a keen interest in liquidity management practices, the Senior Consultant plays a vital role in enhancing the banks liquidity reporting capabilities and ensuring alignment with the bank's strategic objectives.




Must-haves:

- 3+ years experience in Finance, Treasury, Risk (Market Risk, Credit Risk)

- Holding or pursuing designation of CFA or FRM

‚óã Understanding of common financial terms such as assets, liabilities, repos, etc

- Treasury and Liquidity experience

- Strong SQL skills

‚óã Writing SQL queries, developing automated solutions in SQL

- Data Management, Big Data Experience Experience as a Data Analyst, Business Systems Analyst or Developer with Financial background is ideal

Title: Analyst, Data Services
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Data Services group within Capital Markets is responsible for ensuring data quality and accuracy to support critical business operations. We are looking for an experienced and well-rounded Analyst to join our high-performing Reconciliation Data Services team. As an Analyst in this space, you will be expected to serve as the bridge between technical data analysts and operational stakeholders within downstream teams, enabling data-led decisions and operational efficiencies.

This role requires a candidate who can strike the right balance between technical proficiency, business acumen, and stakeholder management. You will help drive meaningful discussions with stakeholders, turning data-driven metrics into actionable insights, and fostering a collaborative problem-solving environment. If you are passionate about financial markets, data-driven decision-making, and process improvement, this role offers a chance to make a significant impact and contribute to our team's success.

What will you do?


Monitor and analyze metrics to detect key trends and identify systemic issues, and work to implement strategic plans for resolution
Facilitate stakeholder forums with upstream and downstream teams to review metrics, address queries, and foster accountability
Present findings and provide updates in a way that is accessible and meaningful to non-technical stakeholders and drive discussions on remediation plans
Build and maintain strong relationships with business users and IT partners at both senior and junior levels
Support team's growth by improving the quality of reporting and deepening the team's understanding of reconciliation operations
Prepare and maintain clear, well-structured documentation covering processes and action plans, and regularly share updates with team leadership and stakeholders to ensure transparency


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience presenting data and insights clearly to diverse stakeholders
Strong knowledge of financial markets and capital markets, particularly with associated operational workflows
Strong problem-solving ability to identify patterns and trends using metrics and data
Proficiency in SQL with intermediate skills for data querying and reporting
Advanced Excel skills, including experience generating pivot tables and formulas
Post-secondary education in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related field


Nice-to-have


Familiarity with visualization platforms like Tableau
Knowledge of reconciliation platforms or financial systems
Knowledge of different reconciliation types, such as cash, position, trade, and data reference
Understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting
Strong understanding of data lifecycles, including focus on data governance
Experience with data science methodologies, including machine learning and advanced pattern recognition.


What's in it for you?

We thrive on our challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


Interaction with a wide variety of departments within Capital Markets
The opportunity to work on projects relating to bank wide data initiatives
Work collaboratively with business partners, IT and Data management in order to deliver new capabilities effectively
Stay close to industry best practices in account, client data and KYC management
Apply interpersonal and influencing skills to develop strong relationships with the Data Management team, Data Management IT, stakeholders across RBC CM, and individuals participating in the various data project streams
Communicate effectively with RBC CM professionals at varying levels of seniority, including applying insight to determine the business impact of data issues that may arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of data which can be supported through better governance.


Job Skills

Agile Methodology, Business Data Analysis, Business Process Modeling, Commercial Acumen, Communication, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Group Problem Solving, Interpersonal Relationship Management, Requirements Analysis

Address

Additional Job Details

90 WESTERN PKY:BEDFORD

City

BEDFORD

Country

Canada

Work Hours/week

37.5

Employment Type

Full time

Platform

CAPITAL MARKETS

Job Type

Regular

Pay Type

Salaried

Posted Date

2025-04-14

Application Deadline

2025-04-28

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

What will you do?

  • Monitor and analyze metrics to detect key trends and identify systemic issues, and work to implement strategic plans for resolution
  • Facilitate stakeholder forums with upstream and downstream teams to review metrics, address queries, and foster accountability
  • Present findings and provide updates in a way that is accessible and meaningful to non-technical stakeholders and drive discussions on remediation plans
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with business users and IT partners at both senior and junior levels
  • Support team's growth by improving the quality of reporting and deepening the team's understanding of reconciliation operations
  • Prepare and maintain clear, well-structured documentation covering processes and action plans, and regularly share updates with team leadership and stakeholders to ensure transparency

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience presenting data and insights clearly to diverse stakeholders
  • Strong knowledge of financial markets and capital markets, particularly with associated operational workflows
  • Strong problem-solving ability to identify patterns and trends using metrics and data
  • Proficiency in SQL with intermediate skills for data querying and reporting
  • Advanced Excel skills, including experience generating pivot tables and formulas
  • Post-secondary education in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related field

Nice-to-have

  • Familiarity with visualization platforms like Tableau
  • Knowledge of reconciliation platforms or financial systems
  • Knowledge of different reconciliation types, such as cash, position, trade, and data reference
  • Understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting
  • Strong understanding of data lifecycles, including focus on data governance
  • Experience with data science methodologies, including machine learning and advanced pattern recognition.

What's in it for you?

We thrive on our challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Interaction with a wide variety of departments within Capital Markets
  • The opportunity to work on projects relating to bank wide data initiatives
  • Work collaboratively with business partners, IT and Data management in order to deliver new capabilities effectively
  • Stay close to industry best practices in account, client data and KYC management
  • Apply interpersonal and influencing skills to develop strong relationships with the Data Management team, Data Management IT, stakeholders across RBC CM, and individuals participating in the various data project streams
  • Communicate effectively with RBC CM professionals at varying levels of seniority, including applying insight to determine the business impact of data issues that may arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of data which can be supported through better governance.

Job Skills

Agile Methodology, Business Data Analysis, Business Process Modeling, Commercial Acumen, Communication, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Group Problem Solving, Interpersonal Relationship Management, Requirements Analysis

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Products & Insights
Description:
Job Summary

The role of the Data Products & Insights Senior Analytics Manager within the CAE Group is to drive digital transformation by developing data-driven solutions for internal audit. You will work within a high-throughput, global audit analytics team of like-minded individuals, developing sustainable, scalable, and reusable data products that enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness as part of the strategy to digitally transform the RBC CAE Group.

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective‚Äî with a coordinated view across the entire business‚Äîto deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

Job Description


Lead the design, development, and implementation of innovative data products that enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness.
Conduct in-depth analysis of large and complex datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and key risk indicators before translating findings into actionable insights for audit teams.
Ensure the quality, accuracy and integrity of data used to perform analytics during audit engagements.
Develop and implement automated processes to improve efficiency, reduce manual effort, and enhance scalability of audit analytics solutions.
Collaborate closely with audit teams to gather requirements and translate them into effective analytics solutions. Partner with other teams in the CAE Digital Innovation, Data & Analytics group to adhere to data governance standards, identify and onboard new datasets into the CAE analytics ecosystem.
Stay abreast of emerging technology, methods, and best practices around analytics and audit. Research and pilot new ideas to push boundaries and enhance audit capabilities.
Guide and mentor junior data analysts on the team.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have :


5-7 years of relevant experience in data analytics, with strong proficiency in Python/R, SQL and data visualization software.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Financial Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences.


Job Skills

Actionable Insights, Analytical Thinking, Big Data Analytics, Critical Analysis, Critical Thinking, Data Administration, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Mining, Data Modeling, Data Movement, Detail-Oriented, Emerging Technologies, Group Problem Solving, Independent Thinking, Quantitative Research, Research Documents

Title: Business Analyst - Data, Analytics & Insights
Description:
Description

Join our team and what we'll accomplish together

The TELUS Health Digital Transformation is a dynamic, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial group dedicated to supporting data-driven decisions for various TELUS Health products globally. The team focuses on solving complex problems that significantly impact customers and is committed to delivering a seamless digital customer experience. The TELUS Health Digital Transformation team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS Health become a world-class leader in Healthcare delivery, leveraging Technology and Artificial Intelligence products and solutions. We achieve this by delivering AI and data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, improving the experience and efficiencies of our patients, clients, clinicians and agents. We are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big advancement in Technology to support our team.

The Business Analyst, will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions within the context of Artificial Intelligence (AI), data analytics, and insights generation. This position requires a blend of analytical skills, data privacy and security acumen in health context and a strong understanding of AI and data technologies.

What You'll Do


Conduct stakeholder interviews and workshops to gather and document business requirements related to AI, data, and insights.
Analyze existing systems and processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization using AI and data-driven solutions.
Translate business requirements into detailed functional and technical specifications.
Create user stories, use cases, and process flow diagrams.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand data sources, data models, and data pipelines.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Develop reports and dashboards to visualize data and present findings to stakeholders in Looker and Looker Studio via Big Query.
Identify and address data Privacy and Security issues
Participate in project planning and execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Track project progress and communicate updates to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, engineering, and business units.
Facilitate communication and collaboration between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Create and maintain documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and user guides.
Develop training materials and conduct training sessions for users on AI and data-driven solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in AI, data analytics, and business analysis.


Qualifications

What you bring


Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or another cloud provider.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst.
Experience working with AI, data analytics, or business intelligence projects.
Confidence in communicating complex technical ideas to diverse audiences.
Advanced expertise in data analytics and visualization tools (Looker/Tableau), strong SQL skills, and experience with Vertex AI and Python.
Experience building data procedures and scheduling and orchestrating data pipelines.
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform
Strong understanding of health data
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) and source control (GitHub).
Exposure to financial reporting
Solid background in project management and the ability to communicate and influence stakeholders.


Great-to-haves


Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) and source control (GitHub).
Exposure to data privacy and security principals

Title: Analyst - Retail
Description:
Job Description

R25_0001805

- Hybrid

Hybrid role - candidates must currently be located in the greater Toronto area with ability to commute to and work in-person at the Retailer client location in Brampton as required

The Retail team works together with NielsenIQ's Retailer clients to cultivate value-added partnership relationships. The goal is to become the primary and leading source of business insights for NielsenIQ‚Äôs clients.

As an Analyst, working with a team environment, you will assist in providing analytical insights to NielsenIQ's Retailer clients through the preparation of data summaries and special analyses. You will also take action which directly results in enhanced quality for our clients and improved efficiency internally.

The ideal candidate will have:

Post-secondary degree in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, Economics or related field

Strong interpersonal skills

Team oriented

Passion for customer service

Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

Able to demonstrate insightful data analysis by turning raw information into insights

Loves to work with data and has a passion for finding insights from it

Solid written and verbal communication skills

Excellent attention to detail, good logic and time management skills

Demonstrated problem solving skills

Strong technical skills with an emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint

Marketing, sales or category management experience preferred but not required

Additional Information

Canadian Benefits:

Flexible working environment

Medical, Dental & Life Insurance Benefits

Retirement & Savings Plans

Time Away from Work & Well-Being Programs

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Analyst, Data Services
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Data Services group within Capital Markets is responsible for ensuring data quality and accuracy to support critical business operations. We are looking for an experienced and well-rounded Analyst to join our high-performing Reconciliation Data Services team. As an Analyst in this space, you will be expected to serve as the bridge between technical data analysts and operational stakeholders within downstream teams, enabling data-led decisions and operational efficiencies.

This role requires a candidate who can strike the right balance between technical proficiency, business acumen, and stakeholder management. You will help drive meaningful discussions with stakeholders, turning data-driven metrics into actionable insights, and fostering a collaborative problem-solving environment. If you are passionate about financial markets, data-driven decision-making, and process improvement, this role offers a chance to make a significant impact and contribute to our team's success.

What will you do?


Monitor and analyze metrics to detect key trends and identify systemic issues, and work to implement strategic plans for resolution
Facilitate stakeholder forums with upstream and downstream teams to review metrics, address queries, and foster accountability
Present findings and provide updates in a way that is accessible and meaningful to non-technical stakeholders and drive discussions on remediation plans
Build and maintain strong relationships with business users and IT partners at both senior and junior levels
Support team‚Äôs growth by improving the quality of reporting and deepening the team‚Äôs understanding of reconciliation operations
Prepare and maintain clear, well-structured documentation covering processes and action plans, and regularly share updates with team leadership and stakeholders to ensure transparency


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:


Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience presenting data and insights clearly to diverse stakeholders
Strong knowledge of financial markets and capital markets, particularly with associated operational workflows
Strong problem-solving ability to identify patterns and trends using metrics and data
Proficiency in SQL with intermediate skills for data querying and reporting
Advanced Excel skills, including experience generating pivot tables and formulas
Post-secondary education in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related field


Nice-to-have:


Familiarity with visualization platforms like Tableau
Knowledge of reconciliation platforms or financial systems
Knowledge of different reconciliation types, such as cash, position, trade, and data reference
Understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting
Strong understanding of data lifecycles, including focus on data governance
Experience with data science methodologies, including machine learning and advanced pattern recognition.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on our challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


Interaction with a wide variety of departments within Capital Markets
The opportunity to work on projects relating to bank wide data initiatives
Work collaboratively with business partners, IT and Data management in order to deliver new capabilities effectively
Stay close to industry best practices in account, client data and KYC management
Apply interpersonal and influencing skills to develop strong relationships with the Data Management team, Data Management IT, stakeholders across RBC CM, and individuals participating in the various data project streams
Communicate effectively with RBC CM professionals at varying levels of seniority, including applying insight to determine the business impact of data issues that may arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of data which can be supported through better governance.


Job Skills

Agile Methodology, Business Data Analysis, Business Process Modeling, Commercial Acumen, Communication, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Group Problem Solving, Interpersonal Relationship Management, Requirements Analysis

Additional Job Details

Address:

90 WESTERN PKY:BEDFORD

City:

BEDFORD

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

CAPITAL MARKETS

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-04-14

Application Deadline:

2025-04-28

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com</a/span>

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Canada.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Canada for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Finance Reporting Lead

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid)

End Date: 4+ months (possible extension)




Position Overview:

The Finance Reporting Lead Analyst is a senior-level role responsible for overseeing the preparation, analysis, and submission of financial and regulatory reports in compliance with US GAAP, US Regulatory requirements, and local statutory standards. This role contributes to the development and execution of strategic reporting initiatives and partners closely with senior leadership to ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of reporting processes.




Key Responsibilities:

Prepare and submit reports to regulators (e.g., SEC, Fed, OCC), and other stakeholders in accordance with US GAAP and local regulatory requirements.
Lead month-end close activities including journal entries, sub-ledger review, and financial consolidation.
Drive process improvements and implement operational discipline within reporting cycles.
Partner with senior leadership for strategic planning and control implementation.
Provide subject matter expertise and guidance to junior team members.
Maintain strong knowledge of product reporting, data flows, and financial systems to identify and resolve reporting issues.
Support policy and procedure development, ensuring adherence to regulatory and internal standards.
Serve as a technical mentor and support stakeholders with analysis and recommendations.
Independently manage responsibilities with minimal supervision, exercising sound judgment and ethical conduct.




Qualifications:

6‚Äì10 years of experience in Financial Services, preferably with global exposure.
Strong knowledge of US GAAP, regulatory reporting, and statutory frameworks.
Experience in global project management is an asset.
Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and decision-making skills.
Strong communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.




Education:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field (required).




Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.

Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more.

Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

Dexian | Unlock trajectory changing opportunities.

Unlock business potential with Dexian's comprehensive solutions. Discover staffing, talent development, and valuable resources. Explore now!

This role contributes to the development and execution of strategic reporting initiatives and partners closely with senior leadership to ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of reporting processes.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Prepare and submit reports to regulators (e.g., SEC, Fed, OCC), and other stakeholders in accordance with US GAAP and local regulatory requirements.
  • Lead month-end close activities including journal entries, sub-ledger review, and financial consolidation.
  • Drive process improvements and implement operational discipline within reporting cycles.
  • Partner with senior leadership for strategic planning and control implementation.
  • Provide subject matter expertise and guidance to junior team members.
  • Maintain strong knowledge of product reporting, data flows, and financial systems to identify and resolve reporting issues.
  • Support policy and procedure development, ensuring adherence to regulatory and internal standards.
  • Serve as a technical mentor and support stakeholders with analysis and recommendations.
  • Independently manage responsibilities with minimal supervision, exercising sound judgment and ethical conduct.


Qualifications:

  • 6‚Äì10 years of experience in Financial Services, preferably with global exposure.
  • Strong knowledge of US GAAP, regulatory reporting, and statutory frameworks.
  • Experience in global project management is an asset.
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and decision-making skills.
  • Strong communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.


Education:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field (required).


Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.

Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more.

Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

Dexian | Unlock trajectory changing opportunities.

Unlock business potential with Dexian's comprehensive solutions. Discover staffing, talent development, and valuable resources. Explore now!

Title: Office Support Employee- Customer Service
Description:
Full-Time Office Support Employee (Customer Service)

Working under the direction of the Manager of Financial Services/ Deputy Treasurer and Customer Service, the Office Support ‚Äì Customer Service role is responsible for clerical and administrative functions in support of maintaining a high level of customer service throughout the organization.

Some of the job responsibilities of the position include:


Assist the public by telephone, email, or in-person by responding to general inquiries, redirecting inquiries to appropriate staff members and/or entering service requests in the Town‚Äôs work order processing systems
Document the outcome of service requests in the Town‚Äôs work order processing system and communicate the outcomes back to residents.
Monitor and investigate the status of open service requests to ensure that items are being addressed in accordance with customer service standards
Investigate customer service issues and report findings back to the customer or supervisor, as required
Assist the public in person at various customer service desks.
Receive and process payments
Assist with large volume mailings such as tax notices and water bills
Assist with documenting Standard Operating Procedures and Policies.
Trained in all office support positions to provide support and coverage during absences (scheduled and non-scheduled) and during busy periods when additional support is needed
Other duties as assigned


Qualifications


Minimum Community College diploma in Business Administration or Public Administration.
A minimum of 2 years experience in a computerized office environment, with proficiency in keyboarding, Microsoft Word and Excel
Excellent customer service, organization and communication skills
Experience in handling cash and processing financial information
Experience in data entry, file management and telephone reception
Ability to multi-task, prioritize effectively and efficiently to complete required work assignments
General knowledge of office procedures and equipment, i.e. photocopier, postage meter, scanner, stuffing machine and the use of a debit machine
General knowledge of municipal operations, By-laws, Policies and Procedures for each department in order to provide residents with the most accurate information and services.
Experience with various software packages, including Great Plains, GIS Interactive Mapping, Microsoft Office, Excel, Outlook, Laserfiche and Cityworks would be considered an asset


The normal workweek is 35 hours and rate of pay will be $32.54- $33.54

Interested applicants must submit a resume and cover letter no later than, Thursday, April 24, 2025, at 12:00 p.m.

All applications are appreciated however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Accommodations under the requirements of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) will be provided upon request.
