Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Requisition ID: 222992

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Are you ready to make a significant impact on our digital products and customer experience? Join Scotiabank‚Äôs Canadian Analytics Team as a Data Strategist and be at the forefront of integrating cutting-edge analytics capabilities into our bank's digital landscape.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


Build and nurture strong relationships with digital product teams, business lines, and performance management teams, driving data-driven decision-making
Dive deep into performance trends, uncover growth opportunities, and proactively provide actionable insights
Collaborate across functions to define and execute a data strategy and analytics roadmap for digital initiatives, working closely with Digital Banking, analytics teams, and the data office
Lead the charge in identifying and implementing analytics solutions to enhance customer experience, partnering with Data Scientists
Conduct thorough data analysis to influence product development and shape overall business strategies
Translate complex data analytics into clear, actionable business insights, both verbally and in writing, with a keen understanding of business needs
Communicate and coordinate with teams to implement data-driven strategies, ensuring progress is measured and goals are met
Present performance results and insights to business line stakeholders and across the bank, making data come alive through compelling storytelling
Develop and produce analyses, reports, and insights that drive strategic decision-making in support of Canadian Banking goals
Work closely with data scientists, data engineers, and operational teams to implement quality controls and automate data feeds and report generation
Champion a culture of data literacy, analytics, and informed decision-making throughout the bank.


Are you the right person for the role?


You have a strong business acumen and excel at developing and communicating analytics insights to senior leadership
Your communication and stakeholder management skills are exceptional, enabling you to lead meetings, captivate the audience, and ensure accountability
You are a self-starter who thrives with minimal direction, proposing solutions rather than seeking instructions
You have extensive experience communicating insights (not just data) to stakeholders at the director level and above
You can create compelling PowerPoint dashboards that highlight your analyses and tell a story that resonates with business stakeholders
You have experience with Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or other cloud data platforms.
You are proficient in SQL (a must) and have experience with Adobe Analytics (a plus) and Python (a plus)
Your data visualization skills are exceptional, and you are an expert with Power BI (preferred) or similar software
You possess strong business and financial acumen, understand how to determine success, and have a track record of setting KPIs.
You can speak the language of both data and business, bridging the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You are not afraid to challenge the status quo and have a deep curiosity about data, processes, and customer behavior.
You can pivot and adapt to change, diving in, taking ownership, and picking up new things with ease.
You are eager to mentor, teach, and share your ideas in a team environment.


Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:


Post-secondary education in Business, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. Equivalent experience will also be considered
Multiple years of experience providing insights, conducting deep-dive analysis, and presenting results to senior leadership
Proven data literacy and excellent storytelling ‚Äî the ability to simplify and describe complex analytical concepts to stakeholders outside of analytics
Experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g., Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Google Cloud Platform) and are comfortable with creating large and streamlined queries
Experience using visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or QlikView
Top-notch analytical skills allowing you to interpret and consolidate large amounts of information into actionable recommendations
Experience cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, images)
Ability to leverage digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or Splunk.
Ability to manage processes and planning, facilitate teamwork, and coordinate the execution of multiple deliverables


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

  • Multiple years of experience providing insights, conducting deep-dive analysis, and presenting results to senior leadership
  • Proven data literacy and excellent storytelling ‚Äî the ability to simplify and describe complex analytical concepts to stakeholders outside of analytics
  • Experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g., Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Google Cloud Platform) and are comfortable with creating large and streamlined queries
  • Experience using visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or QlikView
  • Top-notch analytical skills allowing you to interpret and consolidate large amounts of information into actionable recommendations
  • Experience cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, images)
  • Ability to leverage digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or Splunk.
  • Ability to manage processes and planning, facilitate teamwork, and coordinate the execution of multiple deliverables

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst / Modeler
Description:
Requisition ID: 222472

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Team

CB Data Services manages the collective data asset for the Canadian Bank. DS team members help design and implement the most appropriate data storage, data movement and data integration solutions to meet immediate project requirements while supporting the long term direction of the enterprise. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst & Data Modeler to join our dynamic team focused on the development of enterprise data models and data provisioning to target data platforms. Data analysis and architecture skills are needed to design the use and flow of data between systems; through service calls, data federation, replication, data access, evaluation of performance to align with the appropriate technology and infrastructure to ensure solution optimizes technical and business requirements.

Is this role right for you?


Work with business users to obtain data requirements and analyze source systems data.
Design and develop conceptual, logical and physical data models for the operational and analytical data models
Work closely with the technical and application architects, and developers to implement the data architecture and application solution
Communicate physical database designs to, and work with, database administrator to implement databases
Document data flows, identify appropriate data sources, entities, relationships and redundancies.
Manage data integrity and data quality.
Maintain technical & business metadata. Generate metadata for Hadoop ingestion for different ingestion frameworks.
Design data structures and document data meanings, definitions and intended use, work with various departments/leaders and data stewards to make the ‚Äúmetadata‚Äù available.
Define and document the data architecture for operational databases, reporting and provisioning platforms, including the physical components and their functionality
Support data strategies, standards, guidelines data quality process and governance across the enterprise
Provide leadership in researching and architecting emerging technology solutions to meet business strategies and objectives.


Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?


Relational and dimensional data modeling and database design, Erwin (Data modeling) skills.
Strong SQL, Python and some spark knowledge. Hands on Hive (Hadoop) experience.
Knowledge of data architectural approaches, patterns and emerging technologies (RDBMS, Hadoop and Cloud)
Exposure and knowledge of Cloud platforms, cloud architecture, capabilities and processes like GCP, Azure is great asset.
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions. Strong Analytical skills.
Experience creating architecture and strategy artifacts
Experience of XML, JSON, Copybook, CSV files ingestion
Experience working in Agile environment
Knowledge of Data Governance process for metadata and lineage management is strong asset. Exposure to any Data Governance tools like IGC, Collibra is an asset.
Domain Knowledge in financial Services and enterprise functions is strong asset.
Knowledge of database administration, database performance tuning, source & target data structures, ETL processes & products
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, or diploma in computer engineering or information science


What's in it for you?


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.‚ÄØ
Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community egagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!


Work conditions: Hybrid

Title: Business Analyst - Data, Analytics & Insights
Description:
Description

Join our team and what we'll accomplish together

The TELUS Health Digital Transformation is a dynamic, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial group dedicated to supporting data-driven decisions for various TELUS Health products globally. The team focuses on solving complex problems that significantly impact customers and is committed to delivering a seamless digital customer experience. The TELUS Health Digital Transformation team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS Health become a world-class leader in Healthcare delivery, leveraging Technology and Artificial Intelligence products and solutions. We achieve this by delivering AI and data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, improving the experience and efficiencies of our patients, clients, clinicians and agents. We are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big advancement in Technology to support our team.

The Business Analyst, will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions within the context of Artificial Intelligence (AI), data analytics, and insights generation. This position requires a blend of analytical skills, data privacy and security acumen in health context and a strong understanding of AI and data technologies.

What You‚Äôll Do



Conduct stakeholder interviews and workshops to gather and document business requirements related to AI, data, and insights.
Analyze existing systems and processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization using AI and data-driven solutions.
Translate business requirements into detailed functional and technical specifications.
Create user stories, use cases, and process flow diagrams.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand data sources, data models, and data pipelines.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Develop reports and dashboards to visualize data and present findings to stakeholders in Looker and Looker Studio via Big Query.
Identify and address data Privacy and Security issues
Participate in project planning and execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Track project progress and communicate updates to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, engineering, and business units.
Facilitate communication and collaboration between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Create and maintain documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and user guides.
Develop training materials and conduct training sessions for users on AI and data-driven solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in AI, data analytics, and business analysis.



Qualifications

What you bring



Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or another cloud provider.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst.
Experience working with AI, data analytics, or business intelligence projects.
Confidence in communicating complex technical ideas to diverse audiences.
Advanced expertise in data analytics and visualization tools (Looker/Tableau), strong SQL skills, and experience with Vertex AI and Python.
Experience building data procedures and scheduling and orchestrating data pipelines.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform
Strong understanding of health data
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) and source control (GitHub).
Exposure to financial reporting
Solid background in project management and the ability to communicate and influence stakeholders.



Great-to-haves



Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure) and source control (GitHub).
Exposure to data privacy and security principals

Title: Analyst, Infrastructure Investments
Description:
Fengate is a leading alternative investment manager focused on infrastructure, private equity and real estate strategies. In 2006, Fengate established its first infrastructure fund with a mandate to invest in infrastructure investments in Canada. Today, Fengate has invested in over 50 assets across the energy transition, digital, social and transportation infrastructure sectors in the United States and Canada.

¬†

As part of their strategy to grow the infrastructure investment platform, Fengate is seeking to hire an Analyst to join their investment team in Toronto to expand their investment capabilities.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Support sourcing, bidding and closing investments and financings
Support managing development partnerships and platforms
Assist in the development, interpretation, and communication of financial models
Support diligence of new and management of existing development partnerships/platforms
Develop financial models, presentations and investment memos
Conduct financial analysis and research
Participate in internal and external meetings as part of the team
Provide a wide range of financial and investment focused analytical support as required



Requirements



KEY QUALIFICATIONS

Undergraduate degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering or a related field
Demonstrated experience in financial modeling, Excel and other statistical packages
1+ years of cumulative work experience for an investment bank, infrastructure fund or project finance bank
Strong understanding of project risk (development, construction and operation) and project documentation
Strong organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment
Ability to formally articulate and present data as requested




CORE COMPETENCIES

Being Authentic -Inspiring trust and being courageous.
Focusing on Performance -Being accountable and driving results
Understanding Stakeholders - Knowing the needs of those who rely on you.
Building Effective Relationships - Collaboration and communication.



Fengate is an equal opportunity employer, we strive to attract and retain a diverse workforce and are committed to promoting diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. It is a core priority at Fengate to create, operate with, and continuously grow and sustain an inclusive culture that respects and connects the diversity of our team, our clients, our partners, and the communities we work in.¬†


We are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.


We thank all applicants for their interest in this position; however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Analyst, Data Insights
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In the increasingly complex world of financial services, accurate and complete data is critical for risk management and regulatory compliance. Ensuring data integrity begins with an understanding of financial services data, data quality controls and identifying and resolving data observations and issues. As an Analyst, Data Insights, you will be accountable for driving improvements in Risk and Finance data through the management of identification, root cause analysis, and resolution of data issues for US business critical processes and regulatory reports.

Reporting to the Associate Director, you will be responsible in building trust and ensuring the accuracy and completeness of shared data assets and reporting data by managing data quality initiatives.

What will you do?

Data Quality monitoring, observation identification and management


Review and assessment of exceptions and observations management investigations and reporting, and overseeing and monitoring the remediation of data and processes, as required.


Investigations and reporting


Manages and conducts detailed investigations and report findings based on data exceptions, identified observations, and ad hoc requests from critical Report owners and other users of shared data assets.
Provide monthly summary and detailed data quality reporting to business partners and stakeholders, including data quality exceptions, findings and the status of outstanding observations.


Continuous improvement


Based on root-cause analysis findings, propose process changes/improvements to address gaps or inconsistencies in data, processes and/or controls and raise awareness of best practices and approved provisioning points for commonly used data assets.
Maintain data quality tests and data quality observation repositories


Leadership and collaboration


Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders and business partners, resolving conflicts/issues of medium complexity and escalating to others as appropriate.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


Demonstrated ability to understand data relationships, aggregate information and utilize SQL or other querying languages to research data issues and conduct root cause analysis
2+ years of experience in financial services, data management and business analysis.
Ability to translate business requirements into data requirements
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, and able to dissect complex ideas and concepts to provide clear, concise and relevant summaries and insights
Results oriented; able to set and consistently meet high-quality standards while handling a variety of task and deadlines simultaneously, with ability to collaborate with many stakeholders
Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills and ability to work under pressure to deliver within time-sensitive deadlines


Nice-to-have


Undergraduate degree.
Ability to read and understand financial and regulatory documentation.
Ability to be able to think creatively and use ‚Äòout of the box‚Äô solutions where possible.
Change mindset and ability to apply a process improvement lens to all BAU activities.
Experience working with financial or credit risk data.
Knowledge of Collibra or a similar data management workflow platform.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work


Job Skills

Communication, Critical Thinking, Data Administration, Data Analysis, Database Structures, Data Integrity, Data Modeling, Data Movement, Data Quality, Data Reporting, Datasets, Detail-Oriented, Group Problem Solving, Information Capture, Microsoft Excel, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), Structured Query Language (SQL), Tableau (Software), Teamwork, Teradata SQL, Time Management

Additional Job Details

Address:

BAY WELLINGTON TOWER, 181 BAY ST:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

CHIEF LEGAL & ADMIN OFFICE GRP

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-04-09

Application Deadline:

2025-04-23

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inclusion without Exception:




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer, and embraces diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, gender, age, physical ability, neurodiversity, and sexual orientation, to create a workforce that reflects the societies we operate in. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected in our people stories across our workforce and implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.




About TCS:




TCS is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world‚Äôs largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive-powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile‚Ñ¢ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS employs over 612,000 of the world‚Äôs best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $29 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2024, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.

Role Description:




‚Ä¢ The candidate will be required to do in-depth data analysis work to produce various data management reports to be used by other teams.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in data analysis, data quality assessment, compiling metadata for data lineage.

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand complex data relationships and write effective business-oriented reports.

‚Ä¢ Proficient in SQL and Python languages.

Required Skill Set

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in data analysis, data quality assessment, compiling metadata for data lineage.

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand complex data relationships and write effective business oriented reports.

‚Ä¢ Proficient in SQL and Python languages.

Desired Skill Set

‚Ä¢ Understanding of various payment protocols and message types like ACH, SWIFT, Fedwire.

‚Ä¢ Basic understanding of Collibra, Atacama ONE.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualifications for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Borrowell:

At Borrowell, we're on a mission to help Canadians feel confident about their money. We empower individuals to take control of their financial futures by providing the tools and insights needed to understand, build, and use their credit effectively.

1 in 10 Canadians use Borrowell for comprehensive credit monitoring and personalized insights. Our innovative services, including Credit Builder and rent reporting, help consumers build credit so they can unlock access to a wider range of financial products at more competitive rates. Additionally, we offer personalized financial product recommendations from Canada's most trusted providers based on each member's credit profile and financial goals.

Our team is diverse, inclusive, and driven by a shared passion for making a meaningful difference in the lives of Canadians. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of collaboration, humility, and innovation. If you're looking to join a company that's transforming the financial landscape and empowering Canadians to achieve their financial aspirations, we invite you to explore career opportunities at Borrowell. Together, we can help Canadians feel confident about money.

About this role:

As a Data Analyst you will be a key member of Borrowell's Data Analytics Team. Your role will be pivotal in informing new marketing and product initiatives and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our 3+ million members.

You'll provide a window into business performance and help to make recommendations on what we build next. You can expect to be responsible for creating and managing insights, experimentations, forecasting, and reporting for various business partners at Borrowell. You'll monitor existing key performance indicators, explore new areas of data to drive business growth and product development, and make company data accessible, insightful and actionable to the different business divisions.

This role specifically focuses on being a data thought partner to a designated Product Manager and related cross-functional Product pod (in-house folks in engineering, devops, QA, mobile, and more).

Responsibilities


Establish and maintain KPIs and supporting metrics to be used across the project to track performance
Analyze data from different sources
Collaborate across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with data-driven insights
Translate product requirements into clear and actionable data tasks
Generate visualizations and use data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Perform A/B tests to ensure experiment results are reliable, valid and accurate



Requirements


1+ yrs working experience with SQL to solve business problems
Experience with using data to tell a story that is comprehensive for both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with analytics tools such as Looker, Tableau, or similar (we use Looker)
Experience with A/B testing
Strong statistical knowledge



Nice to Have


Undergraduate (or higher) degree in a quantitative field
Knowledge of Python, R, dbt, or Airflow
Exposure to product-based tech startups



Benefits


The Opportunity - join and have a major impact at a growing company that is helping make financial stability possible for everybody
Comprehensive Health Benefits - medical, dental, vision, and paramedical health benefits for you and your family, with extra yearly coverage for psychotherapists and massage therapists
Additional Health Benefits - virtual benefit offering that allows you to connect 24/7 with nurses, doctors and mental health professionals
Maternity & Parental Leave Top-up - available to new parents
Wellness & Transit Benefit - $600 annually to spend on whatever brings you joy
WFH Reimbursement - we ship you gear like a laptop, mouse, keyboard, and you can reimburse additional items to make your workplace better for you
Employee Development Benefit - annual reimbursements on payments to help your learning
Givewell Benefit - 1 paid volunteer day a year to give back to the community
Flexibility - flexible working hours and a flexible vacation policy



We are remote-first across Canada with an office in Toronto. This role requires you to attend in-person meetings and team-building events.

At Borrowell, one of our core values and firm beliefs is that diversity makes us better. If you're unsure about your qualifications for this position we'd still encourage you to apply. We're looking for candidates who have experience but know that not everyone's had a chance to demonstrate what they can do. What's most important is that you have a growth mindset and care about helping people with their finances - an area in their lives that causes a lot of stress.

Please note that due to the sensitive nature of the work we do, clearing a credit and criminal record check is a condition of employment.

By submitting your application you consent to Borrowell's use and processing of your personal information in connection with your job application at Borrowell and its recruitment processes.

Borrowell encourages applications from candidates with differing abilities. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage in the selection process.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
TRADER Corporation is a trusted Canadian leader in online media, dealer and lender services. The company is comprised of AutoTrader.ca, AutoSync and Dealertrack Canada. AutoTrader.ca (AutoHebdo.net in Quebec) offers the largest inventory of new cars and used cars in Canada, receiving over 25 million monthly visits to its marketplace. With over 3,500 subscribers and counting, AutoSync is the largest and fastest growing dealer and OEM software provider in Canada. The platform's suite of connected automotive software solutions brings advertising, conversion and operational support together, synchronizing the entire retail process. AutoSync's diverse range of offerings includes: vAuto, EasyDeal, xtime, Motoinsight, Activix, TAdvantage and TRFFK. Dealertrack is Canada‚Äôs largest automotive financing portal, enhancing efficiency and profitability for all major segments of the automotive, marine, recreational vehicle, motorcycle and powersport retail industries. Over 6.5 million credit applications are submitted via the Dealertrack Canada portal each year. Collateral Management is a national, end-to-end, managed technology solution that offers industry insight and multi-channel collection strategies to maximize funds recovered. Collateral Management helps you remain compliant in all jurisdictions, alleviating your exposure to reputational and financial risks. Visit tradercorporation.com to learn more. .




TRADER Corporation's parent company AutoScout24 is the largest pan-European online car market with over 2 million listings and more than 43,000 dealer customers. With AutoScout24, users can find, finance, buy, subscribe for and sell used and new cars. The marketplace provides inspiration on cars and other vehicles and makes hard decisions easy.




Since 1998 AutoScout24 has been offering private users, car dealers and other cooperation partners from the automotive, financial and insurance services sector a comprehensive digital platform for car trading. The online marketplace includes used and new cars, motorcycles as well as commercial vehicles. AutoScout24 has over 30 million users per month, more than 43,000 dealers and around 500 employees. In addition to Germany, AutoScout24 is also represented in the European core markets of Belgium, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Italy, France and Austria.




More information on www.autoscout24.de




Experience leveraging AI, Generative AI (GenAI) to enhance engineering productivity, automate repetitive tasks, and optimize workflows. Candidates should demonstrate the ability to integrate AI-driven solutions into their daily work ‚Äî such as code generation, debugging, reviews, documentation, and decision support‚Äîto improve efficiency for themselves and their teams. A proactive approach to exploring and implementing AI tools that drive innovation and streamline development processes is highly valued




The Reporting Analyst is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of reports and dashboards, assisting with the analysis and reporting of business data across various departments. This role will focus on data analysis, reporting automation, and delivering actionable insights to support decision-making and performance improvement. The position is responsible for analyzing and reporting on performance to improve results and facilitate future goal setting as well as reviewing current processes to improve efficiency, quality, and accuracy.Proficiency in Power BI is required, and experience with SQL is preferred, as the role involves working with large datasets and optimizing data retrieval. The position also requires expertise in Excel, data visualization tools, and an understanding of business data from CRMs like Salesforce, as well as the ability to produce polished reports that provide valuable business insights.

Key Responsibilities:

- Data Analysis & Reporting

Responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting on key business data to provide insights that drive strategic decisions. This includes data cleaning, trend identification, and performance analysis across various departments and business functions.

- Report Development & Maintenance

Design, develop, and maintain routine and ad-hoc reports for business leaders and teams. Ensure reports are clear, accurate, and aligned with business objectives. Provide actionable insights through Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools.

- Dashboard & Data Visualization

Build and maintain interactive dashboards to provide real-time business data insights through CRM reporting or Data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver tailored dashboards to track business performance.

- Process Improvement & Automation

Identify opportunities for automating reporting processes and improving data accuracy and efficiency. Develop automated reporting systems that reduce manual efforts and improve data accessibility.

- Performance Analysis & Reporting

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics across business units. Provide regular updates on performance, highlight trends, and identify areas for improvement. Use advanced Excel functions, SQL queries, and other tools to analyze large datasets and draw actionable conclusions.

- Collaboration & Support

Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g., IT, Finance, Marketing) to gather data requirements and deliver reports that align with business needs. Provide training and support to team members on report interpretation and usage.

- Ad-hoc Reporting & Projects

Manage ad-hoc reporting and analytical projects as needed by the business. Collaborate with other departments to ensure data analysis supports project objectives and problem resolution. Provide insights that drive process improvement and strategic decision-making.

Job Requirements




Please indicate if required (R), preferred (P) or asset (A)

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Science, Economics, or a related field (R)

- Minimum 2-5 years of experience in a reporting or data analyst role (R)

- Strong analytical and computer skills with proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, macros, other formulas) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) (R)

- Experience with SQL or other data querying languages (P)

- Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) is an asset (P)

- Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) is desirable (P)

- Experience with programming languages (e.g., Python or R) is a plus (A)

- Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to present complex data in an understandable format

- Ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

- Ability to work with minimal supervision and collaborate across teams

- Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills

- Demonstrated ability to analyze data and provide actionable insights




What‚Äôs in it for you‚Ä¶

-We understand that there is life at work and life outside of work. Here are a few benefits we all benefit from that support us to be our creative best.

Fitness and wellness

-We provide discounts to nation-wide gyms, onsite gyms (when we‚Äôre in the office), an Employee and Family Assistance Program, as well as a virtual wellness program.

Benefits from Day 1

-Gym discounts

-Local in-office free gyms

-Employee and Family Assistance program

-Weekly virtual wellness events

-Conferences & training budget

-Regular internal training programs

Financial planning

-Let us help you invest in your future with 3% matching towards your pension and multiple forms of income protection.

Competitive salary

-Annual bonus structure

-3% CPP matching

Title: DATA SPECIALIST 1
Description:
Job ID: 55371

Job Category: Engineering & Technical

Division & Section: Parks, Forestry & Recreation, PFR Bus & Technology Transformation

Work Location: Metro Hall, 55 John Street (Hybrid)

Job Type & Duration: Temporary, Full-Time, 12 month vacancy

Salary: $93,734.00 - $123,449.00

Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week

Affiliation: Non-Union

Qualified List will be established to fill permanent and temporary positions.

Number of Positions Open: 1

Posting Period: 04-Apr-2024 to 22-Apr-2024

Job Summary

Reporting to the Program Manager, Capital Projects Parks & Recreation, this position will help to guide policies/procedures regarding program-specific requirements, with a heavy focus on asset data as PF&R transitions to a new asset management system. The successful candidates will help to consolidate data sets, improve data quality, enhance data analysis, optimize business processes and guide innovative and strategic planning. They will bring creative and innovative approaches and techniques to large-scale divisional datasets, making recommendations and implementing improvements to the system, supporting data pipelines, ETLs/ELTs, and statistical and inferential analysis. Through collaboration with corporate partners, you will ensure high performance of large amounts of ETL as well as ELT tasks, report building, analytics, and data visualization support. The role will give PF&R the ability to harness the power of data for strategic decision-making, operational efficiency, and improved service value.

Major Responsibilities

Data Management & Technical Responsibilities


Leads tasks related to modeling, analysis, and interpretation of datasets.
Designs and builds complex models for analytics problems.
Conducts peer and literature reviews on data modeling techniques.
Develops processes for ingesting, transforming, and analyzing large datasets.
Prepares, cleans, and standardizes data to ensure it meets data quality and formatting requirements; manages data accuracy, eliminates duplication, and ensures consistency.
Implements ETL/ELT processes for data integration.
Documents data processes, models, and code, including creating detailed run-books or as-built documents.
Transforms and cleanses data for compatibility with Maximo's data structure.
Develops and maintains asset hierarchy and data models to support asset lifecycle management.
Creates and implements data migration plans and establishes data quality rules to ensure data integrity during transitions; performs data validation and testing to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
Leads data accuracy validation before and after migration, confirming the transfer of data is successful; works with stakeholders to verify data relevance and accuracy based on asset management requirements.


Data Governance & Compliance


Establishes and maintains data governance policies and standards to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements; oversees data governance policies and compliance documentation.
Ensures data handling meets regulatory standards, business standards, and project requirements.
Manages data access permissions and roles, ensuring data security and confidentiality.
Ensures compliance with data retention policies and procedures.
Addresses data discrepancies and inconsistencies by working closely with data owners and stakeholders.


Project Management & Change Management Skills


Develops and evaluates work plans for data projects.
Ensures conformance to data governance standards.
Implements Enterprise Asset Management system with project teams and stakeholders.
Monitors and evaluates application functionality.


Stakeholder Engagement & Communication


Collects and analyzes data with internal and external partners.
Prepares reports, dashboards, and submissions; sets up reports, dashboards, and analytics tools to support the business with asset management insights.
Provides training and support to staff on data usage.
Maintains effective working relationships and networks.


Data Tools & Technologies


Utilizes data management and analytics tools (e.g., SQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Python).
Configures data-related features in software.
Evaluates new data management tools and technologies.


Key Qualifications


Post-secondary education in Civil Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Extensive experience in data management principles and practices, including data governance, data quality assurance, data integration, and data analysis.
Proficiency with data management tools and technologies, including analytics and visualization tools (SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau). Familiarity with ETL/ELT processes for data integration.
Experience in developing and maintaining asset hierarchy and data models to support asset lifecycle management.
Experience in creating and implementing data migration plans and establishing data quality rules to ensure data integrity during transitions.
Experience in performing data validation and testing to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
Experience in documenting data processes, models, and code, including creating detailed run-books or as-built documents.
Experience developing data governance frameworks to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements.
Experience designing, developing, and implementing taxonomies, metadata structures, and/or data dictionaries.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess complex data requirements and develop solutions, troubleshooting and resolving issues related to Enterprise Asset Management systems data and functionality.
Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including writing reports, briefing notes, and delivering presentations.
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and compliance for data management, data retention, and data access permissions.
Familiarity with current and emerging technologies in data management and analytics.
Ability to travel to various locations within the City of Toronto, including parks and parks yards, as required.
Knowledge of Toronto Public Service values and ability to support an ethical, supportive, and respectful workplace culture that champions equity, diversity, and inclusion.
Must be familiar with safety and security matters under Occupational Health & Safety legislation and Divisional safety and security policies.


Equity, Diversity and Inclusion

The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City‚Äôs commitment to employment equity.

Accommodation

The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). HTML:
Job ID: 55371

Job Category: Engineering & Technical

Division & Section: Parks, Forestry & Recreation, PFR Bus & Technology Transformation

Work Location: Metro Hall, 55 John Street (Hybrid)

Job Type & Duration: Temporary, Full-Time, 12 month vacancy

Salary: $93,734.00 - $123,449.00

Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week

Affiliation: Non-Union

Qualified List will be established to fill permanent and temporary positions.

Number of Positions Open: 1

Posting Period: 04-Apr-2024 to 22-Apr-2024

Job Summary

Reporting to the Program Manager, Capital Projects Parks & Recreation, this position will help to guide policies/procedures regarding program-specific requirements, with a heavy focus on asset data as PF&R transitions to a new asset management system. The successful candidates will help to consolidate data sets, improve data quality, enhance data analysis, optimize business processes and guide innovative and strategic planning. They will bring creative and innovative approaches and techniques to large-scale divisional datasets, making recommendations and implementing improvements to the system, supporting data pipelines, ETLs/ELTs, and statistical and inferential analysis. Through collaboration with corporate partners, you will ensure high performance of large amounts of ETL as well as ELT tasks, report building, analytics, and data visualization support. The role will give PF&R the ability to harness the power of data for strategic decision-making, operational efficiency, and improved service value.

Major Responsibilities

Data Management & Technical Responsibilities

  • Leads tasks related to modeling, analysis, and interpretation of datasets.
  • Designs and builds complex models for analytics problems.
  • Conducts peer and literature reviews on data modeling techniques.
  • Develops processes for ingesting, transforming, and analyzing large datasets.
  • Prepares, cleans, and standardizes data to ensure it meets data quality and formatting requirements; manages data accuracy, eliminates duplication, and ensures consistency.
  • Implements ETL/ELT processes for data integration.
  • Documents data processes, models, and code, including creating detailed run-books or as-built documents.
  • Transforms and cleanses data for compatibility with Maximo's data structure.
  • Develops and maintains asset hierarchy and data models to support asset lifecycle management.
  • Creates and implements data migration plans and establishes data quality rules to ensure data integrity during transitions; performs data validation and testing to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
  • Leads data accuracy validation before and after migration, confirming the transfer of data is successful; works with stakeholders to verify data relevance and accuracy based on asset management requirements.

Data Governance & Compliance

  • Establishes and maintains data governance policies and standards to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements; oversees data governance policies and compliance documentation.
  • Ensures data handling meets regulatory standards, business standards, and project requirements.
  • Manages data access permissions and roles, ensuring data security and confidentiality.
  • Ensures compliance with data retention policies and procedures.
  • Addresses data discrepancies and inconsistencies by working closely with data owners and stakeholders.

Project Management & Change Management Skills

  • Develops and evaluates work plans for data projects.
  • Ensures conformance to data governance standards.
  • Implements Enterprise Asset Management system with project teams and stakeholders.
  • Monitors and evaluates application functionality.

Stakeholder Engagement & Communication

  • Collects and analyzes data with internal and external partners.
  • Prepares reports, dashboards, and submissions; sets up reports, dashboards, and analytics tools to support the business with asset management insights.
  • Provides training and support to staff on data usage.
  • Maintains effective working relationships and networks.

Data Tools & Technologies

  • Utilizes data management and analytics tools (e.g., SQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Python).
  • Configures data-related features in software.
  • Evaluates new data management tools and technologies.

Key Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in Civil Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Extensive experience in data management principles and practices, including data governance, data quality assurance, data integration, and data analysis.
  • Proficiency with data management tools and technologies, including analytics and visualization tools (SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau). Familiarity with ETL/ELT processes for data integration.
  • Experience in developing and maintaining asset hierarchy and data models to support asset lifecycle management.
  • Experience in creating and implementing data migration plans and establishing data quality rules to ensure data integrity during transitions.
  • Experience in performing data validation and testing to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
  • Experience in documenting data processes, models, and code, including creating detailed run-books or as-built documents.
  • Experience developing data governance frameworks to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements.
  • Experience designing, developing, and implementing taxonomies, metadata structures, and/or data dictionaries.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess complex data requirements and develop solutions, troubleshooting and resolving issues related to Enterprise Asset Management systems data and functionality.
  • Highly developed written and oral communication skills, including writing reports, briefing notes, and delivering presentations.
  • Knowledge of data privacy regulations and compliance for data management, data retention, and data access permissions.
  • Familiarity with current and emerging technologies in data management and analytics.
  • Ability to travel to various locations within the City of Toronto, including parks and parks yards, as required.
  • Knowledge of Toronto Public Service values and ability to support an ethical, supportive, and respectful workplace culture that champions equity, diversity, and inclusion.
  • Must be familiar with safety and security matters under Occupational Health & Safety legislation and Divisional safety and security policies.

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion

The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City‚Äôs commitment to employment equity.

Accommodation

The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request. Learn more about the City‚Äôs Hiring Policies and Accommodation Process.

Title: Associate Data Analyst - Energy & Sustainability (Junior / Early Talent Professional / Entry-Level)
Description:
Change the future with us.

Build a brighter future while learning and growing with Brightly Software, a Siemens company, at the intersection of technology, community and sustainability. Our global team of innovators is always looking to create meaningful solutions to some of the toughest challenges facing our world. Find out how far your passion can take you.

What will you do?

Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) issues have become increasingly important for all stakeholders. The Energy & ESG Managed Services Team is responsible for client data completeness, data integrity, validation, and reporting.

We seek a smart, and passionate individual to join our Energy & ESG Managed Services Team as a Data Analyst. In this role, you will have a strong focus on data collection, loading and verification. Ideally, you will be developing a numerical/analytical skillset and have good comprehension of utility data. Performing necessary validation checks and troubleshooting issues that inhibit data flow, is critical. Your attention to detail with a general desire to learn and grow, will be key to your success in this role!

This is an ideal opportunity for an Early Talent professional.

Responsibilities / Key Aspects:


Support with ongoing maintenance of client, property, and utility account information.
Manually load utility bill data, ensuring high accuracy.
Load and verify data from multiple sources into our system; manage data flow and address issues.
Use data processing tools and proprietary systems to validate data.
Review and investigate year-over-year variances and anomalous energy data.
Identify opportunities to increase efficiencies and propose scalable solutions.
Be readily available to provide cross-team support with client requests and energy data issues.
Become an expert in the relevant products and functional areas.


What will you need to succeed?


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or Diploma preferred
Recent post-secondary graduates will be given consideration for the role with demonstrated co-op / internship / coursework experience within the energy management and/or sustainability fields.
Experience: Minimum of 1+ years of related experience. Includes co-op or internships.
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills in English. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively. Client service and relationship-building skills.
Competencies: A problem-solving and troubleshooting mentality; strong organization and time management skills; able to prioritize and adapt well to shifting priorities and schedules; self-driven and motivated professional; good collaboration skills; strong analytical skills; attention to detail; goal-oriented; strategic thinker; demonstrated commitment to teamwork.
Software skills: Experience with MS Office suite and products such as MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint. Experience with SQL is an asset.
Flexibility: In your work-schedule to learn and collaborate with a global team and colleagues effectively.
Learning agility: A steep learning curve is anticipated; thrive in a dynamic virtual work environment.
Business Process Improvement (BPI): Strong interest and/or experience in Business Process Improvement, with a keen ability to identify inefficiencies and a proactive approach to learning and implementing effective solutions to enhance operational performance.


Character Traits:


Entrepreneurial: High energy level, sense of urgency and intellectual curiosity, confident, thorough, not afraid to make decisions, oriented toward practical solutions. Passion for developing great products.
Self-confidence: Confident, without an ego, to have both the conviction and willingness to make decisions as well as the confidence to seek collaborative solutions.
Strong work ethic: Ability to overcome setbacks and enthusiastically persist until ambitious goals are achieved‚Äîmust be resourceful, creative and innovative.
Accountable: Results-oriented team player who leads by example, holds self-accountable for performance, takes ownership, champions efforts with enthusiasm and conviction.
Great attitude: Collaborative, adaptable, fun, and ability to influence others.


Why you‚Äôll love working for Siemens!


Freedom and a healthy work- life balance‚Äì Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
Solve the world‚Äôs most significant problems ‚Äì Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
Competitive total rewards package.
Profit sharing available.
Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
Employee perks and discounts.
Diversity and inclusivity focused.


Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada‚Äôs Top 100 Employers, Canada‚Äôs Greenest Employers 2025 and Canada‚Äôs Top Employers for Young People 2025.

About Us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

Siemens Canada is a leading technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, mobility and healthcare. The company‚Äôs purpose to is to create technology with purpose, transforming the everyday, for everyone, since 1912. By combining the real and the digital worlds, Siemens empowers its customers to accelerate their digital and sustainability transformations, making factories more efficient, cities more liveable, and transportation more sustainable. Siemens also owns a majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, a leading global medical technology provider pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. In fiscal 2024, which ended September 30, 2024, Siemens Canada had revenues of approx. $2.2 billion CAD. The company has approximately 4,400 employees from coast-to-coast and 37 office and production facilities across Canada.

To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Notice available at www.siemens.ca.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a hybrid position (2x a week in the office) in Downtown Toronto.







In this role, you will join a non-profit and member-based organization in Downtown Toronto. You will join a new team in the company, and will transform data into clear, compelling insights that will fuel this organization‚Äôs programs and impact.







You will join a tight-knit team, and will need strong SQL, Power BI, and Python skills. This company is onboarding Dynamics 365, and previous experience with this (or a similar CRM) will be helpful to have.




What you will do and how you will make an impact ‚Ä¶










Collect, evaluate, and transform raw data into actionable insights that support organizational objectives.







Develop reports and dashboards using tools like Power BI, Excel, and SQL to clearly communicate key findings.







Respond to unique requests from the business and deliver tailored data analyses to support organizational initiatives.







Play an integral role in ensuring the quality, consistency, and accuracy of data within the organization‚Äôs database systems.







Effectively communicate technical data insights to non-technical teams, empowering business users and decision-makers.







You will bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring data insights are actionable for business users.







Why we are excited about you ‚Ä¶







You have experience working with marketing, and customer engagement data.







You have previous experience working with Dynamics 365, or a comparable CRM.







You have strong data storytelling and communication skills.







You are curious, and proactive.







Qualifications ‚Ä¶




Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.




Previous experience with Power BI, SQL, and MS Excel.




Previous experience working with Dynamics 365 or a similar CRM.







Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let‚Äôs explore this together.







The interview process ‚Ä¶







If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will contact you for an initial discussion. This will be a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.







Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna







Compensation & benefits ‚Ä¶







This is a full-time and permanent position that includes a competitive base salary, bonus program, RRSP program, extended health and dental benefits, and paid vacation.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Dedicated to telling stories and creating experiences, Indigo is always looking for bright, energetic, and customer-focused people who can help bring our exciting mission to life in one of our more than 170 Indigo, Indigospirit, Chapters, or Coles stores across Canada. We offer a variety of exciting opportunities at our retail stores, distribution centres, and home office for people who share our passions and want to be part of a dynamic and enriching culture.




WHO WE ARE




We love books and all things beautiful
We are Canada‚Äôs Cultural Department Store
Books are our heart and soul, and Great Books are JUST the Beginning‚Ä¶




We play by the following rules:




We exist to add joy to our customers‚Äô lives every time they interact with us and our products
Our job is to create joyful moments for our customers
We treat each other the way we‚Äôd treat a valued friend
We inspire each other to do our best work
We seek to ignite creativity and innovation every day
We give back to the communities in which we operate




Job Description




MISSION




The Data Engineer is responsible for continuously developing and improving data engineering initiatives that support critical business processes. Reporting to the Manager of Data Engineering, this role leverages data engineering to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of various teams across Indigo and maintains rigorous data best practices.




KEY PERFORMANCE METRICS




Demonstrated improvement of data-focused business processes
Improvements in the quality and accuracy of business data domains
Work independently in managing own deliverables
Collaboration with internal partners to drive data literacy and understanding
Contribution to driving the overall data enablement strategy




KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES




Functional




Create, manage, and optimize data solutions that support business processes such as product recommendations, store and digital operations, performance marketing, and loyalty projects.
Create and manage data products predominantly written in SQL and Python that enable the consumption of data from systems and transform them into standardized domains in our Data Warehouse
Collaborate across the organization to seek opportunities to leverage data and data engineering to improve our business outcomes.
Act as an advocate for the customer by placing them at the forefront of all design and decision-making processes.
Challenge the status quo and consistently identify areas for improvement, diagnose issues, and work to resolve them.
Contribute to designing and implementing team best practices for development workflows and data governance.
Have the ability to navigate ambiguity to progress with projects effectively
Exhibit strong decision-making and problem-solving skills that align with our team‚Äôs best practice.
Have a mindset of continually improving our solutions and ways of working, and proactively recommend new approaches or technology platforms that could be beneficial.




People




Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily.
Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn about the business of retail from other SMEs
Help others see the impacts of their efforts and proactively engage other functions to get input.
Encourage others to freely share their point of view and be open to feedback.




Cultural




Model Indigo‚Äôs beliefs and convey a positive image in everything you do
Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset
Take an active role in fostering a culture of continual learning, taking risks without the fear of making mistakes
Embrace, champion, and influence change through your team and/or the organization




SCOPE

Reports to: Manager, Data Engineering




Qualifications




Work Experience / Education / Certifications




Completed post-secondary education in a quantitative field or equivalent experience.
Demonstrated experience developing and deploying technical solutions to business problems
Strong SQL programming skills required
Experience with Snowflake is an asset
Experience with an ETL tool, preferably Azure Data Factory
Experience with Python is an asset
Experience with version control (e.g. Git) and collaboration on codebases




Competencies / Skills / Attributes




Process-oriented and strong organizational skills
Detail-oriented, with a strong ability to focus and work in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and understand solutions
Effective communication skills that include excellent written, oral, and presentation abilities
The ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and consider the business impact of decisions on diverse groups, influence others to achieve project goals often without direct authority.
Strong and timely decision-making abilities
Demonstrated time management skills, including the ability to adhere to schedules and manage processes; the ability to organize and prioritize work to manage timelines and to meet defined deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
Ability and enthusiasm to learn new technologies




Additional information




At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, customers, and each other; we can make a positive impact together. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2+ and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at Support-HR@indigo.ca if you need an accommodation during the recruitment process.




WELCOME HOME
