The Data Engineer is responsible for continuously developing and improving data engineering initiatives that support critical business processes. Reporting to the Manager of Data Engineering, this role leverages data engineering to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of various teams across Indigo and maintains rigorous data best practices.


KEY PERFORMANCE METRICS


  • Demonstrated improvement of data-focused business processes
  • Improvements in the quality and accuracy of business data domains
  • Work independently in managing own deliverables
  • Collaboration with internal partners to drive data literacy and understanding
  • Contribution to driving the overall data enablement strategy


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Functional


  • Create, manage, and optimize data solutions that support business processes such as product recommendations, store and digital operations, performance marketing, and loyalty projects.
  • Create and manage data products predominantly written in SQL and Python that enable the consumption of data from systems and transform them into standardized domains in our Data Warehouse
  • Collaborate across the organization to seek opportunities to leverage data and data engineering to improve our business outcomes.
  • Act as an advocate for the customer by placing them at the forefront of all design and decision-making processes.
  • Challenge the status quo and consistently identify areas for improvement, diagnose issues, and work to resolve them.
  • Contribute to designing and implementing team best practices for development workflows and data governance.
  • Have the ability to navigate ambiguity to progress with projects effectively
  • Exhibit strong decision-making and problem-solving skills that align with our team‚Äôs best practice.
  • Have a mindset of continually improving our solutions and ways of working, and proactively recommend new approaches or technology platforms that could be beneficial.


People


  • Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily.
  • Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn about the business of retail from other SMEs
  • Help others see the impacts of their efforts and proactively engage other functions to get input.
  • Encourage others to freely share their point of view and be open to feedback.


Cultural


  • Model Indigo‚Äôs beliefs and convey a positive image in everything you do
  • Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset
  • Take an active role in fostering a culture of continual learning, taking risks without the fear of making mistakes
  • Embrace, champion, and influence change through your team and/or the organization


SCOPE

Reports to: Manager, Data Engineering


Qualifications


Work Experience / Education / Certifications


  • Completed post-secondary education in a quantitative field or equivalent experience.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and deploying technical solutions to business problems
  • Strong SQL programming skills required
  • Experience with Snowflake is an asset
  • Experience with an ETL tool, preferably Azure Data Factory
  • Experience with Python is an asset
  • Experience with version control (e.g. Git) and collaboration on codebases


Competencies / Skills / Attributes


  • Process-oriented and strong organizational skills
  • Detail-oriented, with a strong ability to focus and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and understand solutions
  • Effective communication skills that include excellent written, oral, and presentation abilities
  • The ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and consider the business impact of decisions on diverse groups, influence others to achieve project goals often without direct authority.
  • Strong and timely decision-making abilities
  • Demonstrated time management skills, including the ability to adhere to schedules and manage processes; the ability to organize and prioritize work to manage timelines and to meet defined deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
  • Ability and enthusiasm to learn new technologies


Additional information


At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, customers, and each other; we can make a positive impact together. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2+ and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at Support-HR@indigo.ca if you need an accommodation during the recruitment process.


WELCOME HOME

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You‚Äôve come to the right place!

Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsR√©alis. AtkinsR√©alis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

AtkinsR√©alis' Major Projects division is in search of a Data & Reporting Analyst to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Toronto.‚ÄØThe Data & Reporting Analyst role will be part of a high-performing project team that is dedicated to delivering this complex undertaking through collaboration and a best-for-project vision.‚ÄØ

This position is a fulltime contractual role for a 6 month term based in Toronto.

Your Role Within The Team


Develop and implement Data process maps and project-specific workflows and processes.
Collect data from multiple sources, such as databases, APIs, or external systems and create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data insights clearly and effectively using Power BI, Excel, VBA, Power Automate and SharePoint.
Manage large datasets and ensure the proper storage and retrieval processes are in place.
Transform data into a structured format suitable for analysis, applying necessary formatting or aggregation techniques.
Work closely with team members to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks.
Manage IT requirements with parent companies and ensure IT issues are resolved in a timely manner.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports, including providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing, as well as training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of Construction tools such as Procore, Aconex, Oracle P6 would be an asset.


Why choose AtkinsR√©alis as an employer?

Because We Offer


The opportunity to work on an innovative and award-winning project.
An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
Competitive compensation package.
A work environment focused on health and safety.


The Ideal Candidate


2 - 4 years of analytics or data visualization experience
Experience with industry standard reporting tools including Power BI, Excel, VBA, Power Automate and SharePoint.
Experience with data quality assurance processes, methodology and tools, quality assurance testing and implementation methods and practices to ensure the integrity of data and to identify data inefficiencies.
Expertise in data collection/management techniques and interpretation of data to determine requirements, retrieve, analyze, deliver insights and recommendations.
General understanding of program controls disciplines including schedule, cost, risk, and scope management and the associated performance metrics.
Flexibility to work at least 3 times per week on-site.


Are you up for this challenge? Apply today and join our team to help engineer a Better Future for our Planet and its People.

At AtkinsR√©alis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

AtkinsR√©alis cares about your privacy. AtkinsR√©alis and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of AtkinsR√©alis (referred to throughout as ‚ÄúAtkinsR√©alis‚Äù) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to AtkinsR√©alis, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about AtkinsR√©alis‚Äô accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are¬†

Talize is a proudly Canadian owned and operated for-profit thrift retailer.¬† At Talize, we aspire to challenge boundaries and make fashion sustainable, unique, and affordable ‚Äì we recognize the importance of shopping sustainably.¬† We‚Äôre passionate about sustainable fashion because we know we‚Äôre helping the planet at the same time as providing our customers with amazing value!¬† That means offering unbeatable prices on brand names, designer fashions, accessories, leather goods, footwear, housewares, book, toys and more ‚Äì all while contributing to the health and sustainability of our planet.

At Talize, you'll be serving the community by helping them lead a more sustainable lifestyle.¬† A place with unlimited opportunities to learn and grow while unleashing your highest potential each day.¬† You'll be part of a ‚Äúpeople and customer first‚Äù culture; a workplace that is fun, fast paced, collaborative, diverse and inclusive.¬† We provide a productive work environment, where every perspective is valued.¬† Talize also takes a holistic approach for providing great benefits and rewarding employees.

¬†

Who You Are¬†

The ideal candidate is proactive, agile, and business savvy individual who is committed to getting better everyday. ¬†You are a passionate influencer with strong communication skills, who is open to giving and receiving feedback.¬† You are customer-centric with an ability to act as a mentor amongst your peers.¬† Of course, you also deliver consistent results by aligning yourself with Talize‚Äôs values.¬†¬†

The Role

¬†

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Insights Analyst to join our retail team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing retail data, generating actionable insights, and supporting business decision-making. This role requires expertise in data analysis, visualization (Tableau), and ad-hoc reporting to drive strategic initiatives and optimize retail performance.

Work Location: Its an onsite role located at 67 Alexdon Road, Unit A, North York, ON M3J 2B5

Salary: $60,000 - $65000 PA

Duties and Responsibilities

Departmental Duties

¬†

Data Analysis & Insights Generation:


Analyze sales, inventory, customer behavior, and operational data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.
Develop and deliver actionable insights that support business strategies and improve retail performance.
Conduct deep-dive analysis to evaluate promotion effectiveness
Interpret complex data sets and translate them into meaningful business recommendations.


Reporting & Visualization:


Create and maintain Tableau dashboards and reports to provide real-time visibility into key business metrics.
Automate and optimize reporting processes to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Collaborate with business teams to design reports that meet stakeholder needs.


Ad-Hoc Analysis & Business Support:


Perform ad-hoc data analysis to answer business questions and provide insights on specific challenges.
Support cross-functional teams, including marketing and operations, with data-driven recommendations.
Work closely with IT and data teams to ensure data integrity, quality, and consistency.


Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:


Partner with business leaders to understand strategic objectives and data needs.
Continuously identify opportunities to improve data analysis methodologies, reporting tools, and processes.
Stay updated on retail industry trends, consumer behaviors, and analytics best practices.


Core Competencies


Communication: effective verbal and written communication skills are crucial for conveying ideas, collaborating with colleagues, and presenting information clearly.
Adaptability: the ability to quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.
Problem Solving: the capacity to identify challenges, analyze them, and develop practical solutions.
Time Management: efficiently managing one's own time and tasks to meet deadlines and goals.
Teamwork: collaborating with others, valuing diversity of perspectives, and contributing to group success.
Technical Proficiency: proficiency in the necessary tools, software, and equipment relevant to the individual's role.
Critical Thinking: the ability to evaluate information and make informed decisions based on evidence and logic.
Self-Motivation: taking initiative and being proactive in pursuing personal and professional development.
Emotional Intelligence: understanding and managing one's emotions and effectively relating to others in the workplace.
Ethical and Professional Behavior: demonstrating integrity, honesty, and professionalism in all interactions.


¬†

Education, Experience and Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's Degree¬†in¬†Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Science
Proficiency in SQL and database management;
Strong expertise in Tableau
Strong SQL skills
Expert ability in Excel required.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in deep dive analysis of retail data (transactional, product, customer level data)
At least 2 years of experience


Physical Requirements and work environment:

Physical Requirements:


Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Ability to concentrate and analyze data for extended periods of time.


Work Environment:


Primarily office-based on-site work environment for increased collaboration and teamwork.
Fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with frequent collaboration across departments.
Regular use of analytics platforms, dashboards, and business intelligence tools.
May occasionally require attendance at meetings or presentations outside standard working hours.
Open office or virtual team setting with regular interaction via video calls, emails, and chat platforms.


Talize is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment, where all Team Members and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We thank you for your interest in employment opportunities at Talize.¬† Please note, only the candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.¬† Talize welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.¬† Accommodations are availabl
e on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Who We Are 

Talize is a proudly Canadian owned and operated for-profit thrift retailer.  At Talize, we aspire to challenge boundaries and make fashion sustainable, unique, and affordable ‚Äì we recognize the importance of shopping sustainably.  We‚Äôre passionate about sustainable fashion because we know we‚Äôre helping the planet at the same time as providing our customers with amazing value!  That means offering unbeatable prices on brand names, designer fashions, accessories, leather goods, footwear, housewares, book, toys and more ‚Äì all while contributing to the health and sustainability of our planet.

At Talize, you'll be serving the community by helping them lead a more sustainable lifestyle.  A place with unlimited opportunities to learn and grow while unleashing your highest potential each day.  You'll be part of a ‚Äúpeople and customer first‚Äù culture; a workplace that is fun, fast paced, collaborative, diverse and inclusive.  We provide a productive work environment, where every perspective is valued.  Talize also takes a holistic approach for providing great benefits and rewarding employees.

 

Who You Are 

The ideal candidate is proactive, agile, and business savvy individual who is committed to getting better everyday.  You are a passionate influencer with strong communication skills, who is open to giving and receiving feedback.  You are customer-centric with an ability to act as a mentor amongst your peers.  Of course, you also deliver consistent results by aligning yourself with Talize‚Äôs values.  

The Role

 

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Insights Analyst to join our retail team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing retail data, generating actionable insights, and supporting business decision-making. This role requires expertise in data analysis, visualization (Tableau), and ad-hoc reporting to drive strategic initiatives and optimize retail performance.

Work Location: Its an onsite role located at 67 Alexdon Road, Unit A, North York, ON M3J 2B5

Salary: $60,000 - $65000 PA

Duties and Responsibilities

Departmental Duties

 

Data Analysis & Insights Generation:

  • Analyze sales, inventory, customer behavior, and operational data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.
  • Develop and deliver actionable insights that support business strategies and improve retail performance.
  • Conduct deep-dive analysis to evaluate promotion effectiveness
  • Interpret complex data sets and translate them into meaningful business recommendations.

Reporting & Visualization:

  • Create and maintain Tableau dashboards and reports to provide real-time visibility into key business metrics.
  • Automate and optimize reporting processes to improve efficiency and accuracy.
  • Collaborate with business teams to design reports that meet stakeholder needs.

Ad-Hoc Analysis & Business Support:

  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis to answer business questions and provide insights on specific challenges.
  • Support cross-functional teams, including marketing and operations, with data-driven recommendations.
  • Work closely with IT and data teams to ensure data integrity, quality, and consistency.

Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:

  • Partner with business leaders to understand strategic objectives and data needs.
  • Continuously identify opportunities to improve data analysis methodologies, reporting tools, and processes.
  • Stay updated on retail industry trends, consumer behaviors, and analytics best practices.

Core Competencies

  • Communication: effective verbal and written communication skills are crucial for conveying ideas, collaborating with colleagues, and presenting information clearly.
  • Adaptability: the ability to quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.
  • Problem Solving: the capacity to identify challenges, analyze them, and develop practical solutions.
  • Time Management: efficiently managing one's own time and tasks to meet deadlines and goals.
  • Teamwork: collaborating with others, valuing diversity of perspectives, and contributing to group success.
  • Technical Proficiency: proficiency in the necessary tools, software, and equipment relevant to the individual's role.
  • Critical Thinking: the ability to evaluate information and make informed decisions based on evidence and logic.
  • Self-Motivation: taking initiative and being proactive in pursuing personal and professional development.
  • Emotional Intelligence: understanding and managing one's emotions and effectively relating to others in the workplace.
  • Ethical and Professional Behavior: demonstrating integrity, honesty, and professionalism in all interactions.

 

Education, Experience and Requirements

  • Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Science
  • Proficiency in SQL and database management;
  • Strong expertise in Tableau
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Expert ability in Excel required.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience in deep dive analysis of retail data (transactional, product, customer level data)
  • At least 2 years of experience

Physical Requirements and work environment:

Physical Requirements:

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Ability to concentrate and analyze data for extended periods of time.

Work Environment:

  • Primarily office-based on-site work environment for increased collaboration and teamwork.
  • Fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with frequent collaboration across departments.
  • Regular use of analytics platforms, dashboards, and business intelligence tools.
  • May occasionally require attendance at meetings or presentations outside standard working hours.
  • Open office or virtual team setting with regular interaction via video calls, emails, and chat platforms.

Talize is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment, where all Team Members and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We thank you for your interest in employment opportunities at Talize.  Please note, only the candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.  Talize welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are availabl
e on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so.

This Data Analyst position will support the Operations(Client Services, Back Office Administration, IT) teams at CI Financial by delivering insights that help optimize operational performance, effectiveness and efficiency. Reporting to the Director, Business Analytics & Insights, this individual will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting data to support strategic decisions that drive operational effectiveness and strengthen relationships with internal stakeholders. This role is ideal for a detail-oriented, data-driven individual who is passionate about using analytics to make a tangible impact on operational success.

Key Responsibilities


Data Collection and Analysis: Gather, organize, and analyze operational data related to process performance, resource utilization, and service delivery to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Performance Reporting: Develop and maintain regular operational reports and dashboards for operations leadership, focusing on process efficiency, resource allocation, and performance against key metrics.
Insights for Operational Efficiency: Provide data-driven insights on operational performance, helping to identify areas for improvement and optimize operational strategies.
Data Quality and Integrity: Work with the data engineering team to ensure data accuracy and integrity, performing regular data checks and troubleshooting discrepancies.
Ad Hoc Analysis: Perform ad hoc analyses as requested by the operations team or leadership to address specific questions, test hypotheses, and support strategic initiatives.


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related area.
Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or operations analytics, preferably within a financial services or B2B environment. Background in Client Services or Back Office administration an asset.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).
Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical skills, with a proven ability to interpret data and create actionable insights.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to data accuracy and ability to work with large data sets to ensure data quality.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and impactful way for business stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Proactive problem-solver with the ability to think critically and provide data-driven solutions.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in asset management or a related financial services field


CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through diverse financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees with a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile thrive at CI.

A Supportive Environment for Success

We offer an in-office environment, competitive benefits, and a supportive workplace to help our employees thrive both personally and professionally.

What We Offer


Modern HQ location within walking distance from Union Station
Training Reimbursement
Paid Professional Designations
Employee Savings Plan (ESP)
Corporate Discount Program
Enhanced group benefits
Parental Leave Top‚Äìup program
Paid time off for Volunteering


We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role and are not confident you meet all the qualification requirements, we encourage you to apply to investigate the opportunity further.

Please submit your resume in confidence by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù. Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (‚ÄúCI‚Äù) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, require this posting in an additional format, or require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-364-1145 ext. 4747.

Title: Associate, Infrastructure Investments
Description:
Fengate is a leading alternative investment manager focused on infrastructure, private equity and real estate strategies. In 2006, Fengate established its first infrastructure fund with a mandate to invest in infrastructure investments in Canada. Today, Fengate has invested in over 50 assets across the energy transition, digital, social and transportation infrastructure sectors in the United States and Canada.¬†¬†

¬†

As part of their strategy to grow the infrastructure investment platform, Fengate is seeking to hire an Associate to join their investment team in Toronto to expand their investment capabilities.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Support sourcing, bidding and closing investments and financings
Support managing development partnerships and platforms
Support fundraising and strategy
Analyze, structure, and execute investments and financings
Support diligence of new and management of existing development partnerships/platforms
Develop financial models, presentations and investment memos
Conduct financial analysis and research
Participate in internal and external meetings as part of the team



Requirements



KEY QUALIFICATIONS

Undergraduate degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering or a related field
Proficiency in financial modeling, Excel and other statistical packages
2+ years of cumulative work experience for an investment bank, infrastructure fund or project finance bank
Deal execution experience (acquisitions, debt and equity financings)
Strong understanding of project risk (development, construction and operation) and project documentation
Mid-market and development capital experience preferred but not required
Strong organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment
Ability to formally articulate and present data as requested



CORE COMPETENCIES

HTML:
Fengate is a leading alternative investment manager focused on infrastructure, private equity and real estate strategies. In 2006, Fengate established its first infrastructure fund with a mandate to invest in infrastructure investments in Canada. Today, Fengate has invested in over 50 assets across the energy transition, digital, social and transportation infrastructure sectors in the United States and Canada.  

 

As part of their strategy to grow the infrastructure investment platform, Fengate is seeking to hire an Associate to join their investment team in Toronto to expand their investment capabilities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support sourcing, bidding and closing investments and financings
  • Support managing development partnerships and platforms
  • Support fundraising and strategy
  • Analyze, structure, and execute investments and financings
  • Support diligence of new and management of existing development partnerships/platforms
  • Develop financial models, presentations and investment memos
  • Conduct financial analysis and research
  • Participate in internal and external meetings as part of the team


Requirements

KEY QUALIFICATIONS

  • Undergraduate degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering or a related field
  • Proficiency in financial modeling, Excel and other statistical packages
  • 2+ years of cumulative work experience for an investment bank, infrastructure fund or project finance bank
  • Deal execution experience (acquisitions, debt and equity financings)
  • Strong understanding of project risk (development, construction and operation) and project documentation
  • Mid-market and development capital experience preferred but not required
  • Strong organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment
  • Ability to formally articulate and present data as requested

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Being Authentic -Inspiring trust and being courageous.
  • Focusing on Performance -Being accountable and driving results
  • Understanding Stakeholders - Knowing the needs of those who rely on you.
  • Building Effective Relationships - Collaboration and communication.

Fengate is an equal opportunity employer, we strive to attract and retain a diverse workforce and are committed to promoting diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. It is a core priority at Fengate to create, operate with, and continuously grow and sustain an inclusive culture that respects and connects the diversity of our team, our clients, our partners, and the communities we work in. 

We are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position; however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so.

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join the Data Solutions team in the Wealth Technology group at CI Wealth. The Data Solutions team focuses on developing data-driven solutions, driving innovation, and uncovering key insights to support strategic initiatives. The successful candidate will play a key role in leveraging data to deliver solutions that enhance decision-making, streamline business processes, and support strategic objectives.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both data analysis and business processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Analyze and interpret large datasets to uncover key insights that drive business objectives.
Collaborate with stakeholders across teams to identify data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Develop and maintain data processes that enhance efficiency and support data-driven decision-making.
Document and maintain data mapping specifications and business rules to support data governance efforts.
Assist in building reports, dashboards, and analytics tools to monitor key metrics and trends.
Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and recommend data-driven improvements.
Respond to stakeholder inquiries and data requests in a timely and effective manner.
Partner with Data Engineers to support the successful implementation of solutions.


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Experience


2+ years of work experience in quantitative analysis.


Education/Training


Post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline.


Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details.
Solid understanding of data and data modeling.
In-depth knowledge and experience with the following tools:
Visualization e.g., Sigma, AWS Quicksight
Modelling e.g., MS Excel
Database system e.g., PostgreSQL, Snowflake
Cloud Technology e.g., AWS, Microsoft Azure
Strong knowledge and understanding of SQL
Working knowledge and understanding of Python.
A strong analytical mindset and sophisticated written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in the Financial Services Industry is an asset.
Ability to work within an organization based upon continuous improvement.


CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through diverse financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees with a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile thrive at CI.

A Supportive Environment for Success

We offer an in-office environment, competitive benefits, and a supportive workplace to help our employees thrive both personally and professionally.

What We Offer


Modern HQ location within walking distance from Union Station
Training Reimbursement
Paid Professional Designations
Employee Savings Plan (ESP)
Corporate Discount Program
Enhanced group benefits
Parental Leave Top‚Äìup program
Paid time off for Volunteering


We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role and are not confident you meet all the qualification requirements, we encourage you to apply to investigate the opportunity further.

Please submit your resume in confidence by clicking ‚ÄúApply‚Äù. Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (‚ÄúCI‚Äù) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, require this posting in an additional format, or require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-364-1145 ext. 4747.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Move Your Career Forward with DAC as a Reporting Analyst

Who We Are

We are DAC‚Äîa global full-funnel performance media agency dedicated to delivering transformative results. With expertise spanning SEO, paid media, creative production, analytics, and local optimization, we combine the brightest minds with innovative technology to deliver seamless, forward-thinking strategies. Powered by AI, data, and creative ingenuity, we deliver integrated campaigns that engage customers at every touchpoint‚Äîfrom global audiences to individual store locations.

Position Summary

The Reporting Analyst will support our Reporting Architect in building, optimizing, and maintaining modern reporting dashboards and data visualizations across a variety of platforms. The ideal candidate brings 3‚Äì5 years of experience in reporting, data visualization, and data architecture, with a strong focus on developing dashboards that answer business impact questions and uncover optimization opportunities. Experience working with cross-platform BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik is essential.

What You‚Äôll Do


Collaborate on the design and development of scalable business intelligence dashboards and reporting solutions
Build dashboards and reporting tools that clearly communicate business performance, impact, and areas for optimization
Translate reporting requirements into structured, well-documented solutions aligned with business goals
Work closely with internal stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met across various teams and clients
Establish and promote best practices for dashboard design, data visualization standards, and reporting workflows
Contribute to documentation, training, and presentation materials for both technical and non-technical audiences
Support quality assurance and validation of data across systems to ensure accurate and reliable reporting


What You Bring


3‚Äì5 years of hands-on experience in reporting, data visualization, and data architecture
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field
Strong experience with modern BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Looker Studio)
Proficient in SQL and working with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Deep understanding of data visualization best practices and user-centric dashboard design
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics, particularly in SEO/SEM contexts, is a plus
Bonus: Experience with HTML, CSS, or JavaScript/jQuery
Excellent attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset; comfortable working with cross-functional teams


What You‚Äôll Get


Professional Growth: Work with top-tier clients and cutting-edge tools in the performance marketing industry.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a global organization that values curiosity, transparency, and innovation.
Competitive Benefits:
Competitive salary and comprehensive health benefits.
Generous PTO, wellness initiatives and parental leave.
Retirement saving plans.
Opportunities for continued learning and professional development.
A supportive, collaborative, and casual work environment.

How We Work

This role requires two in-office days per week, with three days in-office during the three-month orientation period. Fully remote work is not available for this position.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. DAC is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, creed, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, provincial, or municipal law. If you require an accommodation in any aspect of the selection process, please reach out to tacquisition@dacgroup.com

Title: Business Analyst / Data Analyst (Capital Markets)
Description:
Iris's Fortune 100 direct client is looking Business Analyst / Data Analyst (Capital Markets). Please find below Job description and share me your updated resume at Jatin.gupta@irissoftware.com.







Position: Business Analyst / Data Analyst (Capital Markets)

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid, 3 days onsite in a week)

Design and develop sophisticated data models for trade data related to various financial instruments, ensuring alignment with business needs and regulatory requirements.
Work closely with the Director, Data and Architecture Services, Trade Data, to understand strategic objectives and contribute to the overall data architecture strategy.
Collaborate with business analysts, data engineers, and IT teams to gather requirements and translate business needs into technical specifications.
Create and maintain logical and physical data models, ensuring optimal performance and compliance with internal and external standards. ‚Ä¢ Ensure data models are flexible and scalable to support the introduction of new products and adapt to changes in market practices.
Manage metadata repositories and data dictionaries, promoting data quality and consistency across the organization. ‚Ä¢ Review data models with stakeholders, validating design decisions and ensuring data integrity.
Advise on data normalization, storage solutions, and efficient data retrieval methods. ‚Ä¢ Participate in data governance initiatives, supporting the development and enforcement of data policies and standards.
Stay abreast of industry trends, tools, and regulatory changes that impact data modeling and capital markets

Title: Portfolio and Data Analyst
Description:
Northleaf Capital Partners is offering the opportunity to gain experience using data and technology with a leading private markets investment firm as an Analyst (Data Focus), Portfolio Strategy & Analytics (PS&A). The PS&A team's mandate is to improve outcomes for our investors by conducting analytics and research that supports the portfolio construction and risk management of Northleaf‚Äôs private markets funds. As an extension of this, the team is also involved in new product development activities.




PS&A is a growing team with a high-performance and supportive culture. As the firm continues to grow, there is ample room for professional growth in the team. The successful candidate will gain direct insight into the workings of a global private markets investment firm with a specific focus on Northleaf‚Äôs private credit investment strategy.




The successful candidate will report to the Vice President, PS&A and will work with other members of the PS&A and peers from other functions to develop reporting and analysis that supports investment decision making, ongoing portfolio management and communication of insights to investors.




Northleaf is seeking a driven individual with a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience, ideally in a financial or professional services firm, working with and analyzing data to generate business insights.




Day to day, your role may include:

Collaborating with other members of the PS&A and Investor Relations teams, amongst others, to perform data analysis which supports internal decision-making and investor reporting requirements
Automating business processes across the private credit team and developing dashboards which service internal or external reporting needs
Analyzing Northleaf‚Äôs private credit investment portfolio and performance to develop insights that inform the portfolio strategy of existing and future investment funds
Performing quarterly reviews of private credit portfolios, including assessments of performance and risk trending, stress tests and forward-looking projections
Supporting broader organizational efforts to utilize cloud technologies to meet the current and forward-looking needs of the business
Working with internal data and third-party data services to conduct research which informs investment decisions or fundraising activities




Qualifications

Excellent academic credentials, including a university degree with a focus on a quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, engineering, business analytics, finance etc.)
High degree of technical proficiency - strong Excel skills and expertise in utilizing other analytical tools (e.g., Python, SQL) and data visualization tools (PowerBI or Tableau) are critical
Experience in applying these skills in an investment management context is desirable
Experience working with financial databases (e.g., Bloomberg, CapitalIQ, Preqin) is desirable, though not critical
Familiarity with cloud storage systems such as Google Cloud, AWS, and Azure is desirable, though not critical
Demonstrated interest in investing and financial markets
Excellent time management and organizational skills; ability to prioritize to manage tasks to completion within required timeframes effectively
Ability to work independently and in a team environment on multiple tasks with exceptional attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to liaise with all levels of individuals both internally and externally
Strong addition to Northleaf‚Äôs values of respect, integrity, collaboration, and professionalism




Location

Toronto, Canada.




Contact

Interested candidates are asked to apply on Northleaf Careers. Only those selected to be interviewed will be contacted.




Northleaf Capital Partners is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible candidate experience. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please do not hesitate to let us know and suitable arrangements will be made.




About Northleaf Capital Partners

Northleaf is a global private markets investment firm focused on mid-market companies and assets. With more than US$27 billion in capital commitments raised to date, Northleaf has an established, long-term track record as an investor in private equity, private credit and infrastructure globally.




Northleaf‚Äôs 275-person team, located in Toronto, Chicago, London, Los Angeles, Melbourne, Menlo Park, Montreal, New York, Seoul and Tokyo, is focused exclusively on sourcing, evaluating and managing private markets investments. Northleaf manages closed and open-end funds across a range of global private markets strategies and a series of separately managed accounts with customized investment strategies tailored to meet the specific needs of leading institutional investors and family offices. As part of its ambitious growth strategy, Northleaf is also developing specific private markets products and investment solutions for insurance and wealth management clients.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI/SQL Developer)
Description:
Choose a workplace that empowers your impact.

Join a global workplace where employees thrive. One that embraces diversity of thought, expertise and experience. A place where you can personalize your employee journey to be ‚Äî and deliver ‚Äî your best.

We are a purpose-driven, dynamic and sustainable pension plan. An industry leading global investor with teams in Toronto to London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. We embody the values of our 600,000+ members, placing their best interests at the heart of everything we do.

Join us to accelerate your growth & development, prioritize wellness, build connections, and support the communities where we live and work.

Don‚Äôt just work anywhere ‚Äî come build tomorrow together with us.

Know someone at OMERS or Oxford Properties? Great! If you're referred, have them submit your name through Workday first. Then, watch for a unique link in your email to apply.

We are seeking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Pension Products & Technology team in Toronto. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, leveraging tools such as Power BI, SQL, Python, and Excel to deliver advanced analytics, develop insightful dashboards, and create impactful reports that drive data-informed decisions. This is a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to work with cutting-edge data analytical tools while being part of a dynamic Pension Data team that fosters collaboration, encourages innovation, and supports professional growth.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Data Collection & Integration


Collect data from multiple sources, such as databases, APIs, or external systems.
Integrate data from various sources, ensuring that it‚Äôs accurate, consistent, and complete.
Manage large datasets and ensure the proper storage and retrieval processes are in place.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing
Clean and preprocess raw data to remove errors, inconsistencies, or duplicate entries.
Transform data into a structured format suitable for analysis, applying necessary formatting or aggregation techniques.
Validate data to ensure its accuracy and integrity before performing analysis.


Data Analysis & Interpretation


Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and relationships that can provide insights.
Use statistical methods and predictive models to address business problems and support decision-making.
Perform descriptive and exploratory analysis to understand key metrics and KPIs.
Reporting & Visualization
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data insights clearly and effectively using Power BI and Excel.
Automate recurring reports to improve efficiency and ensure timely delivery of insights.
Present findings to stakeholders with clear, actionable insights through reports and presentations.


Collaboration & Communication


Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, product teams, and development engineering teams, to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Translate complex data into understandable terms for non-technical stakeholders.
Work closely with team members to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks.


Continuous Learning and Improvement


Identify opportunities to improve existing data processes and analytical techniques.
Keep up with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis, visualization, and tools.
Experiment with new methods and tools to enhance the quality and speed of data analysis.


Data Governance & Quality Assurance


Ensure data security, privacy, and compliance with regulations during the collection and analysis process.
Implement processes for quality control to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
Monitor and audit data sources for consistency and potential issues over time.
Ad-Hoc SQL Query Development & Analysis
Develop SQL Queries & Conduct ad-hoc analysis to address immediate data requests and to provide urgent data insights.


Documentation & Knowledge Sharing


Document analysis methods, assumptions, and results for transparency and reproducibility.
Share insights and learnings with the broader team, contributing to a knowledge-sharing culture.


To Succeed In This Role, You Have


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
5 years of hands-on experience in Data analysis, Power BI development and SQL Query Development.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, Power BI Service, and Power BI Desktop.
Expertise in DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for creating measures, calculated columns and complex DAX expressions.
Must have experience building semantic data models in Power BI
Experience working with relational databases and data warehousing concepts.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for querying and transforming data.
A team player and motivated self-starter
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Experience with Azure Data Services (Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory)
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Strong Understanding of DB Pension Knowledge is an asset.


We believe that time together in the office is important for OMERS and Oxford, the strength of our employees, and the work we do for our pension members. In delivering on our pension promise, keeping us connected to our work and each other, our flexible hybrid work guideline requires teams to come in to the office 1+ days per week

As one of Canada‚Äôs largest defined benefit pension plans, our people-first culture is at its best when our workforce reflects the communities where we live and work ‚Äî and the members we proudly serve.

HTML:
Choose a workplace that empowers your impact.

Join a global workplace where employees thrive. One that embraces diversity of thought, expertise and experience. A place where you can personalize your employee journey to be ‚Äî and deliver ‚Äî your best.

We are a purpose-driven, dynamic and sustainable pension plan. An industry leading global investor with teams in Toronto to London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. We embody the values of our 600,000+ members, placing their best interests at the heart of everything we do.

Join us to accelerate your growth & development, prioritize wellness, build connections, and support the communities where we live and work.

Don‚Äôt just work anywhere ‚Äî come build tomorrow together with us.

Know someone at OMERS or Oxford Properties? Great! If you're referred, have them submit your name through Workday first. Then, watch for a unique link in your email to apply.

We are seeking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Pension Products & Technology team in Toronto. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, leveraging tools such as Power BI, SQL, Python, and Excel to deliver advanced analytics, develop insightful dashboards, and create impactful reports that drive data-informed decisions. This is a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to work with cutting-edge data analytical tools while being part of a dynamic Pension Data team that fosters collaboration, encourages innovation, and supports professional growth.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Data Collection & Integration

  • Collect data from multiple sources, such as databases, APIs, or external systems.
  • Integrate data from various sources, ensuring that it‚Äôs accurate, consistent, and complete.
  • Manage large datasets and ensure the proper storage and retrieval processes are in place.
  • Data Cleaning and Preprocessing
  • Clean and preprocess raw data to remove errors, inconsistencies, or duplicate entries.
  • Transform data into a structured format suitable for analysis, applying necessary formatting or aggregation techniques.
  • Validate data to ensure its accuracy and integrity before performing analysis.

Data Analysis & Interpretation

  • Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and relationships that can provide insights.
  • Use statistical methods and predictive models to address business problems and support decision-making.
  • Perform descriptive and exploratory analysis to understand key metrics and KPIs.
  • Reporting & Visualization
  • Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data insights clearly and effectively using Power BI and Excel.
  • Automate recurring reports to improve efficiency and ensure timely delivery of insights.
  • Present findings to stakeholders with clear, actionable insights through reports and presentations.

Collaboration & Communication

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, product teams, and development engineering teams, to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
  • Translate complex data into understandable terms for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Work closely with team members to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks.

Continuous Learning and Improvement

  • Identify opportunities to improve existing data processes and analytical techniques.
  • Keep up with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis, visualization, and tools.
  • Experiment with new methods and tools to enhance the quality and speed of data analysis.

Data Governance & Quality Assurance

  • Ensure data security, privacy, and compliance with regulations during the collection and analysis process.
  • Implement processes for quality control to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
  • Monitor and audit data sources for consistency and potential issues over time.
  • Ad-Hoc SQL Query Development & Analysis
  • Develop SQL Queries & Conduct ad-hoc analysis to address immediate data requests and to provide urgent data insights.

Documentation & Knowledge Sharing

  • Document analysis methods, assumptions, and results for transparency and reproducibility.
  • Share insights and learnings with the broader team, contributing to a knowledge-sharing culture.

To Succeed In This Role, You Have

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • 5 years of hands-on experience in Data analysis, Power BI development and SQL Query Development.
  • Strong proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, Power BI Service, and Power BI Desktop.
  • Expertise in DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for creating measures, calculated columns and complex DAX expressions.
  • Must have experience building semantic data models in Power BI
  • Experience working with relational databases and data warehousing concepts.
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python for querying and transforming data.
  • A team player and motivated self-starter
  • Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
  • Experience with Azure Data Services (Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory)
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
  • Strong Understanding of DB Pension Knowledge is an asset.

We believe that time together in the office is important for OMERS and Oxford, the strength of our employees, and the work we do for our pension members. In delivering on our pension promise, keeping us connected to our work and each other, our flexible hybrid work guideline requires teams to come in to the office 1+ days per week

As one of Canada‚Äôs largest defined benefit pension plans, our people-first culture is at its best when our workforce reflects the communities where we live and work ‚Äî and the members we proudly serve.

From hire to retire, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process that extends all the way through your employee experience. This sense of belonging and connection is cultivated up, down and across our global organization thanks to our vast network of Employee Resource Groups with executive leader sponsorship, our Purpose@Work committee and employee recognition programs.

Title: BI Advanced Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 423098

At Bell, our purpose is to advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world. We achieve this by providing consumers and businesses with the best network technologies in the world, innovative digital solutions and seamless customer experiences. It‚Äôs all developed and delivered by the members of #TeamBell and we‚Äôre always on the lookout for people with great skills and experiences.

We value diversity and provide a supportive, inclusive community where all team members can succeed. And through our commitment to environmental, social and governance initiatives, you will feel good about the greater impact you will have ‚Äì making every day better for people as they connect, work, learn and play.

Join us. You belong at Bell.

Summary

Bell is currently looking for a BI Developer, experienced in decision-making and can support the team in reporting execution and management. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to hone their leadership skills and support important business decision-making by working with new, cutting-edge decision-making technologies.

Key Responsibilities


Work in collaboration with Customer Analytics, Products, Pricing, Marketing Communications and IT channels to develop and execute end-to-end campaigns.
Actively contribute to the marketing planning cycle especially on loyalty campaigns.
Define and deliver business requirements by leading working sessions.
Evolve the reporting ecosystem to enable best-in-class marketing tactics.
Increase ability of Reporting team to deliver more, faster, better
Automate and improve recurring processes.
Analyze the best data sources and the design and logic of queries.
Data analysis - analyzing data to provide information on reporting opportunities.
Data mining - extracting data and identifying errors or gaps in data sources.
Define overall testing strategies and provide support all levels of testing and defect resolution.
Manage multiple concurrent projects and priorities.
Manage incoming data development or investigation requests and engage stakeholders to understand the underlying problem, base assumptions and desired outcomes.


Additional Requirements


Proactive Problem-Solving:‚ÄØIdentifies critical needs and takes decisive action to address them effectively and efficiently.
Innovation and Continuous Improvement:‚ÄØActively seeks and implements new ideas and innovative solutions, proactively exploring new areas and opportunities for growth.
Customer-Centric Approach:‚ÄØDemonstrates a deep understanding of customer needs, anticipating and exceeding expectations to drive customer satisfaction.
Analytical and Solution-Oriented:‚ÄØMasterfully applies systematic problem-solving methodologies to complex challenges, consistently delivering effective solutions.
Learning Agility and Continuous Development:‚ÄØProactively investigates mistakes, fosters a culture of learning from experience, and actively seeks opportunities to expand skills and responsibilities.
Mentorship and Collaboration:‚ÄØMentors and guides junior team members, fostering a collaborative environment of knowledge sharing and mutual support.


Critical Qualifications


3+ year hands-on experience with ETL development and design techniques
Advanced knowledge of SQL is required (3+ years experience)
Experience with SAS programming language and SAS Data Integration Studio
Experience with Teradata and SQL Server
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science and/or related fields or experience
Experience in gathering and analyzing system requirements
Knowledge of Data Marts, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts
Emphasis on development of high quality code focused on efficiency and the elimination of data integrity or quality issues.
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and competing priorities simultaneously and to work independently and as part of an extended team
Experience with Excel (tables and pivot tables)
Working knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide
Experience in direct and targeted marketing, including campaign list creation, and understanding of processes related to excluded numbers, the Canadian Anti-Spam Act (CASA) and contact strategy
Experience in technology companies and/or telecom networks is a strong asset
Experience developing cubes, complex reports and dashboards using MicroStrategy
Experience with Oracle, Teradata, ETL tools
Experience with Jira, Confluence
Bilingual (English/French)
Experience with data modeling
Knowledge of telecommunication sector
Proven project management and change management skills


#EmployeeReferralProgram

Adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information

Position Type: ManagementJob Status: Regular - Full TimeJob Location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : New Brunswick : Saint John || Canada : Nova Scotia : Halifax || Canada : Quebec : Montreal

Work Arrangement: Hybrid

Application Deadline: 04/22/2025

For work arrangements that are ‚ÄòHybrid‚Äô, successful candidates must be based in Canada and report to a set Bell office for a minimum of 3 days a week. Recognizing the importance of work-life balance, Bell offers flexibility in work hours based on the business needs.

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

We know that caring for our team members is at the heart of a healthy, positive and thriving workplace. As part of our team, you‚Äôll enjoy a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary and a wide range of benefits to support the well-being of you and your family. As soon as you join us, you'll be eligible for medical, dental, vision and mental health benefits that you can tailor to your specific needs. Plus, as a Bell team member, you'll enjoy a 35% discount on our services and access exclusive offers from our partners.

We value the experiences that have shaped who you are, and we know the diversity of your talent will bring even greater strength to our team. At Bell, everyone belongs and you‚Äôll feel valued, respected and supported as you grow and reach your full potential.

We also want to make sure that everyone has an equal opportunity to join our team. We encourage individuals who may require accommodations during the hiring process to let us know. For a confidential inquiry, email your recruiter or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions or feedback regarding accessibility at Bell, we invite you to complete the Accessibility feedback form or visit our Accessibility page for other ways to contact us.

Artificial intelligence may be used to assess parts of your application. Please review our privacy policy (see Phenom for details) to learn more about how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information.

Title: Analyst, Investment Banking, Real Estate - Toronto, ON
Description:
Requisition ID: 220980

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Analyst, Investment Banking, Real Estate - Toronto, ON

Global Banking and Markets

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) is a leading Canadian Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a growing platform in the US and Latin America, operating globally for over 100 years. Scotiabank‚Äôs strong U.S. presence provides our clients an important bridge to this key global market for trade and investment flows across the Americas and the world.

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Be part of an innovative, Global Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a unique geographic footprint that puts capital to work for our clients across industries! We work together to drive ambition for every future!

Overview

Analysts in Investment Banking enjoy a stimulating and challenging work environment in which they execute a broad range of transactions. A high degree of responsibility is afforded to those demonstrating initiative and the desire to take on such responsibility.

A significant amount of effort, diligence and initiative is required to properly execute assignments. The complexity of clients‚Äô financial requirements coupled with the intense competitiveness of the investment banking industry necessitates a full commitment to the task at hand. Standards are very high as most work is presented to senior executives at client firms and supervision is provided only to the extent that it is required.

With a limited hierarchy of professionals and a small project team approach, Analysts have ample opportunity for career growth and development. On any given project, Analysts will interact with other departments of the firm such as Corporate Banking, Equity Capital Markets, Global Fixed Income and Global Equity Derivatives gaining knowledge and understanding of both investment banking and the capital markets.

What You'll Do


Evaluating and analyzing the financial needs of corporate clients, including the development of financial models
Creating marketing materials and presentations
Supporting transaction structuring and execution efforts, with increasing levels of responsibility and accountability over time
Identifying and developing business opportunities with clients


Major Activities Include


Performing comprehensive financial statement analysis and create and maintain models
Collecting, consolidating and interpreting company and industry data
Financial and written analysis of companies within the real estate sector
Preparing client presentations, including compiling data and assembling presentation materials
Supporting drafting of prospectuses, related documentation and marketing materials for transactions
Applying product and capital markets knowledge to help clients achieve their financial objectives


What You'll Bring


1 - 2 years of work experience in Investment Banking, M&A, Accounting, Corporate Development or Financial Services preferred
Real estate sector experience and knowledge would be beneficial but not required
Bachelor or a Master‚Äôs Degree in Business, Math, Engineering, Science or something numerate would be beneficial
Proven record of outstanding achievement in academic and extracurricular activities
Strong quantitative skills focused on financial analysis, accounting and financial theory
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Suite, with an emphasis on Excel
Advanced knowledge of Bloomberg and FactSet product platforms
A high level of attention to detail
The ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work, excel under pressure amid demanding deadlines and perform effectively in a team environment
High professional standards including a strong sense of personal integrity and teamwork
Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt to new situations
A high level of energy and a keen desire to learn new concepts


Work Arrangement

This position is currently an in office role, with the expectation that you will work 4-5 days a week in the office. Please note that this is subject to change based on the needs of the business.

#CIB2025 #GBM2025

Interested?

If your experience is closely related but doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification, we do encourage you to apply - you might be the right candidate for this or other roles at Scotiabank!

At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That‚Äôs why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

What's in it for you?

Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work ‚Äì and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
